Job_description:
Le secteur des marketplaces cro√Æt deux fois plus rapidement que l'ensemble du eCommerce. La mission de Mirakl est simple : nous aidons plus de 350+ clients √† saisir cette opportunit√© en leur apportant la premi√®re solution SaaS de marketplace, une expertise in√©gal√©e et un √©cosyst√®me de vendeurs et de partenaires pour acc√©l√©rer le lancement et la croissance de leur marketplace.

Notre derni√®re lev√©e de fonds de 555 millions de dollars en s√©rie E valorise Mirakl √† plus de 3,5 milliards de dollars et nous place parmi les acteurs les plus dynamiques de l'eCommerce au niveau mondial.

Your impact:

The Business Intelligence team is the owner of customer data and insights at Mirakl, and acts as the main point of contact for anyone who needs insights about our customers, our products and the business as a whole.

We are on a journey to build a first-class department; enabling the entire company to easily discover, explore, and report on internal data in order to make data-driven decisions.

You will help shape the department and business as it grows, becoming a trusted partner and a source of authority for all things on data and analytics. Experience as Anaplan Model builder required.

What you'll do at Mirakl:

Your mission is organised with two pillars:

50% : Providing insights, dashboarding and mastering our BI datalake

Partner with teams across the business to understand their needs, challenge existing ideas and guide decision-making.
Produce relevant insights, actionable recommendations, with confidence and in a concise manner to drive product and customer strategy.
Build, maintain and continuously improve our reports and dashboards used by the business (currently Tableau).
Collaborate and share best practices and methodologies with the rest of the BI team and wider business.


50% : Model builder Anaplan¬Æ :

Working closely with the business teams and FP&A controller on the adoption and utilisation of Anaplan, including, but not limited to:
Headcount forecasting
Gross Merchandise Value forecasting
Annual salary review
Ensure the coherence/consistency between these processes/models
Adapt existing models as the business evolves
Support FP&A project team on major new projects (with Anaplan integrators)


Teams you'll closely interact with include:

The Customer Success team, which includes multiple disciplines covering onboarding, ongoing performance reviews and feature adoption.
The Connect team, on their mission to build a leading platform for sellers.
The FP&A team and all departments in the company involved in Anaplan processes.


What Mirakl is looking for in a candidate:

3+ years in a similar or related role (an e-commerce background is an advantage, but not essential).
Experience as Anaplan Model builder required
Proficient with SQL and Excel
Experience with one or more data-visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, QuickSight etc.)
Excellent written and spoken language skills in English and ability to work in a multi-cultural and multi-lingual environment.
Comfortable working with large datasets and are able to write complex and performant queries.
Comfortable working in a fast moving environment, managing several topics in parallel with different stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills to identify patterns and insights, and to propose actionable recommendations.
Have a natural curiosity and investigative mindset.


We welcome collaborators with their diverse perspectives and experiences to power us forward. These often far exceed conventional job requirements and help us create a culture of continuous learning. If you're ready to join a hyper-growth company at the heart of digital transformation for the world's most forward-thinking organizations, we strongly encourage you to apply to any of our roles, even if you think you're not an exact match.

Mirakl est engag√©e en faveur de la diversit√©, de l'√©galit√© des chances et de l'inclusion. Nous c√©l√©brons nos diff√©rences car nous sommes convaincus que les qualit√©s visibles et invisibles de chaque Mirakl Worker sont une source de force et d'innovation. Dans le cadre de cet engagement, nous √©tudions toutes les candidatures sans distinction de : genre, ethnicit√©, religion, orientation sexuelle, handicap, √¢ge ou toute autre caract√©ristique prot√©g√©e par la loi.

About Role




As a Business Analyst Intern you work daily on data analytics / strategy consulting tasks and projects related to mining and researching data, later on data optimization, cleaning, and finally on the interpretation and data visualization for clients and internal company needs.




Your mission:




Develop dashboards and descriptive analytics solutions for clients
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends
Take care of data integration and database management
Support and maintain existing BI solutions and resolve bugs as they arise
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses and informative, actionable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Collaborate with other teams to build valuable content using BI solutions




Your perks:




Access to very extensive educational resources and opportunities
Flexibility (work location, work from home)
Hi-tech and world-class working tools available also for personal use
Life-coaching & mentoring arranged by senior internal and external mentors
Team-buildings that are really different from ‚Äústandard‚Äù companies




Your superpowers:




Currently enrolled in a University degree (Bachelor/Master) or fresh graduate
Serious interest in data research, data science, consulting and finance audit
Your personality captivates with enthusiasm for innovation, curiosity and the courage to question facts and always double-check data
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with competing priorities and last-minute changes
Staying on top of all innovation-related news and leveraging your experience to conceptualize innovation strategies and methodologies
Business acumen and client‚Äôs focus
Basics and willing to improve skills in: Tableau, Power BI, Qlick




Your mission frame:




Type: Full Time/Part Time internship (40/30h per week)
Compensation: Non-paid / Students' scholarships
Location: Remote
Duration: 3 Months, optional to be extended up to 6 months
Start: ASAP




The exact starting date of the internship can be flexible after successful interviews and agreement.




This is a Remote (work from home) position.




Note: Due to the high number of applications we receive, we will only respond to applications that match our criteria and expectations. Thank you for understanding.

Do you want to build a tastier future through cutting-edge technologies? We are looking for a mission-driven, creative, and committed Data Science Intern to join us ü¶Ü. Come and bring your skills to the table!

GOURMEY is one of Europe's leading cultivated meat companies with global ambitions. Our vision is to create sustainable cultivated meat delights directly from animal cells for a conscious generation. We believe in a world where succulence can share a table with a positive impact and that cutting-edge technology combined with culinary arts can help us get there.

From engineers, scientists to culinary experts, we‚Äôre building an international team that shares the same passion for positive change. Currently a team of 50 Gourmates, we have dozens of nationalities at the table! Our differences are our strengths and our common language is food.

At GOURMEY, you will report directly to Remy Kusters - GOURMEY‚Äôs Senior data scientist. The internship can start as early as June. The required length of the internship is 6 months.

What will you be responsible for?

As a Data Science intern, you will join our fast-moving team and support the Data and Discovery team on a large range of transverse projects

Writing data automation scripts and workflow automation for all the lab operations.
Support the R&D, scale-up, and manufacturing teams with automating data-intensive tasks and data analytics.
Work with Gourmey‚Äôs data management system to provide full traceability of all R&D, scale-up, and manufacturing operations.


Requirements

You are fully proficient in Python and have experience with SQL and JSON.
Currently enrolled in a master's program in data science or engineering.
Experience with scripting for data automation.
Bioinformatics experience is a plus.
You have excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly and in a structured way.
Be a reliable, agile, and quick-thinking member of our team.
You are fluent in English.


Benefits

You will join a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris, with a global ambition to build the future of food through cutting-edge technologies in an inclusive work environment valuing the importance of work-life balance, we offer:

‚Ç¨900-1,000 remuneration, depending on your previous experiences
An attractive company health insurance and work-life balance monitoring
Since we are all foodies, we also offer a great kitchen, daily meal vouchers, and fresh fruits and nuts delivered weekly.
Furthermore, we support sustainable transportation and offer extra compensation to those who cycle to work.


What is our recruitment process?

Inclusiveness is at the heart of everything we do at GOURMEY. By being transparent about each step of the process, and why we do things the way we do, we believe we can give all candidates a foretaste of GOURMEY‚Äôs culture.

During the process, you will meet some of your team members in different parts of the recruitment process which will look like this:

30mn call with Cl√©mence (our Head of People)
A remote case study in English to give you a taste of what we are working on at GOURMEY, during a 1h-call with R√©my
A last interview on-site (when possible) to meet part of the team and visit the labs & office

Giskard defends the vision of a Responsible AI that serves the economic performance of companies while respecting the rights of citizens. To embody this mission, Giskard enables AI professionals (Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers) to collaborate with business teams to evaluate & test the quality of AI models.

We are building the first collaborative & open-source Quality Assurance platform for *all* AI models. We already empower customers with two solutions:

AI Inspect helps explain AI models to identify risks of errors & biases. It makes the AI development process more efficient, saving time & reducing friction between AI & business teams.
AI Test allows building automated tests on AI models to ensure ethics, robustness & efficiency. Thanks to these tests, businesses can prevent the risks of costly AI incidents in production.


We recently raised our first round of 1.5 million euros, led by Elaia, with participation from Bessemer Venture Partners and notable angel investors. To read more about this fundraising and how it will accelerate our growth, you can read our announcement.

As a Data scientist intern, you will:

Design & develop core ML products: Computer Vision & Time Series inspection & testing
Produce data science content: papers, conferences, blog articles, etc.
Conduct our technological watch: testing of tools for quality in ML
Be at the forefront of the Responsible AI new wave of innovation


Requirements

We are looking for end-of-year internships leading to a full-time hire. For now, we are hiring only interns enrolled in French universities.

Skills

You are in a Data Science Master degree or Bachelor degree
Strong skills in the Python data science stack, especially with pandas, scikit-learn, tensorflow, torch, and transformers
You have some skills in software engineering (use of Git, etc.)
Technical and non-technical writing skills in English


About You

Passionate about building robust solutions to real-life problems
Driven by customer needs & outstanding user experience
Willing to build a real product and see it being used by customers
Hungry for learning new skills every day
Conscious about technology's role in our society
Empathetic team player


Recruitment process

You can get an offer with salary & equity in 3 weeks üöÄ

Fit interview: 15 minutes
Tech exercise: 10 days to complete
Tech interview: 45 minutes
Reference call: 1 person
Final interview: 45 minutes


Benefits

We value diversity, equity, and inclusivity. Giskard is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran, or disability status.

We are remote-flex. We value productivity and work/life balance. You can come to our office at Station F on a weekly basis if you live around Paris. You can also work remotely and come to the office on a monthly basis.

After internship, full-time employees are granted a significant equity package. We want to include everyone in the adventure and make it a collective win.

Salary: between 1500‚Ç¨ and 1800‚Ç¨ / month

Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare and Spotify founders.

But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

Role And Missions‚ÄîWhat You Will Do üöÄ

You will join our Data team composed of 10 people. Working alongside our Analytics & Data Science experts, you will support them in the implement of new projects. More concretely, you will:

Analyze large and complex data sets representing the behavior of millions online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions;
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from games and monetization data to shape features, game economies and future product roadmaps;
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business requirements, work with cross-functional data and operational teams to design and implement efficient and scalable analytics and reporting solutions;
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics and player‚Äôs experience.


Requirements

If you‚Äôre creative, ambitious, and up for taking over the industry, we want you on our team.

Your are preparing a Master Degree (Business School, Engineering School or MSc in a quantitative field)
You ideally have a prevous professional experience with a data first company (e-commerce, tech, gaming, etc.)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Python and SQL
Passion/Experience in gaming
Experience with Tableau or equivalent is an advantage
Fluent in English


Our Culture‚ÄîWho We Areü™ê

At Homa, we value brains over backgrounds and determination over degrees. We believe actual growth results from diversity ‚Äî nationalities, backgrounds, skill sets, and personal experiences ‚Äî all working towards a single objective. If you‚Äôve got the smarts, energy, and motivation, no barriers keep you from going far.

We are the people behind the platform - the creative specialists giving creators the data needed to power up their creativity. At Homa, we live by the three central values:

Ambition: we put flags on summits. We set our goals ambitiously high and don‚Äôt shy away from the climb. We‚Äôre on a mission to take over an industry thick with incumbents who won‚Äôt go quietly into the night. To succeed here, you‚Äôll need a highly metaphorical shield and a sword.
Humility: we put our egos aside. We put our hands up. First to volunteer to help, second to high-five. Having an ego is natural, but letting it run the show is unhelpful to everyone. In the words of Mr. Lamar: Sit down. Be humble.
Curiosity: we keep our eyes open. We believe the best way to know anything is to question everything. And to do that, you need open eyes and open minds at all times.


Benefits
Success is its own reward, but here are the perks as well.
You‚Äôll be working with top tier talent from 34+ countries
If you‚Äôre interested in working from our newly-renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we‚Äôve got a desk right here‚Ä¶
You‚Äôll have two annual reviews, meaning you‚Äôll have two chances a year to prove you should be earning more.
Don't speak French and don't want to learn it? Pas de probl√®me, we work in English.
See the world via team events + workation (the infamous company-wide Homa trip).
We have a culture of continuous learning, supporting knowledge sharing & experience gaining through our learning platform.
Essential benefits in France and specific locations: health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidy, child-care benefits, and life insurance.

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Data Analyst Marketing Intern (F/M/D)

6 months internship, starting in September, based in Paris

About The Role

You will be part of the global Performance marketing team and be responsible for reporting and monitoring the activity. As a Data Analyst intern, you will ensure that we have the right tools to steer and report. You'll be in charge of Affiliation data health! Using data analytics, you will support strategic decision making for business growth, working hand in hand with global functions, the regional teams and the data teams. You are entrepreneurial, a self-starter, comfortable both working independently as well as collaborating across teams. You are keen to dive headfirst into a fast-growing, global fashion tech business!

What You'll Do

Build and improve existing dashboard and reporting tools to help channel managers monitor their channel in the best way possible.
Automatize reporting & recurring reports.
Set up alerts to flag changes in reporting, highlighting data issues and changes in trends.
Set up new processes to automate data sends between numerous sources ensuring reporting is up to date and accurate.
Ensure all affiliate data is mapped correctly against each publisher and the wider channel to enable more accurate steering decisions.
Collaborate closely with the Marketing Intelligence team to support fixing open data issues.


Who You Are

Master's degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Digital Marketing.
Advanced proficiency in Excel and SQL.
Experience with a data visualization tool is a good plus (Tableau, Google Studio‚Ä¶).
Demonstrate an ability to understand performance and be able to identify opportunities.
Be structured, organized, motivated by a growing fast-paced team.
Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others.
If you know how to code in python that's also a plus!
Fluent in English (French is not required).


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
Hybrid working: working from the office 3-4 days per week
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package
As a full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to receive VC's shares.


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer.

Job_description:
About Us




The Est√©e Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world‚Äôs leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance and hair care products. The company‚Äôs products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Est√©e Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, M¬∑A¬∑C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD BEAUTY, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Fr√©d√©ric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, and the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD.




At Too Faced, we believe makeup is power, giving women the freedom to express themselves and the confidence to take on the world. Makeup is so much more than a little color on your face. It's a mood booster and a powerful ally. So be a star, shimmer it up and take over the world! We are here to give you the tools to create your own looks, find what you love and own your pretty. Too Faced is looking for a new intern starting may 2023 for 6 months.




About Your Responsibilities




You will be supporting the Too Faced EMEA regional team on sales administration missions.




Your main mission will be to extract and centralize data received by retailers and communicate it to the rest of the Too faced team. You will do so by filling weekly and monthly reports on performances, and collect any comments the commercial team may have to cascade to management.




You will also be responsible for handling all ‚Äòno charge orders‚Äô, i.e place orders for any free products to send retailers, stores or team, whether from the warehouse through affiliates or from the office.




You will have additional sales administration responsibilities such a translation review, presentation support, database maintenance, accounting support etc.




See Detailed But Non Exhaustive List Of Tasks Below




Data Analysis:
Weekly and monthly retail sales/sell through analysis
Extraction from retailer‚Äôs data
Synthetization
Centralization in internal dashboards
Collection of comments from field team, synthetization and communication to broader team
Orders:
No charge orders
Collection of orders from team
Conversion into internal order form and communication with affiliate
Tracking of order delivery and budget
Office order
Placement of weekly office order
Distribution of products to team members
Shipment of products to retailer‚Äôs contacts/outside employees
Database management:
Management of internal product database (maintaining right product status etc)
Price communication to affiliates
Retail sales communication to affiliates and sanitization check of system
Accounting:
Maintain expense tracker
Communicate monthly expenses to affiliates




An internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory.




Qualifications




About you:




Required Language Proficiency: English and French fluent




available for a 4 to 6 months internship




Benefits




Located in Neuilly-sur-Seine




International environment with over 40 nationalities in the office




up to 10 days a month of remote working




10 days of remote working in the EU within your internship framework




Conciergerie (corporate store, gym center, beauty salon)




A gift bag of products at the end of your internship




A meal voucher card

Job_title: Junior Data Analyst (Remote Internship ‚Äì Data Analysis)
Job_description:
LOCATION: Remote Work




SCHEDULE: Part-time




Are you an aspiring data analyst seeking an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience while working with a prestigious Management Consulting firm? TalentKompass Deutschland, a leading Human Resources company based in Germany, is searching for a highly motivated Data Analysis Intern to join our esteemed client. This remote position offers a unique chance for someone who is passionate about data analysis and eager to learn in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.




As a Data Analysis Intern, you will work closely with the analytics and consulting teams, where you will be responsible for a range of tasks, including data collection, data cleaning, and statistical analysis. You will have the extraordinary opportunity to learn from experienced professionals who will provide mentorship and guidance throughout the internship. With this internship, you will gain valuable experience in data analysis, data visualization, and teamwork ‚Äì all essential skills for a successful career in this field.




Responsibilities:




Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support consulting projects
Assist in the development of data models and statistical analysis to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data
Create data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Present findings and insights to the consulting team and contribute to project reports
Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas for data-driven solutions
Support the team with general administrative tasks as needed


Requirements:




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficient in Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Familiarity with data analysis principles and practices
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Knowledge of statistical analysis tools and techniques is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus


At TalentKompass Deutschland, we are committed to helping our interns develop their skills and reach their full potential. Our client is a reputable Management Consulting firm that will provide invaluable experience in a competitive industry. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to grow your career in data analysis ‚Äì apply now!

Job_description:
Our Company




As the world leader in alternative animal proteins, Innovafeed contributes to the construction of a sustainable food system by developing a pioneering and innovative industry: the breeding and processing of insects (Hermetia Illucens fly).




Our mission:




Dealing with global protein deficit by strengthening our food systems
To have a positive overall environmental impact based on circular economy and inspired by natural food chains;
To generate territorial economic dynamism : in order to feed and raise our larvaes, we are co-located with agro-industrial partners that provide us with co-products and low footprint energy





Incorporated in 2016, Innovafeed manufactures and sells 3 different insect-based products:




Insect protein for a more sustainable and qualitative aquaculture, especially for feeding salmon and trout üêü
Insect oil for feeding animals (like pig and poultry), in the context of sustainable farming respectful of animal welfare üê§
Insect feces used as an effective organic fertilizer üå±





In September of 2022, at Innovafeed, we raised US$ 250 million in Series D funding bringing the total cumulative financing to US$ 450 million. This capital will be used to further increase our production capacity in France through the further expansion of our Nesle site in the north of France, the world‚Äôs largest vertical insect farm.




To meet this challenge in the most eco-friendly way possible, we have set up a system of industrial symbiosis explained in this video: click here




The success of our project depends on a dynamic and talented team sharing the same values and driven by a common objective : to continue our development as a world leader in the animal nutrition market !




In order to support this scale-up, we are looking for new talents able to get deeply involved in our ambitious and dynamic company.




Are you willing to get involved in building a more natural and sustainable food system? Are you interested in biotechnology and sensitive to the problems of food scarcity? So, we think you are ready to be part of the InnovaFeed adventure !




Our recruitment process is objective, inclusive and fair. It‚Äôs very important for us to offer from the start a clear, smooth and constructive recruitment experience for each applicant.




Your missions




We are seeking a highly motivated Junior Data Engineer to join our team.




As a Junior data engineer, you will be responsible for supporting the design, development, and maintenance of our data infrastructure. You will ensure data quality and availability. You will work closely with operational teams (performance, production, quality) and data scientists to identify data needs, design data models and implement data pipelines.




More precisely, you will be in charge of :




Develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines
Collaborate with data scientists and process engineers to design and implement data models to better understand our insect meal production processes
Ensure data quality and consistency throughout the data pipeline
Identify and implement improvements to data infrastructure and processes
Monitor and maintain data infrastructure to ensure performance and availability
Keep up-to-date with industry trends and technologies in data engineering





At Innovafeed, we strongly believe that an efficient use of data is a key enabler for the industrialization of our production processes. As a junior data engineer, by leveraging data from out IoT sensors, automation and production systems, you will take a significant part in the acceleration of our industrial scale-up.




As part of our technology stack, you will work with state-of-the-art tools including Snowflake, Matillion, Power BI and Databricks.




Your profile and skills




You have a master degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and a first experience in data engineering (internships included)
You have experience with SQL and relation databases and are familiar with programming languages such as Python, Java etc.. (throughout student projects or internships)
You are able to work in a team environment and to communicate effectively with technical and non technical stakeholders
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and are Fluent in French and English





Perks of joining Innovafeed




A customized on-boarding process to discover our business through an operator training and the role of each team through dedicated presentations ;
A particular care in the follow-up of your integration via specific exchanges and a feedback report;
Alan's mutual insurance and provident fund for all;
An important involvement of the employees in the growth and construction of the company (working groups, surveys...);
An internal training program to allow you to develop
Industries: Transport, Logistique, Supply Chain et Stockage

Job_description:
Are you energized by solving tough business problems?




Do you have a passion to transform P&G's brand building while enabling better decision-making with cutting (e.g.




ranging from Data Science to Behavioral Science)?




If so, then a role in the Analytics and Insights organization is for you!




The Analytics & Insights career in P&G takes you across a breadth of experiences, on multiple P&G businesses,




likely in multiple countries, always with an international perspective, always fast-paced.




It is a unique opportunity to develop both the ever-more demanded Data Science skillset and the strategic




thinking needed to manage P&G business.




The most distinguishing traits of whom we hire in A&I are curiosity and mental agility to relentlessly learn more (esp. about business, but equally also psychology, mathematics, and coding): all we need is an eagerness to learn,




the rest we will develop, as we grow our talents from within.




YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G‚ÄôS SUCCESS:




Earn the role of trusted advisor to the Business Unit Leadership Team




Deliver regular insights, by using advanced analytics techniques, mining extremely large data sets (the hyped Big Data), and applying best-in-class algorithms developed with/by other Data Scientists, examples could be building models to propose possible scenarios and answer the toughest business questions of the leadership team, optimize algorithms in accuracy and performance to then recommend specific actions to your business partners, discover unknown truths by mining new data sets;
Develop closed-loop experimentation capabilities, to test and learn about key business questions;
Lead and improve the analytical program of your business unit, together with the other functions: design the data strategy for the business unit adopt the right platform and big data technologies.




Grow the organization‚Äôs knowledge and skills in the space of Data & Analytics:




Take from proof of concept to scaled capabilities the best innovative algorithms from your colleagues and operationalize best-in-class Data-science practice (e.g. cross validation and target shuffling) to all key models and algorithms;
Collaborate in a multi-functional team.




So, here‚Äôs your opportunity! Join Analytics & Insights and help us anticipate what consumers want and find out what they need.




Qualifications




Translatable Rich Text




YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:




Studying towards MSc in a quantitative field, e.g. Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Physical Sciences or Quantitative Social Science;
Ability to handle multiple priorities and you have either an entrepreneur or consultancy mindset and passion for business while technically (data) savvy;
Work experience or certification in SQL, Python and/or R;
Strong analytical skills, using multiple data sources, with the ability to query and analyze data;
Creativity, Innovation, Initiative, Follow-Through, Strong written and verbal communication;
Experience from school/work that demonstrates strong leadership through envisioning, direction setting, enrolling others and thinking/problem solving.




YOUR ADVANTAGES:




27 paid vacation days
13 RTT (out of which 5 are collective ones)
3 bridge days offered by the company
Profit sharing
Company saving plan with company contribution
Health mutual and insurance
Company support for 50% on public transports costs in Paris area or eco mobility support (eg. bike)
Tickets Restaurant card by Edenred (optional)
Company restaurant
Work from Home (2 to 3 days/week, depending on the job)
Conciergerie services on site
Gym room on site for free
Work Council offers & subsidies

Company Description




Numberly is recognized as one of the world's leading data marketing specialists with nearly 500 employees and 8 offices worldwide serving more than 500 blue-chip clients (L'Or√©al, P&G, Groupe Seb, HSBC...). By putting technology to work for brands and consumers, Numberly is at the heart of business growth and everyone's desire for more responsible and relevant marketing. Numberly leverages the latest advances in data processing, analysis, and media activation in a virtuous cycle of business competitiveness, enhanced privacy, and data protection.




Job Description




As a member of the Insights & Analytics team, you will perform consulting, modeling, and research on Numberly's client databases. The goal of this team is to improve customer knowledge in order to develop the best marketing strategies. You will be working with several types of big data: consumption, media reactions, navigation... You will work for all of our clients in various sectors: retail, banking, insurance, luxury, travel, food....




Examples of missions :




Analysis and understanding of the customer lifecycle and modeling of the customer Lifetime Value
Segmentation: buying behavior, browsing behavior
Behavior prediction scores: churn, lifetime moments, engagement
Analysis of the marketing levers and paths that maximize conversion
Modeling of declarative data via behavioral data




The methods used will be chosen according to the problem and in agreement with the trainee




Descriptive statistics
Typology of the database: ACM, ACP...
Segmentation of the database: CAH, neural networks...
Score : decision tree, logistic regression




5 to 6 months internship starting in June or July 2023.




Remuneration: 1300 ‚Ç¨ gross monthly in M1 (internship), 1600 ‚Ç¨ in M2 (internship).




Qualifications




You are a M1 or M2 graduate (engineering school, business school, university)
Knowledge in SQL, R, Python
Ability to fit in, autonomy and work capacity
Ability to question and problematize a study subject
Writing skills
Interest in marketing and the Internet
Sense of contact and strong motivation to work in an innovative environment (internet and mobile) within a young and international team




Additional Information




At Numberly, we share a passion for passing on information to both our teams and clients: weekly internal talks, meetings with professionals who are experts in their field, and ongoing learning.
Our onboarding is fast and powerful, thanks to the "Vis ma vie" (‚ÄúLive my life‚Äù in different teams) and the "Happy Meetings" (monthly internal get-togethers with all of our teams around the world to share the group's latest news).
We cultivate freedom of speech, which allows everyone to participate in the group's on-going development.
We positively impact our ecosystem through 1000mercis actions and activities that create value in the Open Internet; we contribute to the enrichment of the Open Source.
Numberly is a diversity player and Gender Equal by design (WeConnect International certification and a gender equity score of 97/100).
Numberly offers an international environment, hosting over 30 nationalities worldwide.
Other perks: offices that reflect each team, a generous library, a large fully equipped music studio, two cats, waste separation and worm composting, the ability to bring your pet, and room for bikes! In each kitchen: coffee, tea, infusions at will and also mystery lunches, yoga classes, sports classes and parties (often disguised).
Possibility to be remote up to 50% of your time (to be organized as you wish) and to work up to 60 consecutive days (working days) in remote locations in Europe
Swile card (meal vouchers).
Numberly welcomes people with disabilities.

Job_title: Climate Data Analyst - Intern (Asset Impact) | Paris or Berlin
Job_description:
Asset Impact is an impact-driven climate start-up.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Climate Data Analyst Intern to join our team. If you‚Äôre someone who is passionate about sustainable finance, embraces a start-up mentality, and is excited to take on new challenges, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. We offer the opportunity to contribute to the world of ESG data, learn about data analysis applied to sectors key to the climate transition, and experience the growth phase of a start-up.

Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility will be to assist the Asset Impact Data Team, with frequent interactions with the Product and Business teams. You will make direct contributions to the development of our data and analytics. Depending on your profile and interests, you will:

Research commercial and open-source physical asset data providers and data sources to help improve the coverage and quality of Asset Impact‚Äôs climate data.
Conduct quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) checks of our data and climate indicators.
Support the onboarding of raw data into Asset Impact‚Äôs proprietary database.
Support the development of new products, metrics and methodologies in collaboration with the Asset Impact Product Team (e.g. financed emissions, scenario analysis).
Analyze corporate, climate and financial data and prepare responses to clients‚Äô queries on Asset Impact‚Äôs data products.
Support the Data Team in any part of the Asset Impact data workflow.


Requirements

Experience summarizing technical information into concise texts for a general audience.
Knowledge of sustainability and sustainable finance.
Cleaning and analyzing data with code, and proficiency with R, or Python for data analysis and manipulation. Proficiency with SQL (or knowledge of relational databases) is a plus.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Fluency in English.


Mindset

Passion for sustainability and data.
Interest in learning about climate-critical sectors such as power generation, oil and gas extraction, transport, etc.
Desire to work in an international start-up.
Enthusiasm and motivation!


Benefits

A paid internship lasting 4-6 months with a potential transition to a full-time role.
An opportunity to work with and learn from an international team of data scientists, analysts, sustainable finance specialists, and‚ÄØdevelopers‚ÄØpassionate about the climate transition.
Exposure to the latest tools and methodologies in tech and sustainability.
A rapidly growing organization with a lot of opportunities to get hands-on experience, make your voice heard and help shape our future.
A mission that brings together technology and impact.
Flexibility in terms of working hours and location.
Offices in the centers of Paris and Berlin.


Application process

We are recruiting for this position on a rolling basis. Please apply through the link below. We want motivated candidates ‚Äì no need to tick all the skills and experience boxes! Phone interviews will be organized with shortlisted candidates.

We are looking for student interns (‚Äústage de fin d‚Äô√©tudes‚Äù) in France in our Paris office or working students (‚ÄúWerkstudierendenstatus‚Äù) in Germany in our Berlin office.

Asset Impact is proud to be an equal opportunity workspace.

Find out more at https://asset-impact.gresb.com/

About Us

Asset Impact (AI) is an impact-driven climate start-up. Our vision is of a financial system that sets the global economy on a path to net zero emissions. We are a specialist provider of climate data and analytics used by financial institutions to achieve emissions reductions in the real economy. Our asset-based data and analytics cover the most carbon-intensive sectors of the global economy and map more than 250,000 physical assets across nine industry sectors ‚Äì linked to more than 60,000 listed and private companies ‚Äì to issued securities.

Our clients, mostly financial institutions, include large global organizations such as the 1,000+ financial institutions applying the PACTA tool, Barclays for its BlueTrackTM tool, ING for its Terra climate approach, and PwC for its Climate Excellence Tool.

AI was established in 2018 in Paris, and works globally. We became part of GRESB, the leading ESG benchmark for real estate and infrastructure investments, in 2022 after spinning off from the 2¬∞ Investing Initiative, an innovative international think tank working to align financial markets with climate goals. We are expanding rapidly to support the growing needs of financial institutions as they embark on their journey to decarbonization.

Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare and Spotify founders.

But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

Meet the team üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüëß

You will join the Data department organized into:
A Data Platform Team with 5 Data Engineers who are ingesting large amounts of data from multiple different sources, creating and maintaining a core data model which aims at making data standardized, reliable and easily available
An Analytics & Data Science Team with 7 Data Analysts and Scientists exploiting our data for:
Game Analytics
User Acquisition and Marketing Analytics
Market Inteligence Analytics
Ops Analytics

Role and Missions ‚Äî What you will do üöÄ

As a Data Scientist focusing on user acquisition and marketing analytics, your role will be to partner with User Acquisition (UA) Managers to acquire the highest number of players on our games.

You will:

Lead the development of our "autobidder" solution which manages autonomously over $20m of yearly ad spend and will grow to $100m yearly
Build (yourself) global Life Time Value (LTV) predictive models which will enable us to quickly measure the performance of our marketing campaigns
Your experience will also allow you to help coach the Marketing Analytics Data and Data Science Team
Besides delivering data products, given our current size and ambition, you will play a key role in structuring our Data Science roles and how we structure Machine Learning projects.


Requirements

Preferred Experience‚ÄîWhat's your profile üëÄ

Having a strong experience in data, you want to join a diverse team composed of mobile gaming enthusiasts. If you recognize yourself in the following description, you're the one!

You have a strong education background with an MSc. in Statistics / Maths / Computer Science / Economy or other quantitative fields from a top university
You have at least 4 years of experience as a Data Scientist - including at least 2 years focusing on User Acquisition or in an Ad Tech company
If you know the Gaming Analytics world, it would be a great asset
We are looking for outstanding analytical skills and creative thinking
You have the ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations
SQL, Python (data wrangling and data visualization) and Tableau have no secret for you
We want a doer mindset as we are still a small team and need to do things outside of our job description when they can have an impact
We are keen if you have experience with descriptive and predictive modelling
You are absolutely fluent in English (interviews will be led in English).


Our Culture‚ÄîWho we areü™ê

At Homa, we are building a community of brilliant talents. We believe that true innovation comes from diversity and collaboration, and that's why we prioritize brainpower and determination over formal education. So if you have the talent, energy and motivation, there is no obstacle to your success here.

As the creative experts behind the platform, we provide developers with the data they need to bring their ideas to life. Our team lives by three central values that guide everything we do:

‚ú®Ambition: we're not afraid to tackle difficult challenges and set our goals extremely high. We're on a mission to revolutionize an industry dominated by well-established companies, and we won't stop until we succeed.

‚ú®Humility: we leave our pride & ego aside. We are always ready to lend a helping hand, celebrate each other's successes, and learn from our failures. As Mr. Lamar said, "Sit down. Be humble."

‚ú®Curiosity: we keep our minds open and never stop learning. We believe that questioning everything is the best way to stay ahead of the curve, and we encourage all our team members to stay curious and never stop exploring new ideas.

At Homa, you'll be challenged, supported, and inspired every day, and we can't wait to see what you bring to the table.

Benefits

Perks & Benefits üéÅ

While success is its own reward, here are some of the benefits that come with working at Homa:

We offer essential benefits in France and specific locations, including health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidies, childcare benefits, and life insurance
If you're interested in working from our newly renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we have a desk waiting for you
You will be working in English with our international team of top-tier talents from 35+ countries
You will have quarterly reviews with your manager to reflect on your performance, celebrate wins, and receive constructive feedback


You will be able to attend diverse team events and Workations (the famous company-wide Homa trip).

About L.E.K. Consulting

L.E.K. Consulting is a global strategy consulting firm that addresses the most critical commercial issues for the leaders of some of the world's most successful business es.

Clients come to us time and again because we are proven to act as an insightful expert and a trusted partner. We are uncompromising in our approach to help clients make better decisions at crucial moments, changing the trajectory of their enterprise, delivering improved business performance, and creating greater shareholder returns.

Our teams combine our core capabilities of research, benchmarking, modelling, data & analytics and strategy development to create game-changing insights and practical solutions that seize competitive advantage and unlock new growth opportunities. We enable clients to make critical decisions with greater certainty and empower them to master their moments of truth.

With more than 1,900 professionals located across five continents, L.E.K. specialises in Strategy and Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) support with clients across the full range of corporates and private equity. We are expert in a wide range of industries, including Life Sciences and healthcare, retail and consumer, financial services, industrials, energy and transportation.

Our global growth ambitions are huge. Be part of this growth.

https://www.lek.com/

What We Are Looking For

LEK Consulting is seeking a n E xecutive Assistant (EA). This is a great opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

The successful candidate requires the ability to organize and plan effectively, anticipate needs, think critically and proactively, and offer solutions with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.

This critical position will provide dedicated right arm support and sophisticated calendar management. Prioritize inquiries and calendar schedule, including coordination of virtual and in person meetings, while troubleshooting conflicts; make judgments and recommendations to ensure smooth day - to - day engagements. The EA will also act as the primary point of contact / liaison for external and internal stakeholders on all matters, including those of a highly confidential nature. The role is in paris.

Responsible for the agenda (+ monitor and manage incoming meetings)

-Update of contacts

-Registration of Partner time/allowances and expense reports
-Weekly business review / Partner

Archiving
Lunch orders Partners and/or Clients
Cab orders
Punctual help to foreign Assistants/Partners (hotel, Taxi, lunches, meetings)
Punctual help to the team on current project
3. Additional tasks 10% of the time
Support to the Business Travel of the office

Requirements

Very good level of English / fluent English
Reliability/Quality check rigorous
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Good knowledge of Salesforces and Pack office
Enthusiasm
Efficiency/Prioritization (80/20)
Excellent organization
Discretion and sense of confidentiality
Ability to manage complex profiles and agendas
Teamwork
Dynamism and proactivity
Punctuality

Job_description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse glojobbal team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Commercial Data & Insights Analyst Intern (F/M/D)

6 months internship, starting in September, based in Paris

About The Role

The Commercial team at Vestiaire Collective is in charge of customer strategy, CRM activations and marketing strategy, the Analytics team is charge of supporting the teams with their analytics needs.

Do you think that working in analytics is about much more than crunching numbers? Do you enjoy using data to find compelling insights and using your business skills to translate these insights into action? Join our team. You will report directly to the Head of Data and Insights ‚Äì Commercial, focusing on delivering actionable insights.

What You'll Do

Run weekly CRM campaigns and monitor their impact on the business
Support creation and maintenance of commercial measurement studies (e.g. GMV, CRM sending) and share findings to stakeholders to enable continuous improvements.
Work with cross functional teams to understand priorities and deliver insights and actions to improve CRM communications
Be the gatekeeper of high data quality and fidelity. This might involve setting processes to cross-check data, detect outliers, etc.
Conduct end to end ad hoc analysis to provide actionable insights (ex: understand what are the drivers of customers opting out of CRM communication, run A/B tests to understand which CRM copy perform better etc.)
Assist the team on performance monitoring, ad-hoc requests and presentations to measure the impact of key projects and identify new ones.


Who You Are

Currently doing a Master's degree in Economics, Business or Engineering.
Ideally you have already worked in data, operations or product positions in tech startups or consulting firms (strategy consulting, M&A, audit, digital marketing etc.).
You have a strong "get things done" mindset.
You have strong analytical skills: you pay close attention to details & ensure data accuracy.
You can give recommendations based on a structured reasoning, you are a fast learner and integrate feedback quickly.
You are a team-player and enjoy learning from others
Our working language is English, you must be comfortable communicating in English, French is a plus
It goes without saying you have a great knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint
SQL mandatory, Python knowledge is a plus
If you already had experience with Tableau or any other dashboarding tools (Power BI, Qlick view etc.) is also a big plus!


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
A flexible work possibility
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Job_description:
Summary

ABOUT SAINT LAURENT

Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury pr√™t-√†-porter in a 1966 collection called ‚ÄòRive Gauche‚Äô, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the socio-cultural landscape.
In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe.
Today, Saint Laurent collections include women‚Äôs and men‚Äôs ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.

Job Description

ROLE

Within the digital department, she/he will assist the business and merchandising analyst. This internship gives the opportunity to acquire a strong knowledge of various data tools and best practices to develop efficient reports for ecommerce business.

MISSIONS



Support the business analyst in the preparation of weekly/monthly standard reports and business review.



Participate to the weekly sales certification, verify sales data from GAS and Inventory Control are aligned.



Assist with the sales forecast and split by product/by country in collaboration with Finance HQ and Regions.



Help design, document system processes.



Ad-hoc analysis.





Merchandising



Prepare weekly/monthly merchandising analysis, present global digital business in merchandising point of view, (by collection, by point of sales, by collection etc) to the team.



Follow up closely the stock level and performance of permanent products in detail



Improve current reporting format and propose new reports



Help to prepare pre-showroom data analysis, (previous season buys, past season performance etc)





Internship to meet in July 2023.

PROFILE



Currently studying in a master‚Äôs degree (engineer/ Business School)



Previous internship experience in Finance or Business Intelligence/Data analysis



Knowledge of data analysis tool such as Tableau, Power BI, Anaplan is a plus (or eager to learn)



Analytical thinking and problem solving



Fluent in English, French is a plus





Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.

Job Type

Student (Fixed Term) (Trainee)

Start Date

2023-07-03

Schedule

Full time

Yves Saint Laurent SAS

Verkor is a French industrial company aiming to pioneer low-carbon battery manufacturing in France. With the backing of prominent industrial companies such as Renault Group, Plastic Omnium and Schneider Electric, Verkor intends to electrify the future of European mobility.




With over 320+ experts from 36 different countries, our endeavor is to unite exceptional global talent to bring this ambitious and innovative project to life. Our strong and agile international team continues to grow and adapt to new challenges. Based in Grenoble (France), we are currently establishing our Verkor Innovation Centre (R&D centre and 4.0 pilot line).




In the coming years, we will focus on building the world‚Äôs most modern and efficient Gigafactory in Dunkirk (France). With this facility, our ambition is an initial annual production of 16 Gwh of lithium-ion batteries by 2025, thus powering 300,000 electric vehicles annually.




In joining us you will actively participate in this breathtaking industrial adventure toshape the future of European mobility.




As part of the Operations department, you will participate in the design, improvement, and integration of optimization algorithms that contribute to developing operations system and improving the production performance:

Within the operations department, you will be responsible for:




Working with operational teams to understand their business

Identify the data needed for these evolutions and implement the flows
Improve the performance of the algorithms
Analyze the results and produce reports explaining them
Describe the approach and present it to operational teams
Integrate the model in a tool and in the process





Requirements




Engineering school preferred or IUT/DUT in Industrial / Data management field
Basic Battery knowledge is highly advantageous but not essential
Interest in working in the machinery industry
Strong will to learn and work as a team
Strong will to develop interpersonal relationships and versatile engineering skills
Proficiency in English is highly advantageous (& French mandatory)


Starting internship ASAP for 5-6-months




Possibility to continue or directly begin with an apprenticeship contract




English Application preferred

We're committed to transparent communication: we say what we think, and we mean what we say.

Everyone, in their role, is an ambassador for the company. At Verkor, success is most definitely a team sport!

For more info on the company, please visit us at www.verkor.com
Industries: Transport, Logistique, Supply Chain et Stockage

Description de l'entreprise

Nous avons d√©velopp√© des solutions bas√©es sur l‚ÄôIntelligence Artificielle et le design pour augmenter l‚Äôimpact de nos missions de conseil. Notre pr√©sence globale et notre expertise dans plus de 30 secteurs et services nous permettent d‚Äôaccompagner nos clients dans le monde entier. A travers notre d√©marche "Consulting for Good", nous mettons notre expertise au service des objectifs RSE de nos clients et faisons du d√©veloppement durable un levier de performance pour nos clients.




Description du poste




Pour accompagner son d√©veloppement, Sia Partners recrute des consultants data scientist avec une forte expertise en recherche op√©rationnelle.




Ils auront pour vocation de prendre en charge, en synergie avec nos diff√©rentes practices, les travaux et missions n√©cessitant la mise en ≈ìuvre de mod√®les complexes pour accompagner nos clients dans leurs probl√©matiques en lien avec :




Recherche op√©rationnelle : assistance √† la conception et √† la mise en ≈ìuvre de solutions d'optimisation lin√©aires sous contraintes et de mod√®les de simulation avanc√©s ;
Machine learning et statistiques : √©laboration de mod√®les explicatifs et pr√©dictifs d'aide √† la d√©cision (algorithmes d'apprentissage supervis√© et non supervis√©, √©conom√©trie, pr√©vision, diagnostic quantitatif, ...) ;
Big Data : connaissances algorithmiques pour le traitement de grand volume de donn√©es et non structur√©es.




Dans le cadre des activit√©s internes du cabinet, votre participation s‚Äôarticule autour des axes suivants:




Le d√©veloppement ou le renforcement de nos offres au travers de formations, de groupes de travail, de projets R&D, de diffusion de support internes et externes...
La politique de publication (blogs sectoriels, √©tudes, parution presse...)
Le d√©veloppement commercial en contribuant √† la d√©finition des besoins et en participant aux actions commerciales.
Qualifications




Vous avez une formation en Ecole d'Ing√©nieur ou une formation de haut niveau dans le domaine de la recherche op√©rationnelle, du traitement de l'information, de l'ing√©nierie statistique et de l'√©conom√©trie et vous justifiez id√©alement d'une premi√®re exp√©rience en Optimisation, Big Data ou Data Science (stage ou 1er emploi)




Vous avez un excellent niveau en math√©matiques appliqu√©es, statistiques et analyse quantitative (connaissances th√©oriques et pratiques, intuition, facilit√© √† comprendre des mod√®les et les appliquer)




Vous ma√Ætrisez la programmation en R (ou √©quivalent : SAS, Matlab‚Ä¶) et/ou poss√©dez des bases solides dans des langages de script (Python, Julia, Perl, JS, bash) ou compil√©s (C++, Java) et/ou avez une exp√©rience dans les environnements UNIX/LINUX.




Vous avez d√©j√† travaill√© avec des solveurs d‚Äôoptimisation et ma√Ætrisez leur configuration (CPLEX, Gurobi ou √©quivalent), vous √™tes √† l‚Äôaise avec les concepts de r√©solution de probl√®mes via la programmation dynamique, les heuristiques classiques d‚Äôoptimisation et l‚Äô√©laboration de m√©taheuristiques.




Vous souhaitez vous impliquer et prendre rapidement des responsabilit√©s sur des missions et projets interne de R&D √† forte valeur ajout√©e au sein d‚Äôune structure dynamique.




Vous √™tes dot√©(e) d‚Äôune capacit√© √† travailler en √©quipe, d‚Äôune ouverture d‚Äôesprit, d‚Äôun sens de l‚Äôanalyse et vous souhaitez rejoindre un environnement professionnel motivant o√π vous partagerez nos valeurs que sont l‚Äôexcellence, l‚Äôentrepreneuriat, l‚Äôinnovation, la culture du partage, la bienveillance, l‚Äô√©quilibre vie personnelle / vie professionnelle.




Fran√ßais, anglais professionnel courant indispensable.




Informations suppl√©mentaires




Pour plus d‚Äôinformation sur notre lab R&D et nos produits de Recherche Op√©rationnelle : https://www.sia-partners.com/fr/nos-expertises/optiwise




Pour plus d'information sur notre practice Data Science, consultez notre showroom de solutions IA: https://www.heka.ai/fr

Minimum Qualifications




Master's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
Having 2 years of work experience in a data analysis related field.
Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python, MATLAB, pandas) and database languages (e.g., SQL)




Preferred Qualifications




Having a Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline.
4 years of relevant work experience, including expertise with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, sampling methods.
Having applied experience with machine learning on large datasets.
Experience articulating and translating business questions and using statistical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data.
Demonstrated leadership and self-direction. Willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.
Demonstrated skills in selecting the right statistical tools given a data analysis problem. Effective written and verbal communication skills.




About The Job




As a Data Scientist, you will evaluate and improve LogicPlum's products. You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of scientists and analysts on a wide range of problems. This position will bring scientific rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of product creation, development, and improvement with an appreciation for the behaviors of the end-user.




LogicPlum is and always will be an artificial intelligence company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's most significant challenges and make a substantial impact on the businesses it supports. At LogicPlum, data scientists not only revolutionize practicality of solutions, they routinely work on the scalability of solutions, a variety of data problems, and entirely new methods of solving problems with our platforms. From tabular data to image data, text data to clustering, anomaly detection to time-series, LogicPlum Data Scientists are changing the world one technological achievement after another.




Responsibilities




Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed. Conduct analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive knowledge of LogicPlum data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for product development.
Interact cross-functionally, making business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
Research and develop analysis, forecasting, and optimization methods to improve the quality of LogicPlum's user-facing products.

About ArchiMed

With offices in the US and Europe, ArchiMed is a leading investment firm focused exclusively on the healthcare industries. Its mix of operational, medical, scientific and financial expertise allows the ArchiMed team to serve as both a strategic and financial partner to European and North American small and middle-market businesses. Prioritized areas of focus include biopharmaceutical products & services, life science tools, medical devices & technologies, diagnostics, healthcare IT and consumer health. ArchiMed helps partners internationalize, acquire, innovate and expand their products and services.

Over the last twenty years, ArchiMed‚Äôs leadership team has directly managed and invested in over eighty small to large-size healthcare companies globally, representing over ‚Ç¨50 billion of combined value. ArchiMed manages over ‚Ç¨3 billion ($3.4 billion) in healthcare assets across its various funds.

With investments dedicated to the healthcare sectors, ArchiMed aims to advance sustainable global healthcare industries through impactful investing and contribute to the sustainable development goal (SDG) 3 "Good health and Well Being". ArchiMed investments goals‚Äô remain to improve health outcomes at all levels and as such, ArchiMed has classified its new funds MED III and MP II as Sustainable funds under Article 9 (SFDR). We are seeking a dynamic, analytical, values-driven intern to join our Impact Investment Team.

The Team

An international team (British, French, German, Italian, Polish‚Ä¶) with complementary education and experience in the investment, medical, scientific, strategic and operational sectors
Composed of alumni from: INSEAD, Berkeley, Georgetown, Bocconi, HEC Paris, Ponts et Chauss√©es, ESSEC, Imperial College, Dartmouth, etc.
Professional backgrounds: Private Equity (3i, Siparex, USS Ltd, Barings, capiton), Consulting (A.T. Kearney, Bain, McKinsey), M&A (Lazard, EY, KPMG, PwC), Industry (Biotronik, Cerba, Pharmacy, Veterinary)


Requirements

Your Role

Help inform sustainability-related decisions by conducting research on various topics
Collect and analyze ESG data on key sustainability-related topics directly from portfolio companies
Assist in the annual ESG data collection campaign from portfolio funds and companies
Support the robustness and quality of our internal Impact investment processes, and of our Sustainability Reporting
Contribute to the development of our MedImpact methodology and database
Support the finalization of ArchiMed's carbon impact assessment
Support the deployment of an ESG strategy and sustainable initiatives within ArchiMed
Help improve awareness of impact investing within the firm
Assist in the preparation of communication materials on Impact investment at ArchiMed


Aptitudes and Skills we look for

Curious, willingness to learn and adapt quickly
Analytical, ability to present synthetic results
Responsible and eager to take initiatives
Enthusiasm for the growing ESG, Sustainability & impact trends within the financial industry
Previous knowledge and/or experiences in responsible investment or in impact assessment/measurement preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English

We are in business to save independent Retail in Europe!




Across our towns and city centres unique neighborhood shops have been overshadowed by large chains and e-commerce giants. To combat this, we‚Äôve created a BtoB wholesale marketplace designed to help independent retailers to compete against larger competitors and thus maintain a connected community of stores, brands and shoppers in the places we live.




Established in 2019 in France, we‚Äôve since expanded to other European countries, including Spain, Germany, UK and the Netherlands. Driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction, we constantly innovate to develop cutting-edge tools and services that set new standards in the market.

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse glojobbal team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Commercial Data & Insights Analyst Apprentice (F/M/D)

Starting September, based in Paris

Alternance : 12 months (preferred rhythm 6 months office / 6 months school ‚Äì 4 or 3 days office / 1 or 2 days school)

About The Role

The Commercial team at Vestiaire Collective is in charge of customer strategy, CRM activations and marketing strategy, the Analytics team is charge of supporting the teams with their analytics needs.

Do you think that working in analytics is about much more than crunching numbers? Do you enjoy using data to find compelling insights and using your business skills to translate these insights into action? Join our team. You will report directly to the Head of Data and Insights ‚Äì Commercial, focusing on delivering actionable insights.

What You'll Do

Run weekly CRM campaigns and monitor their impact on the business
Support creation and maintenance of commercial measurement studies (e.g. GMV, CRM sending) and share findings to stakeholders to enable continuous improvements.
Work with cross functional teams to understand priorities and deliver insights and actions to improve CRM communications
Be the gatekeeper of high data quality and fidelity. This might involve setting processes to cross-check data, detect outliers, etc.
Conduct end to end ad hoc analysis to provide actionable insights (ex: understand what are the drivers of customers opting out of CRM communication, run A/B tests to understand which CRM copy perform better etc.)
Assist the team on performance monitoring, ad-hoc requests and presentations to measure the impact of key projects and identify new ones.


Who You Are

Currently doing a Master's degree in Economics, Business or Engineering.
Ideally you have already worked in data, operations or product positions in tech startups or consulting firms (strategy consulting, M&A, audit, digital marketing etc.).
You have a strong "get things done" mindset.
You have strong analytical skills: you pay close attention to details & ensure data accuracy.
You can give recommendations based on a structured reasoning, you are a fast learner and integrate feedback quickly.
You are a team-player and enjoy learning from others
Our working language is English, you must be comfortable communicating in English, French is a plus
It goes without saying you have a great knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint
SQL mandatory, Python knowledge is a plus
If you already had experience with Tableau or any other dashboarding tools (Power BI, Qlick view etc.) is also a big plus!


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
A flexible work possibility
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer
