About Us / Company Profile

TotalEnergies est une compagnie multi-√©nergies mondiale de production et de fourniture d‚Äô√©nergies : p√©trole et biocarburants, gaz naturel et gaz verts, renouvelables et √©lectricit√©. Ses 105 000 collaborateurs s'engagent pour une √©nergie toujours plus abordable, propre, fiable et accessible au plus grand nombre. Pr√©sent dans plus de 130 pays, TotalEnergies inscrit le d√©veloppement durable dans toutes ses dimensions au c≈ìur de ses projets et op√©rations pour contribuer au bien-√™tre des populations.

We‚Äôre on a mission to help organisations contextualise the environment they operate in.




At Echo Analytics, we work with companies from all over the world. We create, combine, and convert thousands of public and private datasets into meaningful geospatial insights and provide the most accurate commercial Point of Interest (POI) product and mobility insights available in Europe.




What do we do?

We provide companies with fuel to power their products with high-quality geospatial-based datasets. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build the most comprehensive geospatial datasets and insights available in Europe and rapidly expanding.




Echo partners with companies from multiple industries such as retail, mobility, smart-cities, real-estate, advertising, market-research, and financial services.




Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to be in charge of all the data deliveries (data extraction or data analysis) from our Data Lake to our customers.




To be successful as a Junior Data Analyst, you should have prior data experience, be able to collaborate with team members, be a strategic problem-solver and an inspiring data visionary. You also need to have business or client experience.




The opportunity

Our stack runs on Google Cloud Platform. You will work in an environment made up of Data Lakes (BigQuery, etc.), data streaming platforms (Pub/Sub, Dataflow..), orchestration and scheduling platforms (Airflow), modern deployment (Terraform), and management platforms (GCP).




You will operate some data extraction in coordination with the product and customer success team. You will be managed by a senior Data Analyst.




This is a unique opportunity to be part of a highly promising start-up in its early stage and play a vital role in establishing and expanding its market.




Your Role at Echo

We‚Äôre currently scaling the team and hiring talents to grow faster. You will be responsible to :




Understand the product / customers requirements and specify the strategy to extract the data
Provide the visibility on the deliveries to the business
Provide data analysis to obtain the requested data (raw visit, dwell time, cross visitation,...) using data sciences such as normalisation, extrapolation‚Ä¶
Write complex and efficient SQL queries to transform raw data points from our data lake into reliable business use cases.
Ensure data is clean, consistent and accurate.
Create clear and easy to understand technical documents that explain fully the datasets created.
Continue learning new skills thanks to the Echo Analytics knowledge plan
Resolve complex problems coming from the data.




What we‚Äôre looking for:

Fluency in English (French is a plus)
At least one experience in Big Data, Data warehousing in tier-1 software companies.
Good knowledge in Data Analysis in Python/SQL/R.
Some notions in Data Visualization in Python or other BI tools.
Good organisational skills.
Basics with working with the Google Cloud Platform stack.
Working knowledge in DevOps: GitHub CI/CD, Terraform, Notion, Jira or other Project Management tools.




What we offer:

The opportunity to join an early stage fast-growing start-up and to scale with us

Attractive remuneration package with stock incentives (employee equity plan - BSPCE)
A great international team based in Paris
A contemporary office space in the centre of Paris
Remote-friendly policy
Free coffee and snacks
Weekly team lunch

An amazing and supporting work environment focused on your professional growth and development

Make sure to highlight:

a. Your previous achievements

b. Your motivation

c. Your added value to Echo

2. Video-call

3. In-person meeting in our Parisian office




We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Company Description

From a French tech start-up created in 2007, Deezer has become one of the first French unicorns and the second largest independent music streaming platform in the world.

Job Description

If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you‚Äôd still be a great fit for this role in your application!




Additional Information




At Deezer, you can be your true self as we believe that #everyvoicematters. We strive to build an inclusive culture and foster a diverse environment. Because we care and want to ensure each employee feels welcome and safe at work, we continuously focus on fighting biases and helping diverse teams work well together through multiple learning opportunities, e-learnings and workshops right from the onboarding :

Great offices always located in dynamic and attractive districts, whether in Paris, London, Berlin or Sao Paulo!




If you want to learn more about life and culture at Deezer, please visit our Welcome to the Jungle page here!

A propos de nous:

Cr√©ateur de l‚Äôhypermarch√© et pionnier de la consommation de masse, Carrefour reste fid√®le √† ses racines tout en se r√©inventant chaque jour pour permettre √† chacun, de manger mieux : plus sain, plus local, plus responsable.

Nos atouts pour y parvenir ? Un r√©seau multiformat de magasins, la cr√©ation de services et d'une offre digitale de r√©f√©rence, une coop√©ration renforc√©e avec les acteurs du monde agricole, de la cha√Æne alimentaire, de la Tech... et aussi des collaborateurs passionn√©s, qui s‚Äôengagent, challengent leur m√©tier et grandissent ensemble pour r√©ussir la transition alimentaire pour tous.

Porteuse de cette ambition, la Direction Administrative & Comptable recrute un(e) :

Data Analyst (F/H) - en Alternance

üéØ Les missions :

Nous vous proposons d‚Äôint√©grer la direction afin de participer √† l‚Äôoptimisation et l‚Äôint√©gration de nouveaux processus m√©tiers √† partir d‚Äôune approche centr√©e sur la Data.

Vous participerez au d√©ploiement des nouvelles technologies et des nouveaux processus autour d‚Äôune approche Data Centric. A ce titre, vous travaillerez autour des probl√©matiques suivantes :


Recueil et extraction des sources de donn√©es pertinentes et de qualit√© pour traduction ensuite en donn√©es statistiques ;
Traitement, exploitation et int√©gration des donn√©es dans un Data Warehouse (entrep√¥t de donn√©es) ;
Cr√©ation de dashboards, mise en place de KPIs et reporting des performances pour donner une vision coh√©rente des r√©sultats aux diff√©rentes √©quipes m√©tiers;
Mise en place de process/requ√™tes et automatisation ;

Vous devrez avoir un sens critique pour remettre en cause l‚Äôexistant et proposer de nouvelles approches.

üë•Votre profil :


De formation BAC+3 minimum en fili√®re math√©matiques, statistiques ou informatique, vous souhaitez pr√©parer un dipl√¥me de niveau bac +4/ +5 en alternance.
Vous √™tes une personne curieuse, rigoureuse, autonome et savez √™tre force de proposition avec une app√©tence pour l‚Äôanalyse de donn√©es, la BI, le changement et l‚Äôinnovation.
Vous √™tes √† l‚Äôaise avec les outils SQL, Python, Javascript. La connaissance de l‚Äôenvironnement GCP est un plus.
Vous aimez travailler en mode projet sur des sujets nombreux et vari√©s.
Votre int√©gration dans les √©quipes n√©cessite des qualit√©s de communication, une √©coute active et un bon relationnel ainsi que des capacit√©s d‚Äôanalyse, de pr√©cision et de synth√®se.

Avantages du poste :

50‚Äâ% du titre de transport pris en charge par Carrefour
Autres avantages propre √† votre campus / site


Envie de rejoindre l‚Äôaventure ?

Chez Carrefour, nous avons √† c≈ìur de ne passer √† c√¥t√© d‚Äôaucun talent et sommes fiers de compter des √©quipes repr√©sentatives de la soci√©t√© dans son ensemble. Nous encourageons ainsi tous types de profils √† postuler √† cette offre et garantissons un processus de recrutement d√©nu√© de toutes formes de discriminations.

ABOUT DESCARTES UNDERWRITING



Descartes was born out of the conviction that climate change calls for a revolutionary approach in insurance to better protect corporations, governments, and vulnerable communities. We offer a new generation of parametric insurance that builds resilience against the full spectrum of climate and emerging risks. Utilizing Machine Learning and real-time monitoring from satellite imagery & IoT, our state-of-the-art climate tech provides innovative coverage for all trade sectors in all regions of the world. After a successful Series B raise of $120M USD, Descartes Underwriting is proud to be recognized among the French Tech Next40 and launched Descartes Insurance, a ‚Äòfull stack‚Äô insurer licensed to underwrite risk by the French Regulator (ACPR). With a growing corporate client base (250+ and counting) - our diverse team is headquartered in Paris and operates out of our 12 global offices in North America, Europe, Australia, Singapore, and Hong Kong.





ABOUT YOUR ROLE



Due to rapid growth we are seeking to expand our Data Science team, either across our Underwriting or our R&D functions. At the core of our company‚Äôs strategy, your missions will focus on making direct contributions to the development of new climate models or forecasting tools.




If you join the underwriting team, your key missions will include:



Improving or developing new algorithms, new risk models and products for our B2B client
Identifying, implementing and deploying new statistical and machine learning methods to differentiate Descartes from its competitors
Participating in the development of Descartes‚Äô technological platform
Collaborating with the business team to understand client needs and issues to further strengthen our technical excellence
Taking on management responsibilities as both you and the company develop
Participating in our R&D sessions
Working autonomously and pragmatically to make appropriate technical decisions

¬†



If you join the R&D team, your key missions will include:



Improving or developing new models to improve our understanding of climate risks with a special focus on wildfires or floods
Conducting research on the modelling of climate risks and machine learning methods
Identifying new and innovative ideas and testing state-of-the-art methods from scratch based on recent research articles
Collaborating with the underwriting and business teams to ensure our products are efficiently integrated into the underwriting process and meet our client‚Äôs needs
Working autonomously and pragmatically to make appropriate technical decisions



ABOUT YOU



EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS


Underwriting Data Scientist:



Masters student in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics or meteorological studies
Ideally a previous experience (long-term internship) in data science or climate modelling
Proficient in statistics, applied mathematics and machine learning methods
Capable of building high-performance algorithms
Proficiency in Python (e.g. scikit-learn)

R&D Data Scientist:



Research-oriented Master‚Äôs Degree or PhD in physics, applied mathematics, or meteorological studies
Multi-disciplinary curriculum, with strong skills in statistics, applied mathematics and machine learning methods
Ideally a previous experience in climate modelling or data science
Proficiency in Python

¬†



LANGUAGES
Fluency in English (written and verbal communication) required
Good command of one additional language (e.g. Chinese, French, Italian, German, Spanish‚Ä¶) valued

¬†



MINDSET
Interested in weather and natural perils modelling (wildfires, hail, tsunamis, earthquakes etc)
Strong team spirit and ability to work under pressure
Highly motivated, able to meet deadlines set
Strong desire to learn and commitment to the organization‚Äôs mission
Results oriented, high energy, with the ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Motivated to help improving businesses‚Äô and communities‚Äô resilience to climate change
Eagerness to work in an international environment



WHY JOIN DESCARTES UNDERWRITING?



Opportunity to work and learn with top data scientists from the most prestigious schools and research labs in France, allowing you to progress towards technical excellence;
Commitment from Descartes to its staff of continued learning and development (think annual seminars, training etc.);
Work in a collaborative & professional environment;
Be part of an international team, passionate about diversity;
Benefit from a referral scheme for successfully referring peers;
You can benefit from a punctual home office days.

¬†



HOW TO APPLY?



You may check off several but not necessarily all the expected boxes? Motivation and feeling are key elements for us!



If you want to develop your skills and work in a friendly startup atmosphere, don't hesitate and send us your application! https://www.descartesunderwriting.com/careers/



At Descartes Underwriting, we are committed to fighting against all forms of discrimination and for equal opportunities. We foster an inclusive work environment that respects all differences.



With equal skills, all our positions are open to people with disabilities.




RECRUITMENT PROCESS



Step 1: Call and HR Interview with our Talent Recruiter
Step 2: Technical online test
Step 3: In-person interview with a Data Scientist
Step 4: In-person interview with a Underwriting/R&D Manager

Step 5: Final round interview with our Data Scientist team

About PriceHubble

PriceHubble is a PropTech company, set to radically improve the understanding and transparency of real estate markets based on data-driven insights. We aggregate and analyse a wide variety of data, run big data analytics and use state-of-the art machine learning to generate stable and reliable valuations and predictive analytics for the real estate market. We are headquartered in Z√ºrich, with offices in Berlin, Hamburg, Paris, Vienna, Prague and Tokyo. We work on international markets and are backed by world-class investors. We have a startup environment, low bureaucracy and an international team and business.

Your role

We are looking for rockstar data interns to join our Data Product Team!

The Data Product team at PriceHubble is responsible for driving and shaping the core engine of our products that make our customers successful and that keep PriceHubble on track with our ambitious, global mission. As an intern, you will play a key role in driving strategic initiatives for our Data Product roadmap, working cross-functionally and collaborating closely with the product team, data engineers, data scientists, and internal stakeholders.

Working across teams to help ensure alignment, clarity on goals, and continual progress

Requirements

Comfortable working in English. German or French proficiency is a plus.

Experience and/or interest in Real Estate is a plus
Experience in project management or product management is a plus
Tech or startup experience is a plus

ü´ÄWho are we ?




The creation of Volta Medical follows the discovery of a new complex medical procedure to treat atrial fibrillation (the most common cardiac arrhythmia in the world) by the company‚Äôs founders, world experts in interventional rhythmology and intracardiac signal analysis.




Volta Medical is an innovative start-up based in Marseille, whose goal is to provide a range of artificial intelligence-based products to guide the cardiologist during ablation-type procedures.




We started this adventure 7 years ago and our team now has nearly 70 employees in France, Germany and the United States ! We completed a $27 million Series A round in November 2020 and a $36 million Series B round in January 2023.




ü´ÄOur values




Be a pioneer: Be brave. Don‚Äôt be scared of researching, exploring, trying and sometimes failing.
Improve patients‚Äô lives: Create products to provide electrophysiologists with the best user-experience possible, to help them improve the lives of patients.
Strive for excellence: Push yourselves to deliver the highest quality in everything you do. Learn from your mistakes and aim for the best.
Collaborate as a team: Welcome to a multidisciplinary and a diversified team ! Try to understand people from different cultures and environments. Confront your ideas and have fun !
ü´ÄMission




As a Data Scientist, you will be an integral part of our Data Science team, including Data and Machine Learning engineers. Your key responsibilities will include:
Developing and implementing state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms for analyzing multivariate time series data in the context of cardiac electrophysiology applications.
Producing high-quality, efficient, and scalable code that adheres to coding guidelines, implements unit tests, and follows best practices.
Conducting scientific watch and staying updated with the latest advancements in AI and medical research, and integrating relevant findings into the team's work.
Collaborating with the team to optimize and validate the performance of machine learning models.
ü´Ä Profile




We are seeking a highly motivated Data Scientist with the following qualifications:
Graduate from a Master's degree or PhD in data science, mathematics, statistics, or bioengineering.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in Machine Learning R&D projects, demonstrating a solid technical background.
Strong problem-solving aptitude and the ability to conduct technological analyses and research.
Excellent communication, organizational, and time-management skills.
Attention to detail and a keen interest in the recent developments of AI/ML research.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a diverse and collaborative team environment.
Fluency in written and spoken English.
ü´Ä Technical experience




To succeed in this role, you should possess the following technical experience:
Strong academic background in machine learning, including a solid understanding of mathematical and algorithmic principles.
Proficiency in Python programming language, with experience in NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, SciPy, XGBoost, etc.
In-depth knowledge of version control tools such as Git, as well as CI/CD and MLOps tools.
Experience working with databases, such as MySQL or PostgreSQL.
Familiarity with Linux operating system.
ü´Ä Preferred Qualifications




Although not required, experience in the following areas would be highly appreciated:
Previous involvement in the publication of scientific articles related to AI.
Collaborations with medical professionals or clinicians.
Familiarity with electrophysiology within the medical field.Proficiency in utilizing advanced visualization and processing techniques for 3D geometric data.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements for AI development in the medical device industry.
Experience in developing GDPR compliant machine learning solutions, with a strong understanding of data privacy principles and regulations.

About AXA Group Operations




Under the leadership of the Group COO & CEO of AXA GO, AXA Group Operations covers the following divisions:

Group CIO
Group Technology Operations
Group Security
Group Emerging Data & Technology
Group Procurement & Sourcing
Group Operations Transformation
Strategic Programs, Group Operations Finance
GO General Secretary and Risks
AXA GO BO (legal entity: AXA Business Services)

AXA Group Operations operates across more than 15 countries; and comprises around 7000 staff members.




Overview of the Business Process Design Officer role




Business Process Design Officer's role is to support Business teams and Business process owners in designing and implementing simple, efficient, and standardized processes.

The Business Process Design Officer is part of the Orga, Process and Data Division.




Job Purpose




Gather & analyze business requirements with GO divisions‚Äô representatives/process owners
Support business in gathering, explaining, documenting, clarifying, and analyzing business needs and requirements supporting their core processes
Participate to work with business to identify functional / technical requirements

Business Process Design

Understanding of business process and organization challenges
Participate to analyze and design business process
Review documented business processes

Business Process Implementation

Participate to implement new business processes or modify existing processes
Participate to monitor and ensure that requirements are met, tested, and implemented
Participate to Identify and resolve gaps between new and existing business processes

The Business Process Design Officer may have to, based on his seniority, handle project management activities including proper customer communication and reporting and lead the effort instead of being only a participant.




Skills and Leadership Capabilities




Strong prioritization skills & business orientation
Excellent listening and facilitation skills
Excellent communication - ability to address senior audiences and to challenge them
Ability to drive concrete results through influence
Solid analytical skills and problem solving mindset
Synthesis capacity strongly required to drive and support in depth simplification
Polished written and oral communicator in English




Education & Experience




Project management and facilitation experience
Process certification would be appreciated

¬∑ Master‚Äôs degree in a ranked engineering or commercial school preferably

¬∑ At least 1-2 years‚Äô experience in Consulting and/or similar role in Corporate

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 1000 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for an Operations Data Analyst to join our Operations team in Paris

About The Role

You will be joining our Operations team, whose role is to ensure that our buyers will receive their products and that our sellers will receive their payments. Reporting to the VP of Operations Performance, you will be working with our Vertical teams to support our growth. You will be in constant interaction with operational teams to help them optimize internal processes and better understand Operations' performances.

Field of expertise that you will discover throughout your journey: Customer Service, Customer Experience, Logistics, Transportation, Authentication, Quality Control, Curation and Trust.

What You'll Do

We are currently building the data backbone of our operations and this task will require a very strong collaboration between you and our internal Operations stakeholders and BI teams. In addition to that you will support the Operations teams by analyzing their performance and helping them understand how to improve it.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

DATA ACCURACY & CREATION:

You will be part of the team that designs our Ops data architecture and ensure the robustness of the system designed
Improve our data accuracy and implement control points to guarantee the sustainability of our information system
Document all data & KPI into our data center


BI ENHANCEMENT:

Support our BI team to develop and enhance our data and make it accessible to all our Ops teams
Revamp our Ops Data architecture to improve analysis efficiency
Create new data from external provider into our internal data warehouse


DASHBOARDING :

You will be designing, developing and creating our Operations reports and dashboards
Maintain our pool of reports and dashboards to meet the needs of our Ops internal users


ANALYSIS:

Run analyses to support our experts' teams and to design adequate actions plans
Create reports to help teams make informed, data-driven decisions
Communicate your findings and recommendations to key internal stakeholders as well as to larger audiences
Sit-down and work with various teams in order to tackle some of their pain points
Develop dashboards and tools that will provide consistent insights, visualization and tracking into performance, KPIs or historical performance
Work alongside Analysts to solve operational challenges


OPERATIONS PROJECTS:

Support our Operations Project managers by providing analysis on specific business case
Perform in depth analysis for our project managers to support their decisions
Design & create ops data to leverage the project outcome
Set control KPI & Analysis to ensure projects success


Who You Are

A minimum of 2 years of experience in data/business analytics
Excellent proficiency in analytics
An enthusiastic person who can adapt to multicultural environments
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English (French is a plus)
Strong knowledge in SQL (Use of Snowflake is a plus)
Be structured, organized, motivated by startup mindset (transversal topics management, wide range of topics)
Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others
A strong interest and knowledge in Fashion / Luxury industry
Be structured, detail-oriented, fast learner, and motivated by E-commerce
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
Fluent in English


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Deliver comprehensive and timely data analysis results to support R&D departement.

Company Description




YouGov is an international online research data and analytics group.




Our mission is to offer unparalleled insight into what the world thinks.




Our innovative solutions help the world‚Äôs most recognized brands, media owners and agencies to plan, activate and track their marketing activities better.




At the core of the YouGov platform is an ever-growing source of consumer data that has been amassed over our twenty years of operation. We call it living data. All of our products and services draw upon this detailed understanding of our 24+ million registered panel members to deliver accurate, actionable consumer insights.




As innovators of online market research, we have a strong reputation as a trusted source of accurate data and insights. Testament to this, YouGov data is regularly referenced by the global press, and Meltwater 2022 report concluded that YouGov is the most quoted research company in the world.




With operations in the UK, the Americas, Europe, the Middle East, India and Asia Pacific, we have one of the world's largest research networks.




Job Description




We are looking for a talented Research Manager to join our team in Paris. You will be managing projects on behalf of our clients utilizing YouGov‚Äôs fast-turnaround research platform, as well as managing ad hoc research projects. You will develop research designs and questionnaires, manage data collection, analyse data and produce deliverables.




Responsibilities Include:




Management: You will be managing a small team of research executives and to help them to progress.




Client communication: You will work directly with clients and consult them in conducting research projects, working with survey data and leveraging insights to meet business needs.




Research: You will be identifying business needs and deriving research objectives. You will be planning research projects using bespoke and existing data from the YouGov panel. You will be designing research concepts and questionnaires.




Data analysis and creating reports: You will responsible for coordinating preparation and analysis of survey data. You will interpret and guide clients through results. You will prepare reports and consult clients regarding business needs based on our data.




Project management: You will be planning and conducting projects based on YouGov‚Äôs panel technology. You will be using our internal platforms to ensure a fast turnaround on research projects. You will ensure that projects run smoothly, and are delivered accurately, on time, and within budget.




Qualifications




Minimum 6 years experience in conducting market research projects, ideally in a market research company
Experience in management
An open and pro-active mindset
Problem solving, analytical and numerical skills
Excellent interpersonal skills IT proficiency, especially MS Office
Excellent organisation skills
Excellent communication skills




Additional Information




Why join YouGov?




Join our global team to help us achieve our social mission: to make millions of people‚Äôs opinions heard for the benefit of our local, national, and international communities.




Understanding diversity of opinion requires diversity of background. Although our global panel of millions of people worldwide powers our research, our biggest asset is our people. If our research is to be truly representative of what the world thinks, we need people from all walks of life to be part of the team to bring their perspective to the work we do.




Life at YouGov




We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless, and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics, and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, bringing these values into everything that we do.




We strive to provide YouGovers with best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing. We want our employees to have a sense of belonging and uniqueness in a supportive workplace, so they can bring their full selves to work.




Equal Opportunity Employer




As an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or expression, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, HIV status, political affiliation, socioeconomic background, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law or in line with our responsibilities as a fair and ethic employer. All employment decisions are made based on occupational qualifications, merit, and business need.




To find out how we collect and use your personal data when you apply for a role at YouGov, please read our privacy notice at https://jobs.yougov.com/privacy

Alentis Therapeutics is developing breakthrough treatments for fibrotic and rare diseases and associated cancers. The company‚Äôs lead candidates are monoclonal antibodies that are highly selective for exposed and non-junctional Claudin-1 (CLDN1). Non-junctional CLDN1 is a previously unexploited target with a unique mechanism of action that plays a key role in the pathology of kidney, lung and liver fibrosis, as well as solid tumors.

Alentis` lead therapeutic program, ALE.F02, has finished recruitment into a Ph1a study in healthy volunteers and is currently being developed for the treatment of advanced fibrotic diseases. ALE.C04 will enter clinical studies in oncology in 2023.

Tasks

Develop and implement data analysis pipelines using R and Python.
Analyze and interpret OMICs data using bioinformatics tools and techniques.
Perform quality control and data normalization.
Generate visualizations and reports to communicate results.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in bioinformatics and data analysis.


Requirements

PhD in bioinformatics with experience working with omics datasets.
Experience analyzing and interpreting OMICs data using bioinformatics tools and methods.
Proficiency in programming languages R and Python.
Experience with data visualization tools and software.
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Interact with stakeholders with different backgrounds. Proficiency in English (written and oral).
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment as well as autonomously.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude.


Benefits

The opportunity to contribute to the development of First-In-Class molecules in an innovative leading Biotech environment in the field of fibrosis and oncology
Competitive compensation for your work and a flexible working environment


Alentis Therapeutics is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company developing breakthrough treatments for cancer and fibrotic diseases.

Are you energized by solving tough business problems?




Do you have a passion to transform P&G's brand building while enabling better decision-making with cutting (e.g.




ranging from Data Science to Behavioral Science)?




If so, then a role in the Analytics and Insights organization is for you!




The Analytics & Insights career in P&G takes you across a breadth of experiences, on multiple P&G businesses,




likely in multiple countries, always with an international perspective, always fast-paced.




It is a unique opportunity to develop both the ever-more demanded Data Science skillset and the strategic




thinking needed to manage P&G business.




The most distinguishing traits of whom we hire in A&I are curiosity and mental agility to relentlessly learn more (esp. about business, but equally also psychology, mathematics, and coding): all we need is an eagerness to learn,




the rest we will develop, as we grow our talents from within.




YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G‚ÄôS SUCCESS:




Earn the role of trusted advisor to the Business Unit Leadership Team




Deliver regular insights, by using advanced analytics techniques, mining extremely large data sets (the hyped Big Data), and applying best-in-class algorithms developed with/by other Data Scientists, examples could be building models to propose possible scenarios and answer the toughest business questions of the leadership team, optimize algorithms in accuracy and performance to then recommend specific actions to your business partners, discover unknown truths by mining new data sets;

Grow the organization‚Äôs knowledge and skills in the space of Data & Analytics:




Take from proof of concept to scaled capabilities the best innovative algorithms from your colleagues and operationalize best-in-class Data-science practice (e.g. cross validation and target shuffling) to all key models and algorithms;
Collaborate in a multi-functional team.




So, here‚Äôs your opportunity! Join Analytics & Insights and help us anticipate what consumers want and find out what they need.




Qualifications

Studying towards MSc in a quantitative field, e.g. Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Physical Sciences or Quantitative Social Science;

We‚Äôre on a mission to help organizations contextualize the environment they operate in.



At Echo Analytics, we work with companies from all over the world. We create, combine, and convert thousands of public and private datasets into meaningful geospatial insights and provide the most accurate commercial Point of Interest (POI) product and mobility insights available in Europe.



What do we do?



We provide companies with fuel to power their products with high-quality geospatial-based datasets. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build the most comprehensive geospatial datasets and insights available in Europe and rapidly expanding.



Echo partners with companies from multiple industries such as retail, mobility, smart-cities, real-estate, advertising, market-research, financial services.



Who are we looking for?



We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who is keen to discover and implement new algorithms to help us scale our products.



To be successful as a Data Scientist, you should have prior software development and big data experience, be able to collaborate with team members, be a strategic problem-solver and an inspiring big data visionary.



The opportunity



As a Data Scientist, you‚Äôll be joining the R&D team.



This is a unique opportunity to join, build and grow a successful start-up leading its market, from the early stages.



You‚Äôll be able to work on different types of data ( satellite image, mobility data‚Ä¶) and use a large variety of techniques ( NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series‚Ä¶)









Your Role at Echo



We‚Äôre currently scaling the Activity team and hiring talent to grow faster. You will be responsible for:



Improving existing algorithms and build new POC‚Äôs



Work with geospatial data to create human mobility themated products



Solve business problems in collaboration with the product team and tech team ( Data analyst, Data engineer‚Ä¶)









What we‚Äôre looking for:



Technical skills:

Strong computer science fundamentals and programming (Python)



Comfortable working with the Google Cloud Platform stack or another cloud environment



Strong knowledge of statistics, machine learning and deep learning approaches



You are fluent with SQL and Python



Demonstrated ability in executing challenging R&D projects



Minimum Qualifications:

Masters degree in a technical field



3+ years of experience in ML industry with frameworks such as Tensorflow, Pytorch



Knowledge of putting ML models to production



Preferred Qualifications:

Work on operational research, and solving optimization problems with mathematical models



Examples of work such as research papers, blog posts, Kaggle etc.



Experience with geospatial data,time series









What we offer:



The opportunity to join an early stage promising start-up and to grow with us



Build, manage and grow your own team



Attractive remuneration package with stock incentives (employee equity plan - BSPCE)



A great international team based in Paris and Bordeaux



A contemporary office space in the centre of Paris or Bordeaux



Remote-friendly policy



Free coffee and snacks



Weekly team lunch



Healthcare: Alan



An amazing and supporting work environment focused on your professional growth and development

2/ Call with Kadir (visio/1h)
3/ Skills test¬†

At Aqemia you will work in a multi-disciplinary team of passionate drug hunters, AI engineers and developers who are committed to our mission of finding many drugs, at high pace, to cure diseases.




As part of our growing team, you will enjoy a fast-paced, challenging, science-driven and creative environment, working at the very forefront of AI & Deep physics-powered drug discovery. This is a tremendous opportunity to bring your own impact on changing the way medicines are discovered and be involved in shaping the direction of our fast growing business and team.




We are looking for highly skilled and collaborative individuals who are naturally curious, have a passion for learning and solving complex problems with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù mindset.




If this sounds exciting to you, come and join us!




The main objective of the Target Ranking team is to identify the most relevant therapeutic targets for Aqemia‚Äôs drug discovery pipeline. The team serves as the entry point for targets, which are then continuously monitored to ensure only the best assets for Aqemia are worked on.




Our Target Ranking team:




Designs, develops and runs target assessment workflows
Extracts novel insights, encompassing chemistry and biology complexity, to guide the selection of targets for drug discovery pipelines
Models this extensive and intricate knowledge in innovative ways
Manages a portfolio of promising targets for Aqemia‚Äôs drug discovery pipeline





The Target Ranking team leverages multiple expertises to deliver on this exciting goal (inc. data engineering, data science, biology, chemistry‚Ä¶).




The difference you‚Äôll make




We are looking for a data scientist to join the Target Ranking team, whose role will be to work on the development, implementation and maintenance of a target identification framework. By doing so, you will play a crucial part in shaping Aqemia's portfolio of drug discovery targets!




What you'll do




Creation, development and maintenance of business and biological indicators for the assessment of therapeutic targets
Supporting the maintenance of a portfolio of attractive therapeutic targets
Transformation and analysis of omics and biomedical data
Implementation of machine learning methods to extract relevant biological information from various data sources
Evaluating outcomes and presenting results with Aqemia‚Äôs drug discovery platform teams
Staying up-to-date with the state-of-the-art and latest AI and bioinformatics methodologies and processes


Your profile




2+ years of experience as a data scientist
Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in data science, bioinformatics, or related field
Demonstrable experience with working with biological data
Knowledge of advanced statistical and machine learning methods
Experience in working with omics or biomedical datasets
Fluent in object-oriented language development (ideally Python)
Experience in delivering technical projects from start to finish
Written and oral communication skills and ability to communicate with a technical and non-technical audience


Who you are




You are eager to play an active role in contributing to Aqemia‚Äôs strategy to develop drugs for patients
You are anxious to bring your wealth of knowledge and skills to the table to inspire and coach brilliant people from diverse backgrounds
You are keen to solve tough problems on issues that truly matter
You are inquisitive, and proactive with a can-do attitude
You are excited to join a small team and make your mark on drug discovery
You thrive on working collaboratively in a fast-paced, interdisciplinary environment that keeps everyone on track


Our Workplace Environment




Fast-paced, intellectually and scientifically demanding, results-driven
Our Founders boast : 10+ years experience in research at Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure in Paris, not to mention a stint in Oxford and Cambridge / 10+ years experience in strategy consulting at BCG
Aqemia has a rapidly growing team of +40 people from world-class institutions (AstraZeneca, GSK, Sanofi, Harvard, Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure, Ecole Polytechnique, BCG)
Our premises are conveniently located in center of Paris (1 Bd Pasteur), with a possibility of up to 2 days of remote work
Working language: English





We are growing fast, if you feel that you don't fit this job description but you‚Äôre still excited to join, then please get in touch!

About Pathway

Deeptech start-up, founded in March 2020.

Our developer product, Pathway‚Ñ¢ is a new Stream Data Processing layer ‚Äì a game changer for enterprise clients, designed to enable real-time insights based on raw streams of events data.
Pathway‚Ñ¢ provides application developers with a capacity for real-time incremental in-memory transformation of complex event streams. It is built to master scenarios involving real-world data (e.g. IoT), online data (e.g. user activity patterns), and graph data (including graphs which evolve in time).
Pathway‚Ñ¢ comes complete with a reactive Python programming framework and a rich library of composable application templates, process mining and Machine Learning algorithms.
The product is available in open beta to all developers at pathway.com, and our first deployed clients include some of the leaders of the logistics industry, such as DB Schenker or La Poste.


Pathway is a growing start-up, VC-funded at $4.5 million in pre-seed and supported by amazing Business Angels from the Machine Learning and logistics spaces. In the French tech ecosystem, Pathway is incubated at Agoranov and Ecole Polytechnique, a member of French Tech Paris Saclay, supported by the French Public Investment Bank and R√©seau Entreprendre, accelerated by Wilco. Named as one of the 2021 Hottest Startups to invest in by the magazine Challenges and winner of the BPI I-Lab award for deeptech startups.

The Team

Pathway is built by and for overachievers. Its co-founders and employees have worked in the best AI labs in the world (Microsoft Research, Google Brain, ETH Zurich), worked at Google, and graduated from top universities (Polytechnique, ENSAE, Sciences Po, HEC Paris, PhD obtained at the age of 20, etc‚Ä¶). Pathway‚Äôs CTO is a co-author of Goeff Hinton and Yoshua Bengio. The team also includes the co-founders of Spoj.com (1M+ developer users) and NK.pl (13.5M+ users).

The opportunity

We are currently searching for Data Scientists with experience in the Python stack, to help explore and discover the most pertinent insights in datasets on spatio-temporal event streams. In this job, statistical rigor and beauty of visualization meet on equal footing.

You Will

be working with spatiotemporal data with advanced schemas (time-changing graph models)/
be designing data cross-sections, proposing analytics metrics and KPI‚Äôs in line with clients‚Äô objectives, selecting clustering algorithms, and preparing visualizations, to enable fast data exploration and insight discovery ‚Äì all within our product.
be designing dashboards in SQL with some Python elements/extensions.
be directly helping us with Customer Conversion and Adoption within Customer organizations, by contributing to both deployment instances and ‚Äúdemonstrators‚Äù of our product, performed on client data sets.
work directly with our Product Owner and CTO to propose and implement extensions to our product, based on repetitive client needs.
depending on your seniority, implement machine learning algorithms on spatiotemporal event streams and other geospatial data.


The results of your work will play a crucial role in proving how our technology can help with compelling industry use cases.

Requirements

You Are

Ready for hands-on contribution to the product, helping to ensure the success of demonstrators for clients, and contribution to product codebase.
Intuitive, with good visual taste, and good common sense judgment.
Committed to beautiful user-centered design: you know that stories are made for people, and you are willing to listen to what they have to say.
Curious at heart and thrilled to work with real-world data, especially spatio-temporal data.
Like trains, trucks, cranes, pythons, pandas, and other things that move.
Not afraid to switch between the roles of data scientist, data-vis magician, statistician, engineer, and detective, at a moment‚Äôs notice.
Have 2 years+ experience in positions related to Data Science.
Have a very good working knowledge of Python.
Know SQL. Are able to work with tables and other data types (arrays, json,‚Ä¶).
Would be able to implement the Transit Node Routing algorithm in Python just based on reading its Wikipedia article.
Have experience with git, build systems, and CI/CD.
Have at least basic undergrad textbook familiarity with graph algorithms, finite automata, and text (string) search algorithms.
Understand statistical concepts, such as correlated random variables, significance, and non-Gaussian noise.
Prepared to be quizzed & grilled by the datasets you encounter, everyday. Here are some questions you should be able to answer off the top of your head: what can ‚Äú-273.15‚Äù signify; why ‚Äú65535‚Äù is a suspicious integer value; how many months does it take a containership to go around the world; and, roughly what order of g-force is attained by an astronaut in a space rocket at liftoff?
Respectful of others

Successful track-record in Data Science or algorithms contests (Kaggle, Codeforces,‚Ä¶)
Experience in topics linked to logistics/moving assets.

SESAMm

SESAMm (www.sesamm.com) extracts behavioral insights from millions of unstructured text data sources across the public internet in over 100 languages, helping clients distill valuable intelligence on businesses and their customers to make investment decisions and manage risk.

We work with many well-known firms around the world in private equity, investment banking, insurance, and asset management to apply Natural Language Processing and Artificial Intelligence algorithms to track e-reputation, competitive positioning, sentiment analysis, risk and ESG factors.

SESAMm is growing quickly, with over 90 team members around the globe and offices in Paris, New York, London, Metz, Tunis, and Tokyo.

Are you looking for a new challenge? Do you dream of joining a growing company, proposing new ideas, and taking part in innovative processes?

At SESAMm, everyone brings their ideas, skills, and creativity. We value collaboration, support and teamwork. We learn every day from the experience of this great team and we constantly take up new challenges. We are proud of the work accomplished and to participate in the success of this great adventure!

Key technologies: Alternative Data, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning and Quantitative Analysis.

The Data Scientist Role

As an integral member of our Customer Success Team, you will have the unique opportunity to work directly with high-calibre financial firms globally. The role focuses on extracting meaningful insights from multifaceted, intricate, and sometimes noisy datasets, honing features, enhancing the machine learning pipeline, and evaluating the effectiveness of modeling. Joining us during an exciting growth period, you will contribute significantly to shaping our team's culture.

Key Responsibilities

Identify patterns, conduct tests, and perform evaluations on datasets;
Conduct Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) on complex datasets to generate business insights;
Implement data preprocessing and feature engineering techniques;
Comprehend and generalize Machine Learning models;
Draft comprehensive analysis reports.


Desired Qualifications And Skills

Education

Hold a Master's degree in a quantitative field (such as Mathematics or Data Science), with robust data analysis skills.


Experience

Having 1-2 years of experience in Data Science will be considered advantageous.


Skills

Software: Proficient in Python and familiar with Machine Learning libraries (such as Numpy, Pandas, Sklearn, Keras, and Matplotlib);
Database: Excellent SQL skills.
Comprehensive knowledge of Machine Learning principles and best practices;
Demonstrated interest in complex Machine Learning models (including supervised & unsupervised learning, deep learning etc.)
Fluency in English, with strong written communication skills.
Experience with Cloud services, particularly AWS, is a plus.
Familiarity with the private equity industry will be considered favorably.


Note: If you have a personal project that could underscore your candidacy, please include a link to your Github account in your application.

Benefits Of Working At SESAMm

Flexibility: Team members can work remotely and have the opportunity to work with colleagues around the world.

Work environment: SESAMm is multicultural, with technology, sales, and management teams in the US, France, and Tunisia making important contributions to the company's growth.

Career development: SESAMm is growing quickly, which means the opportunities for your own growth are continually expanding, and that you can shape the company's culture and evolution.

Professional evolution: SESAMm values training and knowledge-sharing. We organize internally and externally led training sessions and pay for access to educational platforms.

Transparency: You will be kept apprised of the company's continuing evolution and performance through monthly "Ask Me Anything" meetings, frequent business/finance updates, and strategy-sharing discussions.

Well-being: Building a good culture is key to building a good business at SESAMm. We focus on being a learning organization that values and supports teamwork, thoughtfulness, and work/life balance.

Job Specifics

Location: Paris
Type of contract: Permanent Contract (CDI)
Start Date: ASAP

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Operations Business Analyst Apprentice (F/M/D)

About The Role

You will be part of the Operations Performance team, reporting to the Performance Analyst. Your role will be to work closely with the data team and the 6 business units from Operations to support, monitor and optimize Operations. You will be working with the three regions: EMEA, APAC and Americas.

What You'll Do

BUSINESS ANALYTICS

You will have the chance to propose, develop, and implement projects.
To optimize the Operations performance, you will work on KPI's and reportings.
You will be in constant interaction with your business partners.
You will provide deep analysis and business cases on several OPS topics.
You will oversee the project / task with an end-to-end vision and have the ownership of your topics: identification of needs, scoping, identification of problematics, action plans and estimation of impact of your analysis.


PERFORMANCE MONITORING

You will be monitoring various KPIs (Customer satisfaction, leadtime, etc.) across Operations organization to drive Operations Performance.
Your role will be to provide visibility and inform your stakeholders on KPIs variation to enable data driven decision making.
You will be supporting the Performance Analyst in the weekly and monthly Performance governances (Presentations, deep dives, etc.)

Currently doing a Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Economics or related field.
Strong analytical skills, eye for details, structured, fast learner, organized, motivated by startup mindset (transversal and wide range of topics, fast-paced environment).
Eager to learn and enthusiastic, you enjoy working as a team-player in a multicultural setting.
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
SQL knowledge and data visualization tools such as Tableau are a plus.
Strong oral and written communication skills in English. French is a plus.
Interest and knowledge about Fashion / Luxury / E-commerce / Sustainability.


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
A flexible work possibility
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for conducting data analysis using statistical techniques, generating insightful reports, identifying data sources, and collaborating with stakeholders to gather business requirements and design data-driven solutions. Your expertise in data analysis and your ability to extract valuable insights from complex datasets will be crucial in driving informed decision-making within the organization.

Responsibilities:

Data Analysis:

Perform in-depth data analysis using statistical techniques, data mining, and data visualization methods to identify patterns, trends, and insights.
Interpret complex data sets, develop meaningful conclusions, and present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track business performance and provide recommendations based on data analysis results.
Continuously monitor data quality and integrity, troubleshoot data anomalies, and resolve data-related issues.


Reporting and Presentation:

Develop and deliver comprehensive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that effectively communicate analytical findings to various stakeholders.
Collaborate with business units to understand reporting requirements and design customized reports that address specific business needs.
Ensure the accuracy, timeliness, and relevance of reports by automating data extraction and implementing data quality checks.


Data Source Identification:

Identify and evaluate data sources both within the organization and externally to gather the required data for analysis.
Collaborate with data engineers and IT teams to acquire, integrate, and prepare data from different sources for analysis.
Conduct data profiling and exploratory data analysis to assess the suitability and quality of data sources.


Business Requirements Analysis and Solution Design:

Engage with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements related to data analysis and reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design data-driven solutions and provide recommendations for process improvements, business strategies, and decision-making.
Participate in solution implementation, including data model design, data visualization development, and data integration.


Requirements :

Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, involving data analysis and reporting.
Proficiency in statistical analysis techniques, data visualization tools (such as Tableau, and Power BI), and SQL querying.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with large datasets and complex data structures.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Knowledge of business intelligence concepts and tools.
Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and database concepts.
Experience with programming languages like Python or R is desirable.
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.

Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

Job_title: Head of CDC Analytics and Reporting
Job_description:
Position Description




The Head of CDC Analytics and Reporting will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of analytics and reporting capabilities within the Cyber Defense Center (CDC). This position will be responsible for creating and delivering reporting on relevant situations, security-related metrics, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to internal cybersecurity stakeholders, as well as external stakeholders within the Volvo Group




The Head of CDC Analytics and Reporting requires close collaboration with external partners and stakeholders, together with the CDC Management Team, to ensure reporting is aligned with business objectives and cybersecurity targets.




Main Responsibilities:




Develop and implement analytics and reporting strategies to enable our current and future business
Responsible to create and deliver regular reports on security-related metrics and KPIs to internal cybersecurity stakeholders, including Executive Management, Business Review Meetings and briefing of external partners and stakeholders.
Collaborate with the CDC management team and external partners to ensure that reporting is aligned with our broader cybersecurity goals and objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards and other visualizations to help stakeholders interpret data and make informed decisions
Continuously monitor and analyse data to identify trends and patterns that can inform cybersecurity strategy and operations.
Collaborate with other teams, such as threat intelligence and digital forensics and investigations, to integrate data from multiple sources and provide a comprehensive view of the organization's cybersecurity posture.
Ensure that all reporting complies with industry best practices, legal and regulatory requirements, and internal policies and standards.
Establish and maintain relationships with external partners, such as vendors and industry organizations, to support the organization's analytics and reporting activities.


Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
7+ years of experience in analytics and reporting, with a focus on cybersecurity or information technology.
Proven experience in developing and implementing analytics and reporting strategies and processes.
Strong knowledge of data analytics and visualization tools and technologies, such as Tableau, Power BI, and SQL.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, resolve and communicate complex technical issues.
Familiarity with cybersecurity concepts and technologies.
Experience with data governance and compliance, including relevant legal and regulatory frameworks.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


We look forward to reviewing your application!

About Yassir




Yassir is the leading super App for on demand, ride-hailing, last-mile delivery, payment services and more, set to change the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across multiple countries. It has raised $150 million in Series B funding, five times what it raised in its previous priced round last November with world class investors such as BOND and Y Combinator, which is the precursor of the likes of Airbnb, Stripe, Dropbox, Doordash, among others.




We‚Äôre not just about serving people - we‚Äôre about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.




We are seeking an experienced and data-driven individual to join our team as a Data Analyst. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of data analysis techniques and the ability to exploit databases in order to uncover insights hidden within large datasets.




As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our AI team to conduct all necessary data studies prior to the launch of machine learning projects that cover all of our services. You will play a central role in communicating data-related topics within the company, with regular presentations to different stakeholders.




The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills. Additionally, you will have the ability to think creatively and "hack around" problems to uncover insights and the perseverance to solve problems that may not have obvious solutions. We value this kind of "out of the box" thinking and problem-solving abilities. If you are excited about the opportunity to make an impact in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, we want to hear from you!




About Your Role As Data Analyst




Translate business questions and strategies into clear, measurable outputs that provide impact to Yassir
Design, create, and evaluate outputs, including metrics, definitions, dashboards, and apps
Communicate actionable insights through effective data visualization and clear communication to support the company's strategic direction
Extract meaningful insights from data, create light data pipelines if needed, and deliver results through dashboards, reports, or one-off analyses
Perform statistical analysis on transactions and marketing data to provide reliable signals of the truth
Design experiments and AB tests to promote data-driven decision making
Serve as a sparring partner for the product team to help them define KPIs and recurring reports to measure the performance of their initiatives


Requirements - Must Have




You have 3+ years of professional experience working as a data analyst
Excellent command of SQL (Postgres, Standard SQL, having worked with BigQuery is a plus) and statistical software languages (R or Python)
Good understanding of statistics (sampling, distributions, probability theory, experiment design, regression etc.)
Good knowledge of machine learning techniques and data pre-processing
Advanced English communication skills
Willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques


*As a company, we are passionate about diversity and inclusion, 40% of our team are women leaders in the tech sector. Research shows that women do not apply for jobs if they do not meet all of the requirements. We would like to hear from you if you feel you would be a good fit for us!




Do you want to become part of our first-class team? Then you absolutely have to send us your application. üöÄ




PS: And if you want to stand out in your application, just let us know in your cover letter why we should have in our team. üí°




Diversity & Inclusion & Engagement:




We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, as we believe diverse teams are more successful in the long term. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, and we encourage all people equally to apply for jobs with us.

More than 91% of our interns and apprentices recommend to do their internship, apprenticeship or VIE at Danone (source Happy Trainees). What if you were our future International Sales Development intern?‚ÄØ




‚ÄØ




JOINING DANONE MEANS...‚ÄØ




Meeting danoners with unique personalities and divers career paths‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




Growing up in different environments production sites, logistics bases, research and innovation centers or headquarters‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




Build a career path adapted to your personality, skills and desires‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




Learn thanks to rich and various missions.‚ÄØ




YOUR MISSIONS AT DANONE ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




Important this offer aims to present different opportunities for a Marketing Analyst internship at Danone. These internships will take place either in Paris Haussman (75) within our international teams, or in Rueil-Malmaison (92) within our French headquarters from July 2023.‚ÄØ You will be supported by a manager from our Strategy & Insights team.




You will be able to take part in one of the following mission‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




‚ÄØ




Business Insights ‚ÄØ




(40%) Analysis of the performance of our categories and Danone brands via retailer and consumer panels (IRI & Kantar)
(25%) Detection of growth opportunities and risks (translated into challenges for the brands)
(25%) Participation in the strategic thinking of sales teams by analyzing the performance of markets and their commercial levers
(10%) Supporting teams in analyzing and interpreting performance




‚ÄØ




Consumer Insights ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




(60%) Analysis of consumer and product trends, using research analysis (e.g. e-listening, Google trends...) and external data (IRI, Kantar, Mintel, Euromonitor...).‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
(30%) Implementation and coordination of market/consumer research to answer questions on brand positioning, communication and innovation (new products, new packaging...). You will work with partner agencies and internal stakeholders.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
(10%) Potentially deliver inspiring and engaging presentations and workshops to internal stakeholders on topics such as sustainability, innovation, the future of health, children's health and daily nutrition.‚ÄØ




‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




THE ADVANTAGES OF THIS INTERNSHIP ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




A position at the crossroads of different teams (Marketing, Sales, R&I, ...)
Up to 2 days of remote work per week‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
A compensation from 1120‚Ç¨ (Bac+4) to 1300‚Ç¨ (Bac+5) gross/month‚ÄØ
About you




You are‚ÄØ




Available from July 2023 for a period of 6 months
Student of Bac+4/5 level in university, business or engineer school
You are interested in data analysis, you are rigorous‚ÄØ
Do you speak english ? We need someone who is fluent to work at our international HQ. If not, there are also positions at our French headquarters!
Are you comfortable with Excel and Powerpoint? Are you curious and want to develop your skills in strategic analysis?‚ÄØ




So, ready to become a Danoner ? Join us !‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We therefore consider all applications* to ensure an inclusive corporate culture where everyone can feel like they belong.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ




All applications will be considered irrespective of origins and ethnicity, personal background, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability....‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

The program includes ‚ÄØ




a manager who will follow you and help you to grow throughout your internship, via weekly meetings,‚ÄØ

and fun moments and other surprises!‚ÄØ

Job_title: Data Engineer Intern - Industry/Catalog Team - m/f/d
Job_description:
Company Description




WE ARE THE HOME OF MUSIC




From a French tech start-up created in 2007, Deezer has become one of the first French unicorns and the second largest independent music streaming platform in the world.




Now listed on #Euronext, growth is accelerating fueled by #Thepowerofmusic. Deezer is ideally positioned to play a key role in the continued development of the booming music streaming market. If you‚Äôre looking for an environment where you can grow and have an impact, this is the perfect time to join Deezer!




Our international and passionate teams are spreading the love for music, working to make Deezer the most personal and innovative music streaming service.




We believe music is about diversity & inclusion, multiculturalism and togetherness.




Ready to join the team? Listen: **Join Us**




Job Description




The Team




Our scope covers everything related to content, which starts with ingesting new deliveries (be it music releases, but also podcasts or lyrics among others) into our catalog, continuously cleaning and curating its content by providing internal tools and automation, goes on with serving this content back to our end users through our different access points (mobile and desktop apps, website, APIs) and is concluded by reporting highly detailed usage data to content providers and right holders for analysis and royalties distribution.




In short: we connect Deezer users to content creators and music industry actors through robust ingestion, engaging display and smart data feedback.




What You Will Do




As part of the Industry‚Äôs Catalog team you will be helping Deezer have the cleanest catalog of music possible. You‚Äôll be in charge of fundamental data enrichment and cleaning, and support us on many other initiatives.




You will work in a technical data environment with mainly Spark/Scala and Python.




Support the team to qualify canonical albums and their related versions thanks to internal and external metadata you will have to consolidate
Support the team in serving the newly qualified content to other internal teams
Participate in creating an immersive and easy to navigate catalogue of music.
Work closely with Product Managers to design solutions and challenge existing ones
Work on fundamental data enrichment and cleaning related to music catalog
Own your subjects and present them to various stakeholders, especially Data Science teams (Recommendation and Research)
Qualifications




What we are looking for:




Master student with focus on data engineering/software development
Some knowledge in machine learning is a plus
Experience with Scala and Spark (Python is a plus, ML is a plus)
Familiar with git and CI/CD
Openness to candid feedback, new perspectives, continuous learning, and self-development
You are a true music lover




This is a 6 months internship. It should preferably be your end-of-study internship




If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you‚Äôd still be a great fit for this role in your application!




Additional Information




At Deezer, you can be your true self as we believe that #everyvoicematters. We strive to build an inclusive culture and foster a diverse environment. Because we care and want to ensure each employee feels welcome and safe at work, we continuously focus on fighting biases and helping diverse teams work well together multiple learning opportunities, e-learnings and workshops right from the onboarding :




Regular Diversity & Inclusion internal and external talks
Dedicated employee work streams on Gender equity, Ethnicity & Culture, Disability and LGBTQ+
Multiple e-learnings and mandatory training sessions for all managers
English and French courses for all, so that everyone can connect and feel included




Beyond benefits like meal vouchers and transportation, we offer you extra perks like:




A Deezer premium family account for free
Access to gym classes
Deezer parties several times a year and drinks every thursday
Allowance for sports travelling and culture ‚Ä¶
Great offices always located in dynamic and attractive districts, whether in Paris, London, Berlin or Sao Paulo!




If you want to learn more about life and culture at Deezer, please visit our Welcome to the Jungle page here!

Job_description:
üë´ About the team




The ad tech industry is a super dynamic and innovative ecosystem where the competition between platforms is tough and the amount of collected data points is enormous. Thus innovation is key to our business, and that's our raison d'√™tre: our mission at the Analytics Lab is to explore new areas and harvest unexploited revenue potential from Equativ‚Äôs existing tech platform through A/B testing and advanced coding.




We do that by

A/B testing to generate revenue from those insights (production)
building our own pipeline to scale our tactics (engineering)





hand in hand with Product and R&D, ultimately paving the way for the next feature improvements in our platform.




While Analytics Operations' clients are mostly Equativ's collaborators, the Analytics Lab's client is Equativ's platform.




That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre looking for both explorers and builders.




Our tech stack : SQL, Python, Snowflake, Airflow, ClickHouse & more

What you'll do ‚úèÔ∏è




Operations - Run
Own our revenue generation activity - Ensure proper execution of the Analytics Lab automated pipeline streams & fix bugs: A/B tests deployment & analysis, results communication and implement successful pricing strategies
Guarantee our rigorous thinking - Contribute to fortifying our processes and ensure they are applied on a daily basis, from feature deployment sanity check to scoping and performance
Engineering - Automation
Industrialize our code - Contribute to improving the Analytics Lab pipeline streams at all levels with Python: sourcing, deployment, sanity check, analysis, communication

About you üí™

Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative or business field (Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Economics, Computer Science or any Engineering related field etc.)
Technical appetence and hands-on mindset is a must

You are fluent in English

Curious, daring, dynamic and versatile personality required

Hiring Process




Call with our recruiter (15')

Technical interview with the Analytics Lab Team Lead (60')
Culture interview with the Head of Analytics Operations (30')





Are you a business profile with a strong taste for coding?




Are you an engineer/dev with a strong business acumen?




Are you curious and bold? Then we need to talk ü§û




With the Analytics Lab, you will be able to grow both technically and from a business standpoint. You will be heard, and you will be challenged, all this in a very good mood -because having fun at work is key (after all we do it 5 days a week).




Strong work ethics + minimum proficiency level in SQL and Python required.

We‚Äôre on a mission to help organisations contextualise the environment they operate in.

At Echo Analytics, we work with companies from all over the world. We create, combine, and convert thousands of public and private datasets into meaningful geospatial insights and provide the most accurate commercial Point of Interest (POI) product and mobility insights available in Europe.

Job_description:
Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Responsibilities

Mines data using modern tools and programming languages.
Defines and implements models to uncover patterns and predictions creating business value and innovation.
Works with project team to understand problem statements, initiates and direction.
Tells stories with the data using visualization tools/methods to demonstrate insight impact.
Assures accuracy, integrity, and compliance of cleansed data.
Maintains proficiency within the data science domain by keeping up with technology and trend shifts.
Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution and suggests changes or improvements.

Knowledge & Skills

Using statistics, mathematics, algorithms and programming languages.
Ability to apply analytical and problem-solving skills.
Understanding of disparate unstructured and structured data in a distributed environment.
Solid grasp of structured and unstructured data and modern data transformation methodologies
Ability to create models to pull valuable insights from data.
Create stories and visualizations to describe and communicate data insights.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Creative.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
Ability to effectively communicate data insights negotiate options.

Scope & Impact

Collaborates with peers, junior engineers, data scientists and project team.
Typically partners with high-level Individual Contributors and Managers.
Supports projects requiring data engineering solutions expertise.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, or equivalent.
Typically 2-4 years‚Äô experience including graduate or postgraduate research.

About HP

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.
