Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Job_description:
Location: Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship & relocation assistance)

Starting salary of USD 60,000 per annum + performance based bonus - 0% tax environment + an opportunity to join our employee share scheme

About Cobblestone Energy

Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.

We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!

Cobblestone Values

Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual.
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence.


What We Offer In This Role

A full-time position on our Commercial team
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues.
Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career.
Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business.
Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term.


Do you have a passion for data and a solid foundation in mathematics and computer science? If you are a recent graduate or early career professional, Cobblestone Energy, a high-speed energy trading company in Dubai, is looking for you to join us as a Junior Data Scientist. Help drive informed decision making throughout the organization.

As a Junior Data Scientist at Cobblestone Energy, you will play a critical role in supporting our energy trading operations. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analysing, and interpreting large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that will drive our business decisions. You will also have the opportunity to develop predictive models to forecast energy prices and trends and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Developing deep understanding of the industry and delivering key insights by analysing data
Forecasting different fundamentals such as wind power generation and demand
Researching and implementing new trading strategies
Building and developing new or existing data infrastructure


Your background:

Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R
Experience with data analysis and manipulation tools such as Pandas, NumPy, and SQL
Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Matplotlib and Seaborn
Experience that demonstrates your team-oriented, innovative, and strategic working styles.
Pro-active and flexible work mentality
Interest in data-driven trading
Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


About the Role: This is an exciting opportunity for a Junior Data Scientist to join a growing and innovative energy trading company. You will have the opportunity to work on challenging projects, gain valuable industry experience, and develop your skills in a supportive and dynamic environment.

The Hiring Process

Your application will undergo evaluation, followed by psychometric tests, a trading simulation, a research project, and remote interviews. Successful candidates will then be extended an offer to join our Dubai office as full-time Commercial Graduates through our Commercial Development Program (CDP). We will cover all relocation expenses, including flights, visas, housing, and necessary paperwork. The CDP provides a comprehensive rotational experience in data science, trading, and analytics, with guidance from our experienced commercial team. Throughout the program, you will receive mentorship and training in market fundamentals, leading to the development of strong analytical skills. Upon completion of the program, you will be a Junior Data Scientist

If you are eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are passionate about using data to drive business decisions, we want to hear from you! Apply now and take the first step in your career as a Junior Data Scientist at Cobblestone Energy.

Job_title: Data Engineer - Stream Data Processing - Distributed Data Processing
Job_description:
About Pathway

Deeptech start-up, founded in March 2020.

Our developer product, Pathway‚Ñ¢ is a new Stream Data Processing layer ‚Äì a game changer for enterprise clients, designed to enable real-time insights based on raw streams of events data.
Pathway‚Ñ¢ provides application developers with a capacity for real-time incremental in-memory transformation of complex event streams. It is built to master scenarios involving real-world data (e.g. IoT), online data (e.g. user activity patterns), and graph data (including graphs which evolve in time).
Pathway‚Ñ¢ comes complete with a reactive Python programming framework and a rich library of composable application templates, process mining and Machine Learning algorithms.
The product is available in open beta to all developers at pathway.com, and our first deployed clients include some of the leaders of the logistics industry, such as DB Schenker or La Poste.


Pathway is a growing start-up, VC-funded at $4.5 million in pre-seed and supported by amazing Business Angels from the Machine Learning and logistics spaces. In the French tech ecosystem, Pathway is incubated at Agoranov and Ecole Polytechnique, a member of French Tech Paris Saclay, supported by the French Public Investment Bank and R√©seau Entreprendre, accelerated by Wilco. Named as one of the 2021 Hottest Startups to invest in by the magazine Challenges and winner of the BPI I-Lab award for deeptech startups.

The Team

Pathway is built by and for overachievers. Its co-founders and employees have worked in the best AI labs in the world (Microsoft Research, Google Brain, ETH Zurich), worked at Google, and graduated from top universities (Polytechnique, ENSAE, Sciences Po, HEC Paris, PhD obtained at the age of 20, etc‚Ä¶). Pathway‚Äôs CTO is a co-author of Goeff Hinton and Yoshua Bengio. The team also includes the co-founders of Spoj.com (1M+ developer users) and NK.pl (13.5M+ users).

The opportunity

We are searching for a person with a Data Processing or Data Engineering profile, willing to work with live client datasets, and to test, benchmark, and showcase our brand-new stream data processing technology.

The end-user of our product are mostly developers and data engineers working in a corporate environment. Our development framework is one day expected to become for them a part of their preferred development stack for analytics projects at work ‚Äì their daily bread & butter.

You Will

You will be working closely with our CTO, Head of Product, as well as key developers. You will be expected to:

Implement the flow of data from their location in client's warehouses up to Pathway's ingress.
Set up CDC interfaces for change streams between client data stores and i/o data processed by Pathway; ensuring data persistence for Pathway outputs.
Design ETL pipelines within Pathway.
Contribute to benchmark framework design (throughput / latency / memory footprint; consistency), including in a distributed system setup.
Contribute to building open-source test frameworks for simulated streaming data scenarios on public datasets.


Requirements

Inside-out understanding of at least one major distributed data processing framework (Spark, Dask, Ray,...)
6 months+ experience working with a streaming dataflow framework (e.g.: Flink, Kafka Streams or ksqldb, Spark in streaming mode, Beam/Dataflow)
Ability to set up distributed dataflows independently.
Experience with data streams: message queues, message brokers (Kafka), CDC.
Working familiarity with data schema and schema versioning concepts; Avro, Protobuf, or others.
Familiarities with Kubernetes.
Familiarity with deployments in both Azure and AWS clouds.
Good working knowledge of Python.
Good working knowledge of SQL.
Experienced in working for an innovative tech company (SaaS, IT infrastructure or similar preferred), with a long-term vision.
Warmly disposed towards open-source and open-core software, but pragmatic about licensing.


Bonus Points

Know the ways of developers in a corporate environment.
Passionate about trends in data.
Proficiency in Rust.
Experience with Machine Learning pipelines or MLOps.
Familiarity with any modern data transformation workflow tooling (dbt, Airflow, Dagster, Prefect,...)
Familiarity with Databricks Data Lakehouse architecture.
Familiarity with Snowflake's data product vision (2022+).
Experience in a startup environment.


Benefits

Why You Should Apply

Intellectually stimulating work environment. Be a pioneer: you get to work with a new type of stream processing framework.
Work in one of the hottest data startups in France, with exciting career prospects
Responsibilities and ability to make significant contribution to the company‚Äô success
Compensation: annual salary of ‚Ç¨60K-‚Ç¨100K + Employee stock option plan.
Inclusive workplace culture


Further details

Type of contract: Permanent employment contract
Preferable joining date: early 2023.
Compensation: annual salary of ‚Ç¨60K-‚Ç¨100K + Employee stock option plan.
Location: Remote work from home. Possibility to work or meet with other team members in one of our offices:
Paris ‚Äì Agoranov (where Doctolib, Alan, and Criteo were born) near Saint-Placide Metro (75006).
Paris Area ‚Äì Drahi X-Novation Center, Ecole Polytechnique, Palaiseau.
Wroclaw ‚Äì University area.


Candidates based anywhere in the EU, United States, and Canada will be considered.

Job_description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Impact Apprentice (F/M/D)

12 months apprenticeship starting in September, based in Paris

About The Role

The Sustainability & Inclusion team drives Vestiaire Collective's ambition to become the sustainable leader among worldwide e-commerce marketplaces for responsible consumption. As part of the team, and reporting to the Sustainability Project Manager, your role will be to support this ambition.

What You Will Do

Participate in the development, implementation and awareness of our sustainability roadmap
Contribute to different ongoing operational projects (charities engagement, corporate platform to communicate on sustainability, gender equality index, climate strategy roll out, annual impact reporting including new BCorp standards, marketing and consumer studies, responsible purchasing policy, ‚Ä¶)
Support internal animation & communication on Impact topics across all offices globally
Support the Diversity Equity and Inclusion task forces work
Support the Sustainability & Inclusion team on various punctual tasks (presentations, wordings, research, brainstorming, interviews and event preparation‚Ä¶)
Keep the team up to date on hot topics, news and legislative agenda in the fashion, tech, logistics industries


Who You Are

Curious and passionate about Sustainability, with a good general understanding of its related concepts (circular economy, climate change, CSR...)
A people-person with good communication skills (written and oral), who enjoys team work!
Strong organization skills, flexibility & proactiveness
Good analytical and synthesis capacities
Fluent in both French and English
Good command of Pack Office tools (GSuite)
Appetite for data & coding is a plus (SQL, Snowflake, Tableau)
You are currently a student enrolled in a Business or Engineering school or University


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
A flexible work possibility
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Our Mission

Help all humans to live well longer

Give access to everyone to the best in class diagnostic technologies
Give data-driven personalized solutions and recommendations
Make this journey seamless and enriching
Make the world conscious of their body health, mind health, and the environment around them
Disrupt the $10t inefficient healthcare industry


Our Values

We move fast, learn fast, iterate fast
We are open minded and curious
We are hungry for scale
We cut the fat and focus only on what's essential
We communicate without filter to enhance our creative energy
We avoid compromise and strive for innovative solutions to reach our goal
We do what needs to be done, nothing is too small or too big


The Project

Build a full-stack B2C health company to improve people's healthspan and lifespan

Build a network of accessible health centers worldwide for health tests and diagnostics
Display results and recommendations in an app
Give access to educational content to guide the user to a healthier lifestyle
Provide personalized and qualitative supplements based on results

Role

You will support the Strategy team on topics that are instrumental to our success.

As such, the missions you will perform as a Business Strategy intern at Aura are various, as you can be asked to help on almost any subject.

Possible projects could include:

Strategy: Explore and quality strategic business opportunities (through benchmark, market research, financial analysis, data-driven frameworks and insights, etc.)
Product: Identify and benchmark strategic product opportunities

At Teads, we do quality and responsible advertising, at scale. We invented outstream video advertising and now have a reach of 1,9 billion unique users per month powered by an end-to-end proprietary platform. We foster a sustainable advertising and media ecosystem by funding quality journalism and respectfully connecting brands to consumers.




To innovate, we have created a strong company culture that empowers passionate people, gives them the right tools and trusts them to do their jobs as best they can. Teads roadmap is full of ambitious and strategic projects related to the evolution of our offering for both publishers and advertisers.




Our organization gives the possibility to work remotely part of the time and more flexibility is open to discussion. We also offer relocation packages if you prefer to settle down in one of our engineering offices.




üëâ Join a team of passionate people who build quality and responsible advertising, at scale!




Our Business Intelligence (BI) Community




We want to empower everyone at Teads to take data-driven decisions. To do this, we federate a community of Data Analysts, distributed across our product areas. They infuse a data-driven culture within the entire company by driving proactive product analysis and building self-serve Business Intelligence tools. They also make sure everyone else within their product area is empowered to use these tools or run ad-hoc studies of any kind (business analysis, financial reporting, exec summary, growth analysis, etc.).




What will you do?




As a Data Analyst in the Product department, your goal is to help infuse a data-driven culture at Teads.




To develop BI within your product area, you will proactively:




Drive the adoption of standard key product metrics, by leveraging Teads BI stack (datamarts, data catalog, dashboards, etc.) to make these key product metrics available in self-service to everyone in the company, with a standardized and accepted definition.
Assess the success of each product release, by defining and monitoring relevant metrics (success, adoption, etc.), and reporting them regularly to key stakeholders.
Help shape the product roadmap, by working closely with Product Managers, and by owning yourself a part of the roadmap, in order to assess business opportunities and challenges.
Drive ad-hoc studies and self-serve data exploration, by building self-serve BI tools, and providing documented business models developed in close collaboration with Software Engineers.
Spread BI knowledge and best practices, by animating BI rituals (workshops, trainings, demos, etc.) and keeping a good relationship with data enthusiasts of your product area (business analysts, product managers, leadership, etc.)




You will also be part of a community to develop BI transversely. As a member of this community, you will:




Govern a BI roadmap, around a unified vision and common objectives.
Work on global BI initiatives, such as standardizing the UI/UX of dashboards, BI learning & knowledge, or consolidating a centralized Data Catalog.
Define and share BI best practices, to enforce consistency across the board.
Own the complete BI cycle, by developing your technical skills and your knowledge of the ad-tech industry.
Help onboarding Data Analysts, with adequate documentation and training.




What will you bring to the team?




Your Skills And Experience




3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Bachelor or Master degree in BI, engineering, mathematics or marketing.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and BI tools (warehouse, datamarts, dataviz, etc.).
Ability to efficiently communicate and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Data-driven mindset and proactive approach.
Passionate, innovative, and fast learner.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Fluent in English.




Bonus Points




Experience with BI platforms (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, SiSense, Qlik, Domo, etc.).
Experience with modern data warehousing solutions (BigQuery, SnowFlake, Redshift, etc.).
Experience in the digital advertising industry.
Experience in coding.
Proficient in French.




Why work at Teads?




At Teads, Product and Engineering work hand in hand and are aligned towards the same goal: to scale our business while continuing to create new and exciting products.




We value team spirit, pragmatism, listening and we encourage initiatives.
We promote end-to-end development: ‚ÄúYou build it, you run it, you monitor it‚Äù.
We share knowledge and support with each other beyond any organizational boundary.
We fix issues during a blameless postmortem and learn from it so that it doesn‚Äôt happen twice.
We are working together to create great engineering, but we are also supportive to promote a great work-life balance.




We Care About You




Security & Savings: Attractive package providing financial peace of mind, including competitive compensation, profit-sharing, daily meal vouchers (Swile), family health insurance (Alan), and a personalized relocation package (if needed).
Career Development: Continuous investment in our employees' skills: in-house and external training, tech conference opportunities, internal mobility (individual contributor or management career ladder).
Life Balance: A well-balanced work-life for our employees is one of our top priorities: 35+ days off per year, hybrid work (2-3 days remote work per week, more is open to discussion), fully covered parental leave, and reserved daycare places.
Wellness: Prioritizing employee well-being through premium work equipment, enjoyable work environment (work-life balance, team building events, summits), remote work subsidy, promoting Diversity & Inclusion with internal & external initiatives (women speaking groups, dedicated school partnerships), dedicated charitable time and sustainability actions (Eco Tree, subsidy for eco-mobility).




Discover more about our culture and benefits on our Engineering website and Welcome To The Jungle page.




About Teads




Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media.




As an end-to-end solution, Teads‚Äô modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies. For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world‚Äôs best publishers and content providers.




Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.




Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries.




We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Merchandising Analytics & Insights Intern (F/M/D)

6 months Internship, starting in June, based in Paris

About The Role

Vestiaire Collective seeks a Merchandising Analytics Intern to assist the Senior Merchandising Analytics and Insight Manager in providing data-driven insights to the Global Merchandising Team. The intern will work with the team to create and manage dashboards, analyze supply and demand, optimise the customer journey, manage automation and scalability, manage merchandising operations, and analyse customer insights. They will also support the team in developing a comprehensive understanding of commercial, pricing, and marketing campaigns to optimize merchandising decisions.

What You'll Do

Assist in creating and managing dashboards for home page analytics, browsing behaviour, campaign performance, and other key metrics to provide insights into customer behaviour and drive business decisions.
Assist in understanding the reasons behind changes in key performance indicators (KPIs) and coordinating with regional teams to communicate these KPIs, understand reasons, and prepare actions.
Help develop a comprehensive understanding of our commercial, pricing, and marketing campaigns to optimize merchandising decisions.
Analyze the customer journey onsite to understand the effectiveness of different mechanisms in boosting traffic and campaigns, such as push notifications and in-app messaging. Assist in assessing demand based in other regions and analyzing the top-performing supply.
Support in providing insights to regions on highlighting the top-performing supply in their campaigns and curation and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure that supply is accurately represented on the website.
Work with regional teams to optimize supply and demand based on customer preferences and trends.
Assist in identifying different user groups and designing campaigns that address their needs.
Utilize customer insights to inform and improve commercial campaigns and promotions.


Who You Are

Currently doing a master's degree in engineering School or Business School
Strong analytical skills: Proficiency in Excel and SQL is a must; and experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a strong plus.
Be structured, detail-oriented, a fast learner, and motivated by E-commerce, Sustainability.
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Enjoy working as a team player and learning from others.
An interest and knowledge in Fashion / Luxury industry
Fluent in English


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
Hybrid working: working from the office 3-4 days per week
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer.

Description




A Day in the Life:




Reporting to the Head of Marketing, you will be responsible for the following subjects:




Events




Help organize trade shows and Near events. In particular, manage upstream preparation (discussions with organizers, finding the right locations, preparing the appropriate materials, etc.) and logistics (email invitations, reminders, etc.).
Monitor suppliers: brochures, goodies, marketing materials, etc.
Keeping track of trade shows relevant to Near and its solutions.




Digital marketing




Help set up and monitor various online advertising campaigns (suggest target audience, create visuals, suggest content, help create landing pages, etc.).
Take an active part in the delivery of pushmails (preparation of texts, online tests, monitoring of statistics, etc.) on our marketing automation tool.
Regularly animate the company's social networks (Twitter, LinkedIn) and suggest posts to be published
Help updating the Near website




Global




Competition analysis: analyze the marketing actions of players in the ecosystem (posts on social networks, emailing, marketing campaigns, events, etc.).
Update reporting on actions taken




Nice to have




Have already worked with marketing automation tools or understand how they work. Examples: Hubspot, Pardot
Have design skills and be able to create a few simple banners, visuals or infographics. Examples: Photoshop, Canva




This is a unique opportunity to join a talented and friendly team, and live an adventure in a fast-growing international company. You'll be working on real-life issues in Europe and liaising with Near marketing teams around the world!




Requirements




We're looking for a passionate marketer with the following skills:




You are currently studying marketing (Master 4/5) and have an interest in digital marketing / B2B marketing.
Fluency in French and English, both written and spoken (mandatory)
You are familiar with tools such as Google Docs, Google Sheet, Excel and Google Drive
You are autonomous, rigorous and organized
You are resourceful and able to make suggestions
You are a team player and are looking for a job where you interact on a daily basis with other departments (Sales, Product, Data...)




If you don't already have all these skills under your belt, that's okay! It's our job to help you grow in these areas.

iBanFirst is an international financial services provider offering alternative payment solutions to traditional banking.

Essencemediacom is Richemont‚Äôs global media partner, bringing together the online and offline eco-systems of luxury publishers to create seamless, agnostic partnerships across channel in a premium communication environment.




The Opportunity




The world of luxury is experiencing significant changes due to fluctuating macroeconomics, a changing clientele and emerging paths to purchase fuelled by an evolving digital landscape. For these reasons, Richemont appointed Essencemediacom in 2017 to help deliver profitable and sustainable growth Richemont brands deserve. With your help, Essencemediacom‚Äôs transformative approach will redefine Richemont communications, evolving the ways of the past and building on today to achieve new levels of excellence.




The role

The Essencemediacom network comprises of over 6,700 people working in 125 offices in 90 markets around the world. We are proud to call some of the world's most successful brands as clients, including Mars, Sony, Danone, Google, Shell, and The Coca-Cola Company. At ManoMano, we bet on passionate and innovative people! Are you looking for a great environment to grow professionally and personally ?

About

Launched in 2013, ManoMano is the European leader specialized in DIY, home improvement and gardening online. ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products. With more than 4000 seller partners, 16 million products, 7M active customers and 50M unique visitors per month, ManoMano is a disruptor of online home improvement, DIY and gardening across 6 countries : France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom.

ManoMano was valued at $2.6 billion and reached Unicorn status in July 2021 after $725 million raised 8 years after its creation.

ManoMano also works for the pros with ManoManoPro, a unique platform designed to make life easier and free building craftsmen from their daily constraints. Currently, in France, Spain and Italy, the BtoB activity saves craftsmen time by revolutionizing their purchasing processes.

We currently are more than 900 Manas & Manos, including a quarter of international talents and 24 nationalities, working in our 3 offices (Paris, Bordeaux and Barcelona).

As a DIY European leader, we have a strong mission : we are free to invent a sustainable future and committed to build it today; together with our employees, partners and customers we are hands-on to improve our homes for tomorrow.

We are free to invent a sustainable future because we have the freedom to decide on the course of our business: we are trend-setters, and we want to be the builders of a more sustainable, exciting and living future.

We are committed to build it today because there is an emergency regarding our planet. Together with our employees, partners and customers we are part of an ecosystem: the more we embark, the more it will lead to an enhanced impact.

We are hands-on because we are doers and committed builders, it‚Äôs in our DNA. Make our homes better for tomorrow is at the heart of our business, at the heart of our lives and one of the biggest levers of positive impact on people‚Äôs carbon footprint.

Job_description:
Founded in Marseille in 1966 by Pierre Bellon, Sodexo is the global leader in services that improve Quality of Life, an essential factor in individual and organizational performance.




Operating in 64 countries, Sodexo serves 100 million consumers each day through its unique combination of On-site Services, Benefits & Rewards Services and Personal & Home Services.




Sodexo provides clients an integrated offering developed over more than 50 years of experience: from foodservices, reception, maintenance and cleaning, to facilities and equipment management; from services and programs fostering employees' engagement to solutions that simplify and optimize their mobility and expenses management, to in-home assistance, child care centers and concierge services.




Sodexo's success and performance are founded on its independence, its sustainable business model and its ability to continuously develop and engage its 420,000 employees throughout the world.




Sodexo promotes the fulfilment of our employees and contributes to the economic, social and environmental development of the local communities with which we work.




You will work at the head office of the Sodexo group, located in Issy-Les-Moulineaux, accessible from Paris by RER C, Tram T2 from La D√©fense and Porte de Versailles or metro line 12.







MISSIONS




We are looking for an EPM (Enterprise Performance Management) EPM Solution Analyst in apprenticeship contract in the Group Financial Systems & Processes team, a division of the Group Controlling department. The GFSP team main mission is to:

Define Group EPM Roadmap and ensure its alignment with Group Strategy.
Manage Group EPM financial systems (mainly HFM, TAGETIK, ESSBASE and Sonar (Oracle/OBIEE)), focusing on the demand, the functional administration and the support.
Guarantee the safety and reliability of Group financial data, providing seamless access to reports, supporting the preparation of Group reporting instructions and planning, updating Group dashboards.




The EPM Solution Analyst will be a member of the GFSP team (10 people), reporting to the EPM Solutions Finance Manager and focusing on the administration of ESSBASE / HFM (performance management & consolidation tools), TAGETIK (forecasting and Budgeting tool) and Power BI.

Her/his mission is:

Administration of ESSBASE, HFM, TAGETIK and Power BI i.e., management of organizational changes, corrections, evolutions, new developments
Build new reporting webforms to respond to new needs in HFM
Update structure in Essbase
Push in production corrections, and developments after having verified them in test environment
Manage ESSBASE, HFM, TAGETIK and Power BI security and access rights
Provide support to ESSBASE, HFM, TAGETIK and Power BI users‚Äô community
Provide ESSBASE, HFM, TAGETIK and Power BI technical expertise for projects
Update internal documentation for users
Integrated in the audit process of the applications

In relation to those missions, you will interact with other finance teams both in Group Finance (Consolidation, FP&A, Holdings) and in Regions.




WHY SODEXO




You will be fully integrated into the life of the team
You will attend all the coordination meetings and you will thus have an overview of the activity of a Group Financial Systems & Processes team
You will participate in rich and empowering missions, in an international environment
Sodexo offers a training course adapted to your needs, in particular to develop your skills
Restaurant pass, partial reimbursement of transport tickets







PROFILE




Master degree in IT or Finance
Service and solution oriented
Ability to work with autonomy and with attention to detail, and to manage multiple tasks and conflicting priorities
Strong team spirit, diplomacy, and proactive attitude
Reliability, accuracy
Good level of communication
Willingness to improve technical skills within an international environment
Good knowledge of Microsoft suite (XL, Word, PowerPoint‚Ä¶),
English business fluent

Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.




Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!




Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare, and Spotify founders.




But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.




If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!




Meet The Team - Who You Will Work With üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüëß




You will join the Growth team; which sits right in the middle of our business model working across numerous departments and scaling new games on a weekly basis. The organization of the team is as follows:




1 Head of Growth Strategies
1 Senior Growth Manager
1 Growth Manager
2 Growth Associates




Role And Missions - What You Will Do üöÄ




As a Growth Assistant Intern, you will be an integral part of our Growth team, supporting various initiatives to drive user acquisition, engagement, and retention. This internship provides an excellent opportunity to gain practical experience and contribute to the growth of our gaming business.




Your missions will be the following:




Support the growth team in planning, executing, and optimizing user acquisition campaigns across various digital channels, such as social media, online advertising platforms, etc.
Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and best practices in the gaming industry.
Assist in analyzing data and metrics to measure the effectiveness of the campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and make data-driven recommendations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including publishing, creatives, data analysis, and others, to optimize our current gaming process and drive growth.
Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and gaming communities to identify new growth opportunities.
Work with the Head of Growth Strategies on documenting and building presentations for the company-wide meetings and learnings




Requirements




Preferred Experience - What's your profile üëÄ




We are always excited to welcome new interns who are enthusiastic, motivated, eager to learn, and passionate about gaming. Overall, we are looking for interns willing to take on new challenges, and committed to making the most of their internship experience.




If you recognize yourself in the following description, you're the one!




Currently enrolled in your final year of (or recently graduated from) a Master's degree program in Business, Finance, Data, or similar.
Prior internship experience or side projects on Growth or Gaming related are preferred.
Passion for the mobile gaming industry and a strong understanding of gaming trends, platforms, and communities.
Good verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills, eager to speak up.
A data-driven individual with strong analytical, research, and problem-solving skills.
You manage Excel and Powerpoint fluently and are able to analyze big samples of data and make decisions accordingly.
Multitasking person, used to working on several projects at the same time.
Availability to come onsite in our Paris offices and commit for 6 months full-time.
Speaking English fluently is a must.




Our Culture - Who We Areü™ê




At Homa, we are building a community of brilliant talents. We believe that true innovation comes from diversity and collaboration, and that's why we prioritize brainpower and determination over formal education. So if you have the talent, energy, and motivation, there is no obstacle to your success here.




As the creative experts behind the platform, we provide developers with the data they need to bring their ideas to life. Our team lives by three central values that guide everything we do:




‚ú®Ambition: we're not afraid to tackle difficult challenges and set our goals extremely high. We're on a mission to revolutionize an industry dominated by well-established companies, and we won't stop until we succeed.




‚ú®Humility: we leave our pride & ego aside. We are always ready to lend a helping hand, celebrate each other's successes, and learn from our failures. As Mr. Lamar said, "Sit down. Be humble."




‚ú®Curiosity: we keep our minds open and never stop learning. We believe that questioning everything is the best way to stay ahead of the curve, and we encourage all our team members to stay curious and never stop exploring new ideas.




At Homa, you'll be challenged, supported, and inspired every day, and we can't wait to see what you bring to the table.




Benefits




Perks & Benefits - What we offer üéÅ




While success is its own reward, here are some of the benefits that come with working at Homa:




We offer essential benefits in France: including health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidies, childcare benefits, and life insurance
Working from our newly renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we have a desk waiting for you
You will be working in English with our international team of top-tier talents from 35+ countries
You will be able to attend diverse team events and Workations (the famous company-wide Homa trip)

Job_description:
Our Team



Our team is made up of passionate data enthusiasts who are always exploring the ever-changing world of data. We strongly believe in the value that data can bring to our teams and ultimately, to our customers.
If you share our drive to make a real impact and are excited about the potential of data, we'd love to have you on our team!



Your Role



As a Product Data Analyst at Zenchef, you‚Äôll work closely with Product Managers to analyze and prioritize our users' needs and align the product roadmap accordingly. You‚Äôll leverage your data expertise to identify key problems and suggest strategic solutions across different teams.



Key Missions



Collaborate with Product Managers to help them validate or invalidate their assumptions and hypotheses about the product through data analysis and experimentation.
Build the right funnels with the right metrics (examples: AARRR, Time To Value, etc.).
Define best practices in Product Analytics (processes, data interpretation).
Measure the impact of tests and new application features (AB tests, funnels, recommendations, etc.).
Create decision-making tools and develop KPI dashboards to bring insights and provide recommendations.

What we're looking for



You have¬†2-3 years of experience in a similar role.
You‚Äôre an SQL master, able to working on complex queries and optimizing them.
You have expertise with product analytics tools (such as GA4, Mixpanel or Amplitude) and Business Intelligence tools (such as Metabase, Redash or Tableau).
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams, including Product Managers, Engineers, and Designers.
You have a track record of driving impact and growth through data-driven insights, including measuring the impact of tests and new product features, defining and challenging KPIs, and identifying areas of opportunity for improvement.
You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and enjoy staying up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in data analytics and product management.
You are fluent in both French & English (read, write & speak)

You'll be our rockstar if



Your are comfortable with at least one programming language (ideally Python)
You have implemented an event tracking or behavioral analytics tool in the past
You‚Äôve worked with BI tools such as Re:Dash and Metabase
You are a Food Lover, passionate about Food & Tech

Recruitment process



Step 1 : People Meet & Greet with the Talent Acquisition Manager (45')
Step 2 : Case study with Andrew, Team Lead Data & CRM (home)
Step 3 : Discussion with a PM and Andrew (1:00')
Step 4 : Cultural Fit Meeting with Tech & Ops (1:00')

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Global Social Media Intern (F/M/D)

6 months internships, starting in July, based in Paris

About The Role

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a talented, community-minded and sustainable fashion passionate Global Social Media Manager apprentice.

Reporting to the Global Social Media Manager, you will be supporting the team in the strategy implementation and follow up, as well as coordinating our different markets to insure global strategy adoption across markets.

What You'll Do

Social Media management and planning:

Support in coordination of content planning for the Instagram and TikTok global accounts: book slots in the global calendar with knowledge of our priorities, platform (Vestiaire Collective) app calendar, in respect of a defined process (make sure the process is respected across countries and business units).
Support our Global Social Media Manager and our Social Media Specialist into planning orchestrations and creative briefs for the Creative Factory and countries (brand partnership, local activations, build briefs for our recurring content categories and fashion shoots)
Support our the team to respect the editorial line and content mix, in order to grow our community engagement and reach
Support our the team in planification of the posts, publishing
Support the team into writing the Social Media curation newsletter : spot new features, campaigns to highlight, trending conversations on social media
Answer non - related to customer services comments on our social networks to fuel engagement on a daily basis


Data and analysis

Support the team in providing analysis and building weekly and monthly activity reports based on owned and earned KPIs


Who You Are

Currently enrolled in a master's degree in digital marketing
You consider yourself a "social geek" , you are a high social media user and know which feature to use in order to drive specific KPIs (reach, engagement, traffic)
Proactive, highly motivated, detail-oriented and process driven individual with excellent numerical and communication skills
Community driven: you are passionate about conversations and trends on social networks, you closely watch trending topics and rising stars on social
Creative: you have an eye for content and know, how to nurture creatives to make contents standout in the users' newsfeed
Passionate about second-hand fashion and sustainability: you think second-hand is the future of fashion and follow platforms, editors, or influencers involved into sustainable fashion


Tools

Experience with Project Management tools : JIRA, etc.
Experience with Analytics tools : Google analytics, Tableau, Dash&Hudson, Social Bakers and other social media dedicated tools
You like to think of yourself as someone organized and sharp: organization tools, dashboards and planning tools have no secret for you
Knowledge and active user of social networks: Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, Twitter etc.


Languages

Be fluent in both English & French


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
Flexible work possibilities
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer.

Background:

eu-LISA is the European Union Agency for the Operational Management of Large-Scale IT Systems in the Area of Freedom, Security and Justice (eu-LISA) manages large-scale IT systems to support the implementation of asylum, border management and migration policies in the European Union (EU). The Agency is also a front-runner for the digitalisation efforts of the EU's Justice and Home Affairs domain, building a new information architecture and contributing to the development of a new security ecosystem. Since the Agency's beginnings in 2012, eu-LISA has become the digital engine of the Schengen Area. With its activities and tasks, the Agency adds value to the EU Member States by supporting their efforts towards justice, security and freedom.

Keyrock is expanding!

Keyrock was founded in 2017 and has quickly grown from 3 to over 100 people today. As an industry recognized liquidity provider and market maker, Keyrock is a leading European creator of algorithmic trading technologies in the digital asset space. You will be in direct technical reference with client contacts such as Heads of Pricing, Heads of Product, CTOs, Actuaries and Data Scientists.

You will lead product demonstrations with various audiences and oversee Akur8 proof of concept projects in an actuarial consultant type of role.

In addition to these technical pre-sales responsibilities, you‚Äôll also be able to impact on the design of product training, improvement of model development, as well as leading technical after-sales projects by providing modeling and actuarial support during sessions with clients.

Finally, you‚Äôll also contribute to white papers and participate in / present at conferences to establish the leadership of Akur8 in non-life insurance pricing.

You‚Äôll be attached to our Paris office, and so traveling for business events will be required (approximately one week per month).

Requirements

The successful candidate must meet each of the following criteria in order to be considered for this position:

A minimum of 3 years experience in a P&C / General / Health insurance pricing role as a Pricing Actuary, Data Scientist or Actuarial Consultant (in order to understand insurance business imperatives and to be able establish solutions in accordance with them);
A strong understanding of Data Science and Machine Learning techniques for predictive modeling;
Experience in actuarial data-driven predictive modeling (GLMs / GAMs) & risk analysis in a P&C / General insurance pricing role;
Strong communication skills in order to elaborate on complex technical concepts to both technical / non-technical audiences;
Readiness to travel if required (approximately one week per month).
Fluent English language skills which are necessary for internal communication


Benefits

As a member of our team, you‚Äôll be able to learn from highly skilled colleagues, with a strong Tech DNA, that are eager to share their knowledge and passion.

But it‚Äôs not all work, you‚Äôll also be part of a dynamic team that enjoys spending time together, having fun activities, team lunches, playing sports as well as the occasional ‚Äòhappy hour‚Äô.

Homa is a gaming technology lab that gives game creators the data-driven tools and human expertise needed to turn their creative ideas into commercial hits. The technology we create is used by game creators around the world to create games that hit players' sweet spot, and the commercial jackpot.

Our ‚ÄúHoma Lab‚Äù platform gives game creators a comprehensive set of tools and solutions that lets them keep their eyes on new trends and ideas, execute real-time A/B testing of all their game's features through a no-code SDK, and distribute and monetize their games as well. It's a full end-to-end digital ecosystem that ensures developers are focused on the right idea, building games with every feature optimized, and distributing them at the right time, to people eager to play them, worldwide.

Does it work? Yep. Apps powered by our tech have been downloaded more than 1 billion times. And a lot of that is because we don't just sell our platform to clients and wish them well. We partner with them long-term, we make one hit, then we make some more. Homa is 50% a technology platform and 50% a collaborative, transparent partnership.

As a team, we're over 160 people and 34+ nationalities strong. Some of us are artists, some of us are business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs or former strategy consultants ‚Äì but we're all here for the same thing: to take over the gaming industry by giving creators the data to transform their ideas into games played and money made.

Since inception, Homa raised a total of $165M to achieve this mission, with the participation of Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures and Bpifrance - along with renowned business angels, including King and FuboTV founders, and Spotify founder Daniel Ek‚Äôs family office.

As Creative Ops Assistant you will be :

providing high-quality raw recordings on Unity (or APK) and editing these recordings on After Effects,
showing the most attractive moments of the game to catch the attention of users,
applying different scenarios and color designs on winner recordings to aim for better results,
analyzing data and generating a roadmap based on data results,
consistently brainstorming with the creative team.


Requirements

You are passionate about video editing based on storytelling,
You have basic knowledge of Unity for recording and After Effects for


editing videos,

You are analytical, strategic, and a team player,
You have a basic understanding of the KPI video metrics (CPI, spend),
You are responsible and can work autonomously,
You are open-minded and willing to learn new tools.


Benefits

Alice&Bob is developing the first universal, fault-tolerant quantum computer to solve the world‚Äôs hardest problems.

The quantum computer we envision building is based on a new kind of superconducting qubit: the Schr√∂dinger cat qubit. In comparison to other superconducting platforms, cat qubits have the astonishing ability to implement quantum error correction autonomously!

We are at the forefront of the quantum race, competing with tech giants such as Google or IBM. We are growing fast, securing 30 million USD of funding in 2022 to develop our unique technology.

We are 65 and counting, between physicists, PhDs, engineers and experienced business professionals, all united in reaching our ambitious goal. If you are an explorer, craving to challenge yourself and make quantum computing come true, come and join us!

Role

As an trainee at Alice & Bob, you will work in close relation with engineers and physicists involved in cutting-edge qubit experiments.

During this apprenticeship, you will be supporting the product team. One mission for the team is to improve the R&D process of the company, by making sure we keep learning as an organisation. This learning is solidified in a set of tools and database. These tools need to evolve to get maximum utilisation and usefulness.

For this role, you will:

Work directly with the PM in charge of these processes who is identifying the needs of our internal users.
Work with various R&D teams, understand their processes, and help identifying potential for evolution.
Implement required changes in our DB schematics.
Identify and setup the tools needed to improve DB usage.


Requirements

The job has been made for you if:

You are currently enrolled in a relevant degree, and are looking for a 1 or 2-year apprenticeship
You are a solution-oriented person, willing to take initiatives and push new ideas
You are fluent in English, with excellent written and oral communication skills
You are motivated to be part of a fast-growing startup, in a cutting-edge environment


Knowledge about the following is strongly recommended:

Python
Data analysis
Database administration
Web development
Product management skills, such as user experience and user research.


Icing on the cake:

Product management skills, such as user experience and user research.


Benefits

Joining Alice & Bob, you can expect the following:

1 day-off a month for interns, or 25 days off a year for trainees as per French Law
Half of transportation cost coverage (as per French law), or yearly allowance for the die-hard bicycle users
Meal vouchers with Swile, as well as access to a fully equipped kitchen


You will join of one of the most innovative startups in France at an early stage, to be part of a passionate and friendly team on its mission to build the first universal quantum computer!

We love to share and learn from one another, so you will be certain to innovate, develop new ideas, and have the space to grow.

Job_description:
Data Scientist apprentice M/F [Internship]

Forvia: Technology leader in the automotive industry

FORVIA comprises the complementary technology and industrial strengths of Faurecia and HELLA. With over 300 industrial sites and 77 R&D centers, 150,000 people, including more than 35,000 engineers across 40+ countries, FORVIA provides a unique and comprehensive approach to the automotive challenges of today and tomorrow.

Composed of 6 business groups with 24 product lines, and a strong IP portfolio of over 14,000 patents, FORVIA is focused on becoming the preferred innovation and integration partner for OEMS worldwide.

FORVIA aims to be a change maker committed to foreseeing and making the mobility transformation happen.

We are looking for a data scientist to join our team!

Faurecia is a global leader in automotive technology, providing innovative solutions for a fast-evolving industry.

The Faurecia Global Business Services (GBS) is the global organization in charge of end-to-end Business processes: Procure to Pay (P2P), Order to Cash (O2C) and Record to Report (R2R) processes.

In order to improve and simplify its processes, the GBS organization focuses on digitalization via RPA (Robotic Process Automation: UIPath), data and process mining solutions (Celonis, Foundry).

You will be working on challenges that matter

GBS organization has selected advanced IT solutions and is looking for a motivated Engineering IT school apprentice in order to boost its digital transformation.

He will be the GBS data scientist and will support the GBS digital transformation manager to define and to implement the process improvement solutions.

He/She will work collaboratively with the project management and IT teams. He will be located in Nanterre in the headquarters of Faurecia in a very dynamic and international environment.

Process mining / Celonis:


Celonis is a process mining tool that helps Faurecia to visualize, to analyse and to improve the Business processes.

In the context of implementation of Celonis, the data scientist will have to work with the system architect and with the Celonis project manager to adapt the Celonis data model (SQL) to Faurecia Business specificities.

Together with the Celonis project manager, the data scientists is at the heart of the Business problematics.

Data preparation / Foundry:


Palantir Foundry is a collaborative data science software platform for teams of data scientists, data analysts, engineers, product owners and data governance to explore the SAP tables of Faurecia.

It reimagines how people use data by removing the barriers between back-end data management and front-end data analysis. Foundry enables users with varying technical ability and deep subject matter expertise to work meaningfully with data. With Foundry, anyone can source, connect, and transform data into any shape they desire, then use it to take action.

We identify the Business need to address the use cases from the specification phase to the development of datasets , dashboards and alert systems in Foundry.

Thanks to his technical expertise, the data scientist will use Foundry to code the datasets (Pyspark) and to help boost the data mining efficiency within the GBS central team. His understanding of the Business problematics will be important to remain relevant with the technical solutions proposed.

What if it were you?

Skills And Experience

You are studying Computer / Data Science, master degree
You have an strong interest and excellent understanding of IT applications: data models, database design development, data preparation and data mining
Knowledge of SQL query / Python / Pyspark
Knowledge of SAP is a plus
Fluent in English; spoken and written is a must
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Good social skills combined with a down-to-earth attitude
Result driven, motivated, focused and persistent on improvement and quality
Business and customer-oriented mindset


So, are you coming on board?

As a responsible employer, Faurecia is committed to promoting diversity. This position is open to all.

Job_title: Media & Acquisition Apprentice - Display & Affiliates m/f/d
Job_description:
Company Description




WE ARE THE HOME OF MUSIC




From a French tech start-up created in 2007, Deezer has become one of the first French unicorns and the second largest independent music streaming platform in the world.




Now listed on #Euronext, growth is accelerating fueled by #Thepowerofmusic. Deezer is ideally positioned to play a key role in the continued development of the booming music streaming market. If you‚Äôre looking for an environment where you can grow and have an impact, this is the perfect time to join Deezer!




Our international and passionate teams are spreading the love for music, working to make Deezer the most personal and innovative music streaming service.




We believe music is about diversity & inclusion, multiculturalism and togetherness.




Ready to join the team? Listen: **Join Us**




Job Description




We are looking for a super-motivated apprentice to join our Paid Acquisition team and help us develop & optimise our digital media strategy.




You will be part of the Performance Marketing division, directly attached to the Display & Affiliates Lead, and will work with many internal & external teams (such as global media, data, brand & studio teams, as well as external advertisers, medias and tech solutions) on defining, executing, monitoring and reporting all Media & Acquisition operations.




What you will do:




Participate in delivering business:




Take part in developing and executing a digital acquisition strategy to gain new engaged paid users, on top of digital campaigns aimed at driving brand preference and consideration
Create, manage, optimise online acquisition campaigns on Display/Affiliates and also B2B2C partners & Participate in developing new acquisition streams: performance influencers campaigns, emailing, sms‚Ä¶




Participate in analyzing & reporting through data:




Develop and monitor metrics, provide weekly & monthly reporting to management as well as deep-dive analysis to uncover strategic insights and action plan
Improve acquisition user journeys (with product team) and campaign quality (with data/ analytics team) in order to increase acquired user Life Time Value (LTV)




Participate in brand notoriety and global Deezer influence




Create, manage and optimise online branding campaigns (with brand marketing team) for punctual branding operations
Stay abreast of the competitive landscape and develop new initiatives




This is an apprenticeship starting from September 2023




Qualifications




This role is excellent for a person with:




A first experience in online marketing, online advertising, traffic acquisition, and marketing analytics
First experience collaborating with product, data and/ or analytic teams on the technical tracking specifications for products, especially for mobile would be appreciated
Highly analytical with an expert level in Excel, good level in Looker Studio and in any reports / data visualisation tools & a passion for data report analysis, case studies‚Ä¶
Should be self-motivated and able to work effectively in an autonomous environment, proactive and persistent
Comfortable with multi-tasking in a very fast-paced work environment
Fluent in English




If you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you‚Äôd still be a great fit for this role in your application!




Additional Information




At Deezer, you can be your true self as we believe that #everyvoicematters. We strive to build an inclusive culture and foster a diverse environment. Because we care and want to ensure each employee feels welcome and safe at work, we continuously focus on fighting biases and helping diverse teams work well together through multiple learning opportunities, e-learnings and workshops right from the onboarding :




Regular Diversity & Inclusion internal and external talks
Dedicated employee work streams on Gender equity, Ethnicity & Culture, Disability and LGBTQ+
Multiple e-learnings and mandatory training sessions for all managers
English and French courses for all, so that everyone can connect and feel included




Beyond benefits like transportation, we offer you extra perks like:




A Deezer premium family account for free
Access to gym classes
Deezer parties several times a year and drinks every thursday
Allowance for sports, travelling and culture
Meal vouchers
Great offices are always located in dynamic and attractive districts, whether in Paris, London, Berlin or Sao Paulo!




If you want to learn more about life and culture at Deezer, please visit our Welcome to the Jungle page here!

Votre r√¥le et vos missions

The AXA Group, world leader in Financial Protection, supports and advises its individual and corporate customers at every life stage, providing them with the products and services that meet their insurance, personal protection, savings and wealth management needs.

Our areas of expertise are reflected in a range of products and services adapted to the needs of each client in three major business lines property-casualty insurance, life & savings, and asset management.

In 2019, present in 57 countries, the 160,000 employees and distributors of AXA were committed to serving 108 million clients.

AXA Corporate Center‚Äôs main missions are to

Steer the entities in order to ensure the coherence of the strategies, the consistency of the commercial approaches as well as the optimization of the risks and results;
Defining and coordinating Group policies, different transversal projects and standards, identifying and sharing best practices;
Supporting the entities in order to help them to grow, to develop their offer, their management and steering standards as well as their risk management.

The head office of AXA Group (GIE AXA), based in La D√©fense Majunga, gathers the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities according to the Group's strategy and is responsible for managing international projects. The headquarters is composed with over 850 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities).

About AXA Internal Audit

AXA Internal Audit exists to help the Board and Executive Management protect the assets, reputation and sustainability of the organisation by providing an independent and objective assurance activity designed to add value and improve the organisation‚Äôs operations.

It helps the organisation accomplish its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, control and governance processes, in line with recognised professional standards for internal audit.

Within AXA Internal Audit, a Data Analytics Centre of Excellence is in charge of developing the use of analytics to improve the effectiveness of auditing. The team‚Äôs activities range from developing analytic dashboards that automate tests, to advanced techniques such as text mining and process mining, covering the full spectrum of business processes within AXA.

Job Purpose

AXA Internal Audit‚Äôs Data Analytics team is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to support the development of audit analytics & reporting solutions

The primary mission of the Intern will be to design, build and maintain a new PowerBI dashboard connected to AXA Internal Audit‚Äôs global tool to enable audit management to better steer Internal Audit‚Äôs activities and produce richer insights from the global data set.
In addition, the Intern will also work with auditors during audit delivery, either by performing ad-hoc data analysis or developing shared audit analytic assets to automate common audit tests. Who we are




Genomines is a young biotechnology company based in Paris and Saclay, specialized in sustainable extraction of Nickel from plants. Our Team has already been active for 2 years, focussing mainly on research and development. The mission of Genomines is to usher in a new era of sustainable mining by using genetically enhanced plants to extract metals from soil (Agromining). Through synthetic biology and cutting-edge technology, we harness the power of nature to create bioengineered plants that can extract metals while decontaminating soils and creating cleaner lands for agriculture. Our ultimate goal is to become the world's first carbon-neutral mining group, using sustainable and environmentally friendly methods to extract the precious resources our society needs.




What We're Looking For




As the Chief of Staff at Genomines, you will hold a strategic and versatile role within our growing company. By closely collaborating with company leaders, you will be responsible for coordinating and implementing global strategies, improving operations, and managing key projects. We are seeking a multitasking "orchestra conductor" with expertise in functional, strategic, and operational areas. Our ideal candidate will also be able to handle high exposure while ensuring the confidentiality of our activities.




Role




This role requires agility, immense rigor, and adaptability. Depending on priorities, the Chief of Staff coordinates the preparation of board meetings, executive committee meetings, and management committee meetings. They filter the topics to be brought to the CEO's attention, handle internal and external communications, act as a representative for their supervisor, and establish connections with other managers in the company.A good Chief of Staff may not necessarily be an expert in all these disciplines but can leverage their extensive experience to work in an interdisciplinary manner.




Here are the main areas they will be involved in




Consulting: As a neutral person without hierarchical ties to other managers, you will act as a consultant to help other leaders make the best decisions to achieve the executive management goals
Strategy: You will provide ongoing operational support to the CEO and also contribute to the overall company strategy, drawing on your solid internal knowledge. You can contribute to the generation and creation of key performance indicators (KPIs) and track their progress
Information Management: You must understand the issues and expectations of each individual to ensure effective transmission and sharing of information. You will be one of the most well-informed individuals in the company and will need to ensure smooth internal communication with executive members, clients, and partners
Operations: Your tasks will adapt to the company's existing strengths and the CEO's agenda. You will play an exploratory role in evaluating new business ideas and participate in structuring new teams. Depending on the company's needs, you may also contribute to financial analysis and occasional HR missions




The Chief of Staff must fulfill several main tasks, all aimed at improving the efficiency of time management, information, and decision-making processes.




Responsibilities




Lead and manage strategic projects of the company
Monitor and track the overall performance of the company
Define target processes and, if necessary, deploy tools to optimize performanceIdentify and define recruitment needs
Participate in strategic topics such as fundraising, acquisitions, etc
Education & Background




You have a degree from a top business or engineering school
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in strategy consulting firms, M&A or other highly analytical jobs
Previous experience in a Chief of Staff role, preferably in a biotechnology company or a fast-growing startup
Essential Skills




Ability to work independently while being an effective team member
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines
Strong analytical skills and ability to use data for strategic decision-making
Proactive problem-solving and informed decision-making abilities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present information clearly and concisely
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks

Excellent leadership skills and the ability to influence and inspire others
Resilience and stress management
Teamwork and collaboration

Leading role in a fast-growing, promising startup with high international exposure

Establish development strategy and budgeting for France in coordination with Country Head
Prepare offers to customers
Lead commercial and legal negotiations with land owners and customers
Recruit, grow and train development team in line with the sustainable growth of development activities in France
Work with senior executives to create investment opportunity/cases for developments and investments in France as they occur; then drive "deals" through to completion post Investment Committee ratification, carrying out all the activities required to such purposes, including (but not limited to):
Source and develop BTS and other possibly speculative developments across France
Identify and qualify land plots suitable to sustain the development strategy of P3 in France
Grow and exploit the existing network of brokers and consultants
Identify and address potential customer targets on the market, qualify opportunities and prepare offers
Prepare and get approved Heads-Up-Memo and Investment Committee Memo including Development appraisal, cash flow, SWOT analysis and market data
Ensure that all developments are delivered on time, on budget and profitably
Coordinate internal and external resources (architects, lawyers, finance analyst, local authorities, General Contractors, etc.) to achieve successfully end to end all projects including assistance with FIDIC negotiations
Collaborate with technical and other departments of P3 (legal, finance...) on assigned developments, coordinate and liaise with other country teams inside P3
