Work with Business Development and Marketing teams to enforce P3 development strategy
Monitor competitors` and customers` activities as well as the logistics real estate market and trends
Collaborate and take the lead on corporate initiatives impacting development
On a needed basis, participate in searching, interviewing and hiring new employees


What we offer you:

Top class technical and soft skills training
Leadership team of experienced professionals
Encouraging environment of fast growth and ambitions
Independence and high level of responsibility
Attractive salary and annual bonus based on performance
Home office and flexible working hours

Founded in Marseille in 1966 by Pierre Bellon, Sodexo is the global leader in services that improve Quality of Life, with annual revenues of ‚Ç¨21.1 billion and more than 400,000 employees operating in 53 countries.

Sodexo serves 100 million consumers each day through its unique combination of On-site Services, Benefits & Rewards Services and Personal & Home Services.




Sodexo provides clients an integrated offering developed over more than 50 years of experience: from foodservices, reception, maintenance and cleaning to facilities and equipment management; from services and programs fostering employees' engagement to solutions that simplify and optimize their mobility and expenses management, to in-home assistance and concierge services.




Sodexo is also a global leader of the Live events hospitality experience and contributes to the success of prestigious events such as the Super Bowl, the Tour de France, Roland Garros and the upcoming 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games in Paris. In addition, Sodexo operates exceptional venues including the restaurants of the Eiffel Tower (Jules Verne, Madame Brasserie), the Pr√© Catelan and the boats and yachts of the Seine River.




Sodexo's success and performance are founded on its strong entrepreneurial spirit, independence, its sustainable business model and its ability to continuously develop and engage its employees throughout the world. Through our EVP and its support of Stop Hunger, Sodexo supports skill-based volunteering for the benefits of local communities in need and international nonprofit organizations.




Sodexo promotes the fulfilment of our employees and contributes to the economic, social and environmental development of the communities with which we work.

Our recruitment teams are trained in recruitment without discrimination, including people with disabilities. Our managers are also made aware of these issues and are our first ambassadors on these subjects.




You will work at the head office of the Sodexo group, located in Issy-Les-Moulineaux, accessible from Paris by RER C, Tram T2 from La D√©fense and Porte de Versailles or metro line 12.







MISSIONS




Group marketing team is led by a Chief Brands & Marketing Officer, within Sodexo Growth & Commercial department. The Global Marketing Hub includes Brand Owners, a Head of Marketing Center of Excellence (CoE), and Head of Marketing Insights.

The mission of the Global Marketing Hub is to leverage a brand / marketing culture and drive a marketing expertise for a brand-led model across segments and geographies. The team interacts with stakeholders from many functions (IS&T, Strategy, Digital, Legal, Procurement, Operations‚Ä¶), countries in the organization as well as a a few external providers to support marketing communiy in the regions and segments.




The Group CCX team (within Marketing CoE Department) defines the global framework for the measurement of client experience (B2B) and consumer experience (B2C) and leads and owns the management of the global CX platform. They also set CX targets (Net Promoter Score and CSAT) as part of Sodexo strategic KPIs. They work closely with marketing teams in regions/countries and segments on building and implementing their CX roadmap to ensure consistency. They also collaborate with the teams owing other Sodexo systems (CRM, Global Data Platform, Performance dashboards, apps etc.) to make sure CX data is available to flow into other relevant systems. The objective is to encourage the teams to move the needle from measurement towards experience improvement.




Your key responsibilities will include:

CCX KPIs collection and reporting
Compile, analyze CCX data and create reports
Contribute to CCX community management (via Yammer, support CCX Steering Team meetings etc.)
Support roll-out of the Global Client and Consumer Experience measurement platform (InMoment) across all different regions and segments: training, tests, coverage tracking, global overview of survey waves
User management of Sodexo self-service CX platform (DIY Surveys)
Create Ad-hoc surveys for CCX measurement
Support CCX Director on organizing Steering Committees
Assistance and training to users of Sodexo self-service CX platform (DIY Surveys)
Design of content to promote CCX and its related topics
Interact as needed with internal support functions (IS&T, Legal) and with external CX providers (InMoment, HappyOrNot etc.)
Any other assistance that Client and Consumer Experience Director or Global Marketing Hub may need




WHY SODEXO ?




You will be fully integrated into the life of the team
You will attend all the coordination meetings and you will thus have an overview of the activity of a Group Marketing team
You will participate in rich and empowering missions, in an international environment
Sodexo offers a training course adapted to your needs, in particular to develop your skills
Restaurant pass, partial reimbursement of transport tickets




PROFILE




Master degree in relevant fields such as Marketing, Business Administration, Market Intelligence, Statistics
Passionate about CCX topics. A first experience in CX or Marketing or Data Analytics would be a plus
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), experience with advanced Excel data functionality such as vlookup, pivot tables, & solver
Highly numerate, with strong analytical skills
Experience in statistics, both descriptive statistics (PCA, MFA, MDS, ‚Ä¶) and inferential statistics (general linear regressions, regression trees, ‚Ä¶) is a plus
Experience with scripting languages such as R or Python is a plus but it is not a requirement
Ability to synthesize and present data in a user-friendly manner and to translate complex data into actionable opportunities for the business
Experience with data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI‚Ä¶) is a plus
Good presentation and communication skills (both oral and written)
Structured, rigorous
Ability to adapt to new situations and learn quickly
Autonomous, proactive and solution-oriented
Curious, engaged, eager to learn
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish collaborative working relationships with individuals at varying levels within the organization
Fluent/native English and French (compulsory); Spanish would be a plus
Previous international exposure is a plus

Job_description:
At Shipup, our mission is to create a seamless, proactive, and branded post-purchase experience for online retailers. üõçüõí




If you‚Äôre used to shopping online, you‚Äôve probably already had your patience tested by an order that had multiple incidents. For online retailers, a poor post-purchase experience is a costly nightmare: it drags down customer satisfaction, online reputation, and repeat purchase rate while inflating the volume of complaints to customer support.




Shipup is a SaaS company that tracks the orders and deliveries of online retailers in real-time in order to create a seamless, branded, and reassuring post-purchase experience (proactive and live notifications, customized tracking pages, customer surveys at delivery‚Ä¶). Thanks to Shipup, ordering online is less stressful. Online shoppers are happier, complain less, and buy again more.




Shipup works with more than 400 brands in Europe and North America, some of which are very successful digitally native brands (Cheerz, Blissim, Withings, Feed., Le Petit Ballon, Respire, Aime, Ssense, Ys√©, A.P.C. ‚Ä¶) while others are larger, more traditional accounts (Leclerc, Carrefour, Go Sport, Yves Rocher‚Ä¶).




Our company culture & values




‚úä Ownership

We‚Äôre on a mission to help organisations contextualise the environment they operate in.

At Echo Analytics, we work with companies from all over the world. We create, combine, and convert thousands of public and private datasets into meaningful geospatial insights and provide the most accurate commercial Point of Interest (POI) product and mobility insights available in Europe.

Tasks

What do we do?

We provide companies with fuel to power their products with high-quality geospatial-based datasets. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build the most comprehensive geospatial datasets and insights available in Europe and rapidly expanding.

Echo partners with companies from multiple industries such as retail, mobility, smart-cities, real-estate, advertising, market-research, and financial services.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a Data Analyst to be in charge of all the data deliveries (data extraction or data analysis) from our Data Lake to our customers.

To be successful as a Data Analyst, you should have prior data experience, be able to collaborate with team members, be a strategic problem-solver and an inspiring data visionary. You also need to have business or client experience.

The opportunity

Our stack runs on Google Cloud Platform. You will work in an environment made up of Data Lakes (BigQuery, etc.), data streaming platforms (Pub/Sub, Dataflow..), orchestration and scheduling platforms (Airflow), modern deployment (Terraform), and management platforms (GCP).

You will manage all the data extraction in coordination with the product and customer success team.

This is a unique opportunity to be part of a highly promising start-up in its early stage and play a vital role in establishing and expanding its market.

Your Role at Echo

We‚Äôre currently scaling the team and hiring talents to grow faster. You will be responsible to :

Understand the product/customers requirements and specify the strategy to extract the data
Provide visibility on the deliveries to the business
Provide data analysis to obtain the requested data (raw visit, dwell time, cross visitation,...) using data sciences such as normalisation, extrapolation‚Ä¶

Asklepios BioPharmaceutical, Inc. (AskBio) is a leading, clinical-stage gene therapy company founded in 2001 based on the work of adeno-associated virus (AAV) gene therapy visionary and pioneer, Jude Samulski, PhD. Since that time, our commitment to developing life-saving medicines that can potentially cure genetic diseases has never wavered.

At AskBio, we‚Äôve built a foundation of therapeutic programs, AAV manufacturing and a rich portfolio of patented technology. Our therapeutic focus includes neuromuscular, central nervous system, cardiovascular and metabolic diseases with clinical trials underway for Pompe disease, Parkinson‚Äôs disease, and congestive heart failure. Our gene therapy platform includes Pro10‚Ñ¢, an industry-leading proprietary cell line manufacturing process, and an extensive AAV capsid and promoter library.

We became a wholly-owned, independently operated, subsidiary of Bayer AG in late 2020 as a cornerstone of its newly formed Cell & Gene Therapy (CGT) platform. Our global headquarters is in Research Triangle Park, NC. Additionally, we have significant operations in Philadelphia, PA, Columbus, OH, Scotland, France, and Spain.

Our vision: Pioneering science to create transformative molecular medicines.

Our mission: Lead innovative science and drive clinical outcomes to transform people's lives.

Our principles:

Advance innovative science by pushing boundaries.
Bring transformative therapeutics to patients in need.
Provide an environment for employees to reach their fullest potential.


Our values:

Be a Pioneer. We are not afraid of the impossible and to innovate to make gene therapies accessible to those in need.
Cultivate Collaboration. Strive to be the best teammate, actively listen, openly communicate, and embrace diverse points of view.
Embrace Responsibility. We are humbled by the enormity of our mission. We hold a relentless commitment to advance science and clinical outcomes for our patients, families, and caregivers.
Raise the Bar. Continuously drive improvements and efficiencies. Seek and provide constructive feedback. Have a bias for learning and action.
Act with Uncompromising Integrity. Be honest, transparent, and committed to doing what‚Äôs right in every situation. Make clear commitments and follow through.


About the role:

This position is based in Paris (Paris Brain institute) France.

The area of interest will be the central nervous system (CNS), with local gene transfer into the CNS and/or systemic gene delivery. Therapeutic strategy is gene transfer approaches using viral vectors (AAV), in various models of neurodegenerative diseases.

the candidate will perform animal studies and execute techniques of gene delivery in animal models and mastering various ex vivo techniques (Immunohistochemistry, Western Blot, Elisa, MSD, qPCR, Microscopy), analysis of data, and presentations of the results (reports, team meeting‚Ä¶).

Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

In vivo experimentation in mouse models
Perform mouse necropsies, tissue dissection and blood collection/preservation/processing
Design, perform, develop biological sampling by various ex vivo techniques and fine analysis of the samples using a panel of arrays (Western Blot, qPCR, ELISA, immunohistochemistry, microscopy analysis, etc)
Maintain comprehensive understanding of the current project, timelines, and reporting to the direct manager
Author development reports, lab protocols, SOPs, study plan
Hight autonomy and flexibility to collaborate with other projects and internal tasks/missions in the team (cross-disciplinary)
Interaction with CROs, external platforms and AskBio internal teams to ensure progress of the project(s) in hands


Required Education and Experience:

Master‚Äôs degree in biology or equivalent.
Experience with animal experimentation (Animal experimentation certificate)


Preferred Experience and Skills:

Self-motivated, organized, capable of working independently as well as in a collaborative/team environment.
Ability to generate high quality data for presentations and publications.
Good judgment and innovation to achieve a solution within standard practices and procedures.
Ability to prioritize, organize, and multi-task among multiple projects and work independently in a fast-paced, highly interactive environment.

Job_function: Management de projet et Technologies de l‚Äôinformation

Job_description:
About Us

Symrise is a global supplier of fragrances, flavors, food, nutrition, and cosmetic ingredients. Its clients include manufacturers of perfumes, cosmetics, food and beverages, pharmaceuticals and producers of nutritional supplements and pet food.

Its sales of ‚Ç¨ 3.8 billion in the 2021 fiscal year make Symrise a leading global provider. Headquartered in Holzminden, Germany, the Group is represented by more than 100 locations in Europe, Africa, the Middle East, Asia, the United States and Latin America.

Symrise works with its clients to develop new ideas and market-ready concepts for products that form an integral part of everyday life. Economic success and corporate responsibility are inextricably linked as part of this process.

Symrise ‚Äì always inspiring more‚Ä¶

Your Role

We are looking for a talented and experienced BI Analyst to join our Data team in the Taste Nutrition and Health segment. You will be responsible for providing key reports and dashboards, supporting key users, and participating in the global BI project.

You will also be required to address group needs in terms of data coming from legacy and local systems. Your primary objective will be to provide platforms to the users to report KPIs per domain.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with various stakeholders such as finance, sales, and operations to understand their data requirements and provide them with actionable insights.
Create and maintain BI dashboards and reports to support business decision-making.
Participate in the definition and execution of the new global BI platform.
Ensure that the data provided to the business is accurate, timely, and meets quality standards.
Address group needs in terms of data coming from legacy and local systems.
Develop and maintain data models and ensure that they are aligned with business requirements.
Identify data quality issues and work with stakeholders to resolve them.
Work with the IT team to ensure that data architecture and infrastructure are optimized for reporting and analytics.


About You

You should have experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Microstrategy, as well as new big data technologies.
Experience with SQL or Oracle dbb is a must.
You should have excellent communication skills, with the ability to speak English fluently.
You should be able to work collaboratively with stakeholders across various business units.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are necessary for this role.
You should have the ability to prioritize workload and deliver work on time with a high level of accuracy.
Familiarity with cloud-based BI platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure is a plus.
Knowledge of data visualization best practices and techniques is highly desirable.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes is preferred.


Our Offer

Become part of our open and transparent culture. It will give you the opportunity to flourish and to develop inspiring experiences that contribute to the health and well-being of consumers in 160 countries around the world. Putting our employees in the focus fuels our strong company growth above market rates and makes us an excellent place to develop your career.

Come join us and embark on a fascinating journey with Symrise.

If you feel that you fit the above criteria, then please apply by using our online application system. Your application will be treated confidentially.
Industries: Fabrication de produits alimentaires et boissons

Verimatrix is a CyberSecurity software company focused on protecting critical customer applications. Our customers use our software to protect mobile applications that are core to their business and customer interaction. The Customer Experience Manager (CEM) is a critical role to working with our customers using our XTD Security software in post-sale interactions. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (other duties may be assigned):

Ensure that the customer is using the Verimatrix XTD software to provide key inputs into the CISO‚Äôs reporting dashboard.
Work across teams internally (sales, product management, technical support and professional services) in Verimatrix to achieve required goals. The CEM owns responsibility for customers achieving goals and driving internal awareness of customer progress.
Manage a subset of the Verimatrix customer base along with other CEMs in the Customer Experience organization.




REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:




Solid background in customer management with a heavy emphasis on CyberSecurity software
Experience interacting with the Chief Information Security Organization within enterprise organizations spanning the financial, healthcare, high tech and other vertical customer markets
Familiarity with Cyber Industry standards such as MITRE ATT&CK, PCI, GDPR etc.

Prior experience as Technical Account Management, Customer Success or Pre-Sales in the CyberSecurity software industry is required
Experience within the application security market is preferred but not required.
Solid presentation and communication skills in English

NAX




We are NAX, the New Asset Exchange, a global fintech and venture building pioneer with headquarters in Manhattan Beach, California, USA and a presence across North America, Europe and Asia. We build new ventures in partnership with the world‚Äôs leading institutions. With our proven method, our technology solutions and our diverse team of management consultants, experienced entrepreneurs, venture capitalists & industry experts we create, launch and scale new high-growth companies.




NAX Group maintains its headquarters in Manhattan Beach, CA and has offices in Silicon Valley, New York, Tampa, Frankfurt, Munich, and Paris.




NAX is always searching for entrepreneurs, innovators, technologists, and business builders to join our global team. We provide an innovative culture and the unique opportunity to commercialize corporate-backed, high social impact products alongside the world‚Äôs leading corporations. Join us and help build the products and markets of tomorrow.




Job Summary:




As Director, are a versatile business professional and an experienced leader with the ability to produce high quality work products yourself, as well as from your colleagues. You know how to overcome adversity, can simplify the complex, and can bring creativity to ambiguity to create where others would likely be lost or wayward. You‚Äôre someone people look to for guidance. You are a trusted leader in the company and can work well with others to deliver impact and build a valuable business.




Your focus will be on building and leading NAX ventures and the successful launch of NAX products, at times leading project plans or venture development then facilitating a smooth transition to supporting the Development team efforts to do so. Coordination with the Securitization and Technology teams is also a must. As a leader at NAX, a growth-stage business, you will have a direct role in building the company which may include working with advisors and investors from time to time on major corporate initiatives. The organization will support you in these efforts including a team that may include direct or indirect reports.




We value and reward both strong individual performance and extending your impact through sound teamwork. As an experienced addition to our team, we expect you to take a few junior colleagues under your wing, helping them to make meaningful contributions and develop themselves to follow in your tracks.







What you get to do:




Owns the planning phase through to execution/ early stand-up of a new venture project from inception to launch
Serve as a voice to clarify the expectations of customers on new problems and solutions. Using human-centered design principles, you will prepare/ conduct primary user research, present target user personas, market sizing, journey maps to identify and prioritize user pains, unmet market needs and design principles
Uses empathy as an excavation tool, to divine the problem beneath the problem; facilitate ideation with creativity and courage to uncover best possible range of solutions against user pains/ market needs
Ability to create and test prototypes, MVPs, launch beta pilots and proofs of concept development as a means to test, learn and validate or pivot to arrive at most viable products and business models for commercialization
Mentor members of the core project team, creating a high-performance, innovative, collaborative, continuous learning culture
Drive quality deliverables for the work and embrace data-driven decision-making and diversity of perspectives to get there
Own the P&L and be responsible for the success of multi-million dollar ventures, in a capacity equivalent to the CEO, GM or board member of the venture
Lead multidisciplinary teams to complete explorations and bringing venture partners into and through the process of creating minimum viable businesses
Establish resource needs and coordinate with HR, Development, Technology, and Securitization teams to staff or hire the founding teams for ventures
Develop and deliver strategies and roadmaps for implementation that produce successful initiatives
Establish KPIs to demonstrate progress toward deliverables
Translate complex objectives into simple presentations and work plans
Inspire, manage and coach teams in executing project deliverables and priorities
Organize, prepare and drive meetings with external and internal stakeholders
Manage the pipeline and report on the progress of team deliverables, opportunities and strategy to internal and external stakeholders




What you bring to the team:




Empathetic, tenacious, resilient, nonconforming lender who uses humor and vision to help shape a better world. Someone who wants to bring others along for the ride and is willing to both learn and teach
Strategic thinker with the ability to build and execute innovative products, combined with the tactical ability to execute simultaneously against multiple competing priorities
Strong project management skills. Must be able to provide structure, be proactive, navigate ambiguity, be flexible to change, manage stakeholders, hold others accountable and create appropriate professional collateral (e.g., decks, white papers, design briefs, project plans, etc.)
Leading cross-functional teams and extracting the best from each team member, ability to leverage change management best practices to mitigate resistance, Track record of taking action ‚Äúgetting things done‚Äù
Exceptional communication, active listening, critical thinking, and presentation skills
Passionate about solving the right problems, by leveraging the right questions, enjoys learning about people, following trends, attending events, etc
Ability to work and manage projects independently. Ability to work without supervision. Feels comfortable with broad latitude for decision-making
Ability to apply broad/ diverse expertise or unique knowledge and professional concepts to develop resolutions to critical issues
Ability to network with key contacts outside their own area of expertise and create formal networks with key decision-makers
Self-aware, possess a learner‚Äôs growth mindset. Continuously seeks and provides feedback, open to new perspectives, and remains coachable
Proficiency with Google suite, especially Slides & Sheets




Education and Experience:




8+ years of experience with strategy development, business planning, venture building or equivalent
Experience doing market research and analysis to develop the following:
market sizing, customer segmentation, go-to-market strategy, competitive analysis, regulatory strategy, product roadmap, customer journey, right-to-win, etc.
Ability to build high-level financial models from the ground up
A background in product prototyping and testing with design or product development expertise
Ability to dive into research and synthesize findings in a concise, thoughtful & organized way
Track record of building/launching new products, businesses or teams/divisions. Demonstrate ownership of complex projects or work from inception to delivery.
Bachelor's degree in Design, Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Architecture or equivalent




Total Rewards and Benefits

NAX Group offers a hybrid work environment and flexible unlimited PTO. We prioritize ongoing employee development and provide our employees with their own LinkedIn Learning account and access to over 17,000 courses. Other benefits include 401k, health, dental, and vision insurance. Our dress code is casual.







Life at NAX

We are a forward thinking organization, and believe that great people deserve a great place to work. This includes generous compensation and benefits. We desire a full commitment from our team members, and we show the same commitment in return.




We are headquartered in beautiful Manhattan Beach, CA and offer a fun and collaborative work environment: our offices are pet friendly, and we host regular town halls, company lunches (UberEats for remote employees!), trivia nights, beach outings, monthly birthday gatherings, and other scheduled events. We offer a wide variety of snacks and beverages to enjoy when in office as well.




EEOC Statement




NAX Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.




This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job_title: Data Engineer (full time, all seniority levels) - QuantumBlack
Job_description:
Qualifications

Master‚Äôs degree in quantitative field like computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics or related field required; advanced degree advantageous
Experience building data pipelines in production and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python, Scala, or similar languages
Familiarity with the latest OSS, cloud, container, query languages and database technologies
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Commercial client-facing or senior stakeholder management experience a plus
Fluency in both English and French
Willingness to travel up to 60%


What You'll Do

As a Data Engineer with the Paris office...

You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organisations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

See our video A Day in the Life of a Data Engineer

Role Responsibilities

Work with our clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches
Acquire, ingest, and process data from multiple sources and systems into Big Data platforms
Understanding, assessing and mapping the data landscape.
Maintaining our Information Security standards on the engagement.
Collaborate with our data scientists to map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in their advanced analytical models.
Defining the technology stack to be provisioned by our infrastructure team.
Building modular pipeline to construct features and modelling tables.
Use new and creative techniques to deliver impact for our clients as well as internal R&D projects.


What You‚Äôll Learn

No project is ever the same ‚Äì we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities across the region.

How successful projects on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end pipelines.
Build products alongside the Core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations.
Be focused on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data by working alongside the Data Science team which focuses on modelling the data.
Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment.

You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.

Real-World Impact ‚Äì No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership ‚Äì We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture ‚Äì Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
Striving for Diversity ‚Äì With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.

Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimising a Formula1 car‚Äôs performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture

Healthcare Efficiency ‚Äì We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagnostic testing as a key indicator of admissions breaches.
Environmental Impact ‚Äì We designed and built the first data-driven application for a state of the art centre of excellence in urban innovation by collecting real-time data from environmental sensors across London and deploying proprietary analytics to find unexpected patterns in air pollution.
Product Development ‚Äì We worked with the CEO of an elite automotive organisation to reduce the 18-month car development timeframe by improving processes, designs and team structures.

Please note that the recruiting process for this role can take up to 5 weeks, together with the necessary preparation - we advise you to take this into consideration when thinking about the timing of your application.

Who You'll Work With

Based in Paris and working across the region, as a consultant data engineer you will work closely with our clients, data scientists and all types of McKinsey consultants to curate problem specific datasets that feed directly into our machine learning and modelling approach.

This hybrid client-facing/technical role will allow you to use state of the art technologies to solve highly impactful business problems, whilst also leveraging your strong communication skills to convey complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences.

Who You Are

This position is for a data engineer (all seniority levels) with strong intrinsic technical ability and an aptitude to solving complex problems using technology.

A core value at QuantumBlack is fusion and at the heart of our multi-disciplinary teams is the belief that the sum of individual parts will always be less than the impact of the entire team. You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritising impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Trust between colleagues is paramount here ‚Äì you are an individual who can always be trusted to work in the best interests of all colleagues and to achieve the best outcome for QuantumBlack and our clients. You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion with others.

Job_description:
INSEAD brings together people, cultures and ideas from around the world to educate leaders who transform business and society. As a mission-driven school, INSEAD focuses on three values: open, rigorous, and entrepreneurial. Founded on a commitment to innovation in management education, INSEAD was the first international business school, introduced the first one-year MBA, pioneered company specific executive education, and has developed a unique fully integrated multi-continent campus structure. Today, no more than 10% of the incoming MBA class comes from one country ‚Äì we truly are the Business School for the World.







We are currently looking for a Business Development Assistant to join Executive Education department in our Fontainebleau campus. This is a full time, permanent position.

The Business Development Assistant will support the corporate partnership teams in Europe.

S/He will implement and coordinate all aspects of the administrative duties for the corporate client portfolios.




The Business Development Assistant will be responsible for critical tasks :

Working with corporate partnership teams in Europe as their administrative support person
Scheduling of complex meetings/calls with clients or prospects, using various technologies (MSteams, Zoom, Webex).
Booking and preparation of meeting rooms.
Support when answering to RfPs.
Conducting initial company research (datamonitor, report)
Working on procurement platforms.
Raising Purchase Orders.
Helping with the formatting, review of PowerPoint documents/proposals.
Inputting data and producing reports on Salesforce
Getting custom programme contracts signed (via docusign) and follow through, internal distribution of signed contracts, follow through with clients on getting signatures




The successful candidate should have the following profile :

Interest in INSEAD, executive education and the custom programme activity
Ability to work independently and within a team of BDAs in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work in a multi-culture environment and prestige business school.
Extremely well organized and structured.
Strong attention to details, multitasking
Bilingual English/French (main working language is English).
Culturally sensitive and comfortable working in a multicultural international organization.

Job_title: Product Data Analyst (Paris, New York, San Francisco)
Job_description:
Meet Gorgias, the customer service platform designed for ecommerce merchants, and built to provide amazing experience to shoppers at scale on Shopify, BigCommerce, and Magento. Our product empowers merchants to manage all their customer service in one place over email, live chat, voice, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and SMS.

Everything we do is for our customers, and we‚Äôre currently serving over 12,000+ ecommerce merchants, including : Steve Madden, Timbuk2, Decathlon, and Sports Illustrated. They love us for our innovative product, our focus on their ecommerce needs, and, of course, our lightning-fast customer service response time.

We raised $25 million in our Series B round in December 2020 and $30 million in our Series C round in 2022. We more than doubled in size in every meaningful way: annual recurring revenue, the size of our customer base, and the size of our Gorgias team, for starters.

We‚Äôre still growing fast and looking for new teammates who want to grow with us.

About The Team

Growth Ops is a cross-functional team that works hand-in-hand with all of the other Growth teams (Marketing, Sales, Partnerships, Success & Support, Product) as well as interacts with the dev teams.
Our core mission is to maximize Gorgias‚Äôs impact by empowering our stakeholders to make data-backed decisions by providing them with accurate data & assisting them in driving insights.


The team itself is composed of three main squads:

Business Intelligence, split into 2 squads, Go-to-market & Customer Operations, who partner with the rest of the company by providing insights on performance and by giving them the data resources needed to achieve their goals.
Core Ops is responsible for the management and maintenance of the Data Platform, including all data pipelines and assets. Their primary goal is to ensure that accurate and easily accessible data is provided at scale to end users.


Our current data analytics stack mainly includes:

Data ingestion: Airbyte, Segment, Fivetran
Storage: BigQuery
Transformation: DBT
BI tools: Periscope, push.ai
Data Activation: Hightouch, Segment, Airplane
Data Monitoring: Datafold, Metaplane
GCP products: Compute Engine, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, PubSub
CI/CD: GitHub Action & GitLab
Project management: Linear, Notion


About The Role

(The position is also open in New York and San Francisco)
You will join the Customer Ops team and support the growth of the Automation add-on ü§ñ The Automation add-on gathers all the features enabling our merchants to automate Customer Support. It‚Äôs the second product we‚Äôve launched and it‚Äôs showing tremendous growth: our customers love it! üî•
You will be the primary Data partner of the Automation Tribe, a kick-ass team of 20+ people that loves automation & is customer-obsessed. This is a golden opportunity for constantly influencing the short and long term strategy of the Tribe by combining analytical results and product knowledge to drive strategic decisions.
As such, you will work hand in hand with the Automation Tribe Lead Valentin and will be his analytical and data counterpart. This is your chance to collaborate directly with an experienced leader on a daily basis.
More precisely, you will:
Deliver key insights by analyzing product features, adoption behaviors and retention trends. üí° Is the launch of this new feature a success? How to drive product adoption among targeted merchants? Why do we see a drop in performance of this feature? Here are some questions you will answer by combining product knowledge and analytics.
Create / monitor data products to track metrics using SQL and dbt to empower the Tribe in their data-driven initiatives.
Contribute to the overall Tribe strategy with Valentin: switching from long-run Tribe impact (contribution to the roadmap) to day-to-day tangible impact (ad-hoc projects) ensures a healthy balance which makes the job always exciting.
Partner with other teams to support their initiatives (experiments & a/b testing analyses with Success or Marketing, data formatting with Engineer to ensure easy-to-use data, etc.).
Educate and share knowledge to stakeholders via data townhalls and office hours.
You‚Äôll have the opportunity to collaborate and sometime lead cross-functional initiatives. Some examples of projects:
Build a reliable data product that centralizes key adoption metrics for cross-team stakeholders.
Implement a fluid and standardized process to track the impact of new features/projects.
Focus on key product analytics (analysis of churn, adoption, automation rate evolution, etc.) and potentially build a playbook to automate recurrent analytics and drive enablement for other teams.
Other cross-team projects such as revamping pricing strategy (how to optimize our pricing model under revenue maximization and churn minimization constraints?).

If you like working with data, excited by product analytics and growth, and motivated by having an impact on the business where you work, we want to hear from you! üôÇ

Who You Are

You have 2+ years of hands-on experience working with data.
You are very data-driven, with strong problem-solving skills: you have experience analyzing complex, large-scale data sets to make decisions based on data.
You are proficient in SQL and have technical experience with analytical tools.
You are comfortable in dynamic & fast-moving work environment and able to switch gears as necessary. Things move fast with the Automation add-on extended tribe üòÑ
You have strong synthesis and communication skills: cross-team communication is at least as important as analytical skills as you‚Äôll often partner with less technical teams to transform insights into action items ü§ù
You have a growth mindset: you proactively evaluate your own performance and actively seek opportunities to develop your skills üöÄ
Knowledge of dbt is a big plus.
Previous startup or consulting experience is a plus.
You are autonomous, looking to build your team as a Data Analytics Manager.


Perks and Benefits

üèñÔ∏è 5-week vacation plus 2 weeks RTT (We follow each country's appropriate PTO Laws)
ü§ï Paid sick leave
üß∏ Paid parental leave (16 weeks)

üìö Get up to ‚Ç¨2000 of learning material per year (includes books, courses, and training sessions that are easily identified and linked with your job scope. This also covers individual coaching!)
ü•∞ Every quarter, we organize an online company-wide summit to discuss where we‚Äôre going and strengthen social bonds. Once per year we organize offsite team retreats and company retreats! (Here is the photo album from our last company retreat in Mexico in 2022, when we were a total of 200 people!)


Why join us?

üöÄ We're among the fastest-growing startups in the eCommerce ecosystem

ü¶Ñ We've built an extremely efficient go-to-market engine

ü•á Work with a talented team you'll learn a lot from

üôè Join a company where automation and good & clean data are core beliefs shared by all

üé• Here is an interview with one of our team member‚Äôs experiences from our most recent company retreat to Cancun!

More Cool Things To Know About Gorgias... üòÅ

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

Master's degree in Business School or University, with a strong interest in E-commerce

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth

Job Description

CDD of 6 months

This position is part of the Distributed Generation Direction of TotalEnergies Renewables business unit, dedicated to the development, construction, operation and financing of B2B solar projects all over the world. Projects are solar on-site installations for self-consumption with a size between 1MW and 20 MW and installed on the sites of its commercial and industrial customers.

TotalEnergies has a plan to have 35 GW of renewables generation capacities in operation by 2025 and 100 GW by 2030. Of this, 3 GW is planned to be achieved in 2025 by the Distributed Generation (DG) Business Unit (on-site solar) and 9 GW by 2030.

Being part of the Marketing and Commercial Performance direction, at the headquarter, as a PowerBI Data Analyst you will produce/update PowerBI reports on Sales Performance that will be shared worldwide. Sales Performance dashboards analyze the sale opportunities pipeline and key metrics such as stages conversion time and conversion rates. Sales dashboards have also to be developed to forecast sales and to give useful KPIs for regional or country sales managers to drive their sales teams, but also to give useful KPIs for sales to drive their activity.

Your main missions are the following:

Contribute to the definition of dashboards content:

Run working groups to gather information needs by all functions concerned by sales (Economics, Finance, ‚Ä¶).
Propose data treatments and dashboards layouts to deliver the information.


Data analysis and combination

Find automations to correct quality-of-data issues (missing, incorrect.)
Design automated data treatments
Design robust calculation methods
Define statistic laws applying to KPI calculations and calculate confidence intervals for the KPIs that can only be estimated / partially calculated.


Dashboard design and publishing

Use PowerBi to treat data and produce the dashboards
Design dashboards that can be refreshed automatically daily

You master PowerBI
You have minimum 2 years of relevant experience.

Job_description:
>Based in: Paris (possibility of partial remote - min. 8 days per month)




>Contract: Full-time




>Manager: Cl√©ment

>Package: ‚Ç¨45K to ‚Ç¨55K (it depends on the profile, Confirmed or Senior)




About Worklife




Worklife is a Fin/HR tech company reinventing employee benefits. All of your benefits are gathered on ONE app and combined with ONE payment card to facilitate their use.




Employee benefits are often undervalued, lack visibility, and no longer meet the real needs of employees or the company. If you want to be part of this change and join a growing company, consider joining us!




Opportunities




We help our clients implement a salary policy that has an impact and meaning for both employees and the company. Our expertise and personalized offerings place us among the most dynamic players in the employee benefits market, and we are notably the No. 1 player in sustainable mobility.




We are looking for a Data Analyst who can drive efficiency in every department. This is a highly visible and high-impact position, and you must be very good at understanding every aspect of the business.




We are seeking a hybrid profile between tech and business that can maintain processes and tools, and has the capacity to understand every aspect of the business.




You will join the Product team and report directly to the Chief Product Officer. It's a small, close-knit team of six people, which makes it perfect for sharing and improving your skills!




üöß We are currently in a development and test & learn phase. You will have the opportunity to co-construct our processes and our organization within Worklife. For this, it's essential that you have a "hands-on mindset" and are able to roll up your sleeves to handle any challenges that arise üôÇ




Your missions




-> You will handle data analysis end-to-end. This includes defining business objectives, transforming data, visualizing data, collecting key insights, and communicating results to stakeholders -




> You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams across the company such as product, marketing, sales, finance, and customer support. Examples of work include analyzing new product features, measuring the impact of new marketing strategies, creating dashboards (Metabase a very SQL-driven data viz tool) or identifying client upsell opportunities
> You are responsible to identify and prioritize analytics projects and you will own your own roadmap
> You are the curator of your data, using SQL in a modern data stack environment (dbt, Airflow) to adapt and create data models and metrics, ensuring those models are version-controlled and well-documented
> You collaborate with the backend team to ensure data collection, quality, accuracy, and completeness
> Stay up-to-date with industry trends, tools, and best practices to enhance the effectiveness of our data analytics efforts





Expected Results




D+30:




> Product and industry training: gain an understanding of our offerings, the employee benefits landscape, and the FinTech/HR tech market
> Meet company members and learn about their roles and responsibilities
> Data stack onboarding: collaborate with team members to identify our different sources of data and explore them and get a sense of their structure, quality, and potential insights





D+60




> Conduct exploratory data analysis: Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement - find business opportunities to leverage for the product marketing team
> Collaborate with cross-functional teams: understand their needs and gather feedback on potential improvements
> Develop dashboards and reports: create user-friendly tools to communicate key findings and insights - train stakeholders: Provide training to stakeholders on how to use and interpret dashboards and reports





D+90




> Monitor and maintain data quality: ensure the accuracy and integrity of data being used for analysis
> Formulate hypotheses: Develop data-driven hypotheses to guide further analysis
> Prepare for a performance review: gather accomplishments and challenges faced during the first three months





Qualifications




We believe that diversity of profiles contributes to the success of Worklife and we therefore make every effort to ensure that inclusion, equity, and accessibility are at the heart of our recruitment processes.




Pre-requisites:




Strong business sense and problem-solving skills, ability to communicate actionable data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You can communicate efficiently in English and French, both written and verbally





Great SQL skills.




More than 3 years of experience with data visualization tools to create informative and visually appealing reports and dashboards
Knowledge or willingness to learn more about DBT and git for version-controlled data modeling
Familiarity with Google Spreadsheet and its advanced functions





Our other evaluation criteria (scorecard) for this role:




Ideal to have knowledge of core SaaS concepts such as MRR, churn, and other relevant metrics in a B2B environment
Attention to Detail: A detail-oriented mindset, with strong organizational and time-management skills, to ensure data quality and accuracy in analyses
Teamwork and Collaboration: the ability to work well in a team, collaborate with colleagues from different departments, and contribute to a positive and inclusive work environment





Our evaluation criteria (scorecard) for the culture fit:




Care: trust, respect & teamplayer
Challenge: demanding, resilient & daring
Curiosity: Test&Learn culture, open-mindedness & perspective





Benefits




We offer a remuneration at market price, re-evaluated every year (according to the market, our performance and your results) as well as +3.000‚Ç¨ of employee benefits üëá




> ‚Ç¨8.50/day worked of meal vouchers (50% paid by the employer) and many other benefits (Frichti, Hello Fresh, ...)
> 800‚Ç¨/year of mobility allocation (public transport pass, scooter, bike purchase, single metro ticket, ...)
> ‚Ç¨100/month (‚Ç¨150/month for parents) of care services (childcare, homework help, housework help, sports coach, etc.)
> 150‚Ç¨/year of remote allocation for your expenses and a monthlyflexible work organization
> A mutual insurance: Alan (50% paid by the employer)
> ‚ÄúRTT‚Äù (number of days defined according to the law)
> A profit-sharing agreement is being set up
> An excellent work environment: an international environment, team events, offsite, beautiful offices in the 11th district
> The pleasure and pride of using our own product on a daily basis (and of testing all the advantages offered!)





In addition, you will be working in an international environment which will lead you to meet a diversity of profiles, which is one of the riches of Worklife.




Process

Job Description

The Renewables Division is responsible for the development, construction, operation and maintenance, asset management and financing of renewable energy projects: large and small scale solar (distributed generation), onshore and offshore wind, off-grid energy and storage. Its strategic goal is to accumulate 35 GW of operational renewable energy capacity by 2025.

With over 10 GW installed by the end of 2021, the planned operational capacity is expected to reach over 5 GW/year. This represents annual project investments of approximately $4 billion/year in TotalEnergies shares and approximately $20 billion in debt to be secured.

You have the opportunity to join TotalEnergies Renewables to take on a new challenge and join the renewable energy sector within the company. We are looking for a talented, committed and enterprising individual. You will be assigned to solar projects across the global scope of the Distributed Generation subsidiary.

Distributed Generation (DG) - a wholly owned subsidiary of Total SA (created in 2019) - is dedicated to the development, construction, operation and financing of industrial and tertiary solar projects worldwide. REN/DG's ambition is to develop in the next 5 years an international leadership and a commendable presence in the market of decentralised solar energy production on industrial and tertiary sites, aiming at a market share of 10 to 20% in the main selected markets.

As a Project Finance Analyst F/H, reporting to the Business Unit DG Economics Manager, you will be responsible for :

Supporting business developers in their bidding process and asset managers by providing financial expertise and technical support on models
Conducting economic analyses for the General Management and contributing to the decision-making process for investments, mergers/acquisitions and disposals, and project structuring
Maintain economic models in conjunction with the Finance, Financing and Tax department
Develop data collection of assets in operation alongside local hubs to establish real asset portfolio analyses.


You will liaise with:

Management: DG Management, local hubs
Finance departments: finance, IFRS experts, tax teams, corporate finance
Legal team, business developers ...


The environment is rapidly changing and the market is very competitive and complex.

Candidate profile

Degree from a business or engineering school.
5 years of relevant experience in the energy sector, in corporate finance or economics positions on long-term projects
Strong analytical skills, ability to work under pressure, ability to work in multiple business cultures.
Background and economic analysis/valuation, financing, modelling
Languages: English, French,

About Cobblestone Energy

Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.

We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!

Cobblestone Values

Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
Others must benefit from our existence.


What We Offer In This Role

A full-time position on our Commercial team
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues.
Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career.
Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business.
Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term.


Summary: We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. With a passion for data-driven solutions and a strong academic background, the successful candidate will play a key role in supporting our business decisions and driving operational efficiencies through the use of advanced analytics and predictive modelling techniques.

Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large and complex datasets to uncover key insights and inform business decisions.
Design and implement predictive models to support the optimization of trading strategies and market forecasting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutions
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning and apply these to the power trading domain
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.


Requirements:

2-3 years of experience in data science or a related field, with a proven track record of success
Strong academic background in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Proficiency in python programming language.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and data visualization tools
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment.


This is an outstanding opportunity for a driven and talented Data Scientist to join a market-leading power trading company and make a significant impact on our business operations. If you possess a passion for data science and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply.

Note: While previous work experience in the power trading domain is highly desirable, it is not a requirement for this role.

Pr√©sentation de la soci√©t√©




The company is a company of Artificial Intelligence experts dedicated to the efficiency of the company‚Äôs business lines. For more than 14 years, it has been building tailor-made decision support solutions that take full advantage of the full potential of data with a clear objective and systematic benefits for its clients.




The company differentiates itself from its direct competitors, not only by its long-standing multi-sectoral experience, particularly in healthcare and Banking/Insurance and its technological choices resolutely focused on human growth, but also by its ability to design, develop and industrialize genuine decision support solutions, some of which are used by thousands of users




Thanks to constant internal capitalization and cutting-edge R&D, the company finds the solutions that bring data into the performance improvement that its customers expect. Finally it is a strategic partner of the digital transformation of several leading companies.




Description




Within the company you will be responsible for the successful execution of one or multiple client engagements. Your understanding of the healthcare sector, and more notably of the pharmaceuticals industry, allows you to translate effectively client needs into impactful solutions. Your experience in managing data-driven projects in a complex client setting enables you to guide our project teams towards flawless delivery.




More specifically your role covers the following critical areas for our company :




**Project management:** supervise project teams in the context of project execution, monitor operational excellence, business productivity and people skills development, secure on time and in quality delivery, role-model customer focus
**Client management:** manage the client relationship in a project setting, ensure consistency between operational execution and contractual objectives, identify new client needs to translate into commercial opportunities
**Business development:** in collaboration with the account executive, development of commercial propositions, support business intelligence on client site, contribute to account planning and management
**Offering management :** support capitalization of knowledge, participate in the development of the offering development, engage and participate in events




Acting as the bridge between our organisation and the client, you will thus participate very actively to the growth of the company Health while gradually developing your skills in project management and client management




Exigences

Experience in Data Science project management is a plus

Data Scientist apprentice M/F [Apprenticeship]

Forvia: Technology leader in the automotive industry

FORVIA comprises the complementary technology and industrial strengths of Faurecia and HELLA. With over 300 industrial sites and 77 R&D centers, 150,000 people, including more than 35,000 engineers across 40+ countries, FORVIA provides a unique and comprehensive approach to the automotive challenges of today and tomorrow.

Composed of 6 business groups with 24 product lines, and a strong IP portfolio of over 14,000 patents, FORVIA is focused on becoming the preferred innovation and integration partner for OEMS worldwide.

FORVIA aims to be a change maker committed to foreseeing and making the mobility transformation happen.

We are looking for a data scientist to join our team!

Faurecia is a global leader in automotive technology, providing innovative solutions for a fast-evolving industry.

The Faurecia Global Business Services (GBS) is the global organization in charge of end-to-end Business processes: Procure to Pay (P2P), Order to Cash (O2C) and Record to Report (R2R) processes.

In order to improve and simplify its processes, the GBS organization focuses on digitalization via RPA (Robotic Process Automation: UIPath), data and process mining solutions (Celonis, Foundry).

You will be working on challenges that matter

GBS organization has selected advanced IT solutions and is looking for a motivated Engineering IT school apprentice in order to boost its digital transformation.

He will be the GBS data scientist and will support the GBS digital transformation manager to define and to implement the process improvement solutions.

He/She will work collaboratively with the project management and IT teams. He will be located in Nanterre in the headquarters of Faurecia in a very dynamic and international environment.

Process mining / Celonis:


Celonis is a process mining tool that helps Faurecia to visualize, to analyse and to improve the Business processes.

In the context of implementation of Celonis, the data scientist will have to work with the system architect and with the Celonis project manager to adapt the Celonis data model (SQL) to Faurecia Business specificities.

Together with the Celonis project manager, the data scientists is at the heart of the Business problematics.

Data preparation / Foundry:


Palantir Foundry is a collaborative data science software platform for teams of data scientists, data analysts, engineers, product owners and data governance to explore the SAP tables of Faurecia.

It reimagines how people use data by removing the barriers between back-end data management and front-end data analysis. Foundry enables users with varying technical ability and deep subject matter expertise to work meaningfully with data. With Foundry, anyone can source, connect, and transform data into any shape they desire, then use it to take action.

We identify the Business need to address the use cases from the specification phase to the development of datasets , dashboards and alert systems in Foundry.

Thanks to his technical expertise, the data scientist will use Foundry to code the datasets (Pyspark) and to help boost the data mining efficiency within the GBS central team. His understanding of the Business problematics will be important to remain relevant with the technical solutions proposed.

What if it were you?

Skills And Experience

You are studying Computer / Data Science, master degree
You have an strong interest and excellent understanding of IT applications: data models, database design development, data preparation and data mining
Knowledge of SQL query / Python / Pyspark
Knowledge of SAP is a plus
Fluent in English; spoken and written is a must
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Good social skills combined with a down-to-earth attitude
Result driven, motivated, focused and persistent on improvement and quality
Business and customer-oriented mindset


So, are you coming on board?

As a responsible employer, Faurecia is committed to promoting diversity. This position is open to all.

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Job_title: Senior Product Manager - User Acquisition and Monetization
Job_description:
Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare and Spotify founders.

But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

Meet the team üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüëß

Our Product team is growing and we‚Äôre looking for an experienced, data-savvy product expert to help take our User Acquisition & Monetization (UAM) tools to the next level. You will be working closely with our brilliant Growth, UA, and Monetization teams as well as the tech team that builds Homa Lab and the UAM Hub, our platforms for running all our growth activities. Your goal will be to provide best-in-class tools that our growth can use to successfully scale games, drive profitable UA, and optimize monetization.

Requirements

Role and Missions ‚Äî What you will do üöÄ

Be a domain expert on UA and monetization tools and run the product development process for media buying and ad-based monetization
Run competitor analysis and market research to identify product gaps and opportunities
Participate in the product development process by identifying user requirements and turning them into user stories, user journeys, and visual wireframes
Work closely with tech squad, tech lead, engineers, data team, and user champions to plan the product roadmap and ensure delivery
Provide clear, detailed requirements for product implementation, and support development decision-making along the way
Work closely with game teams and business stakeholders to ensure the successful adoption of the features, and to identify valuable business opportunities for future product enhancements
Use analytics to measure how features are used in-game, resulting in player behaviour and value created
Create and maintain product documentation to ensure it is thorough and up to date
Ensure product usage, engagement and satisfaction are measured through appropriate metrics (e.g. analytics, NPS, etc.).


Preferred Experience‚ÄîWhat's Your Profile üëÄ

You have +3 years of experience in ad-tech product management - in UA and ad-based monetization platforms for mobile games
Significant product management experience working on highly technical products with a strong data component
Excellent understanding of programmatic ad buying and the mobile ad ecosystem, including ad networks, attribution providers, meditation providers
Excellent knowledge of ad performance measurement metrics and tools specific to mobile gaming and proven experience working with data and analytics to drive uplifts
Strong understanding of ad creative production pipeline and ad formats
Experience writing product requirements and creating wireframes
Experience supporting the agile product development process (kanban or scrum)
Experience working with project management or product development tools: Asana, Notion, Jira, Confluence, etc.
Fluent in English


Good to have üí™

Experience in a top-grossing mobile studio or publisher specialised in casual games
Game design or STEM degree
Experience with data analysis tools: BI tools, SQL querying, etc.
Experience working with Figma and/or Sketch, Adobe XD.


Our Culture‚ÄîWho We Areü™ê

At Homa, we are building a community of brilliant talents. We believe that true innovation comes from diversity and collaboration, and that's why we prioritize brainpower and determination over formal education. So if you have the talent, energy and motivation, there is no obstacle to your success here.

As the creative experts behind the platform, we provide developers with the data they need to bring their ideas to life. Our team lives by three central values that guide everything we do:

‚ú®Ambition: we're not afraid to tackle difficult challenges and set our goals extremely high. We're on a mission to revolutionize an industry dominated by well-established companies, and we won't stop until we succeed.

‚ú®Humility: we leave our pride & ego aside. We are always ready to lend a helping hand, celebrate each other's successes, and learn from our failures. As Mr. Lamar said, "Sit down. Be humble."

‚ú®Curiosity: we keep our minds open and never stop learning. We believe that questioning everything is the best way to stay ahead of the curve, and we encourage all our team members to stay curious and never stop exploring new ideas.

At Homa, you'll be challenged, supported, and inspired every day, and we can't wait to see what you bring to the table.

Benefits

Perks & Benefits üéÅ

While success is its own reward, here are some of the benefits that come with working at Homa:

We offer essential benefits in France and specific locations, including health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidies, childcare benefits, and life insurance
If you're interested in working from our newly renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we have a desk waiting for you
You will be working in English with our international team of top-tier talents from 35+ countries
You will have quarterly reviews with your manager to reflect on your performance, celebrate wins, and receive constructive feedback
You will be able to attend diverse team events and Workations (the famous company-wide Homa trip).
