CON Patient Centred Outcomes (PCO) is part of ICON plc, a leading global Clinical Research Organization headquartered in Dublin, Ireland. Our PCO group undertakes consultancy projects for international clients in both the pharmaceutical and medical device sectors, supporting development of medicines and clinical trials.




The work of the PCO group focuses on patient-centered research, including health related quality of life, disease signs and symptoms, treatment preference, adherence and satisfaction. The group is respected globally for the quality and innovation of their applied qualitative and quantitative work. Much of their work involves Clinical Outcome Assessment (COA) measurement development and evaluation, including conducting patient interviews and focus groups and qualitative analysis psychometric validation and COA analysis.




Our PCO team is primarily based in US (Gaithersburg, Raleigh), UK and France (Lyon), with ICON offices in most EU countries.




We are looking for an individual who is looking to join a consultancy group where research experience is applied within a fast-moving commercial environment. In particular, we are looking for someone who is looking to apply their quantitative skills and join our growing team.




You will have experience of applied research in an academic, health or commercial environment, and will have experience of, and interest in, qualitative quantitative research design and interpretation of results.




The Role




We have a strong preference for an individual with qualitative quantitative coding and analysis skills




Supports project meetings and the resolution of issues, project recaps and corrective/preventative action.
Assist with development of research materials (such as study protocols, interview guides Statistical Analysis Plans ) and conduct of literature reviews
Conduct interviews with patients, caregivers and clinical experts
Undertake qualitative quantitative data analysis using qualitative quantitative analysis software: e.g., MaxQDA, ATLAS.TI, NVIVO SAS, R
Draft, review, and assist with client deliverables, including reports, proposals and scientific manuscripts under the direction of senior team members




Requirements




Bachelor's (or higher) degree in a related field (such as sociology, anthropology, statistics, public health, epidemiology, psychology, or related discipline) or proven relevant experience
Fluency in English both orally and in writing, with excellent interpersonal skills.
Experience in a related field in academic or industry environment
Understanding of scientific research methods and processes
Experience with quantitative methodology and analysis; knowledge of qualitative quantitative analysis software strongly preferred
Well-developed written and oral communication skills, including fluent English, both written and spoken
Accuracy and attention to detail
The ability to work effectively as part of a team with a high degree of self-motivation




Benefits Of Working In ICON




Our success depends on the quality of our people. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve made it a priority to build a culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.




We offer very competitive salary packages. And to keep them competitive, we regularly benchmark them against our competitors. Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals - both ours and yours.




We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans - and related benefits such as life assurance - so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead.




But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you‚Äôll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change.




ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

WAIT, THERE IS MORE! LET US GIVE YOU 4 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

YOU APPLIED?

Job_description:
Who we are:

Drake Star Partners is a global investment bank serving the technology, media, and communications (TMC) sectors. With over 125 employees and 10 offices across the U.S., Europe and Asia, the firm focuses on mergers & acquisitions and corporate finance for its clients worldwide. Drake Star has completed over 400 transactions since 2004, 70% of which are cross-border.

Overview:

Drake Star Partners is seeking Interns with relevant internship experience to join the investment banking group in our Paris Office starting JUNE/JULY 2023. The successful candidates will be responsible for leading analytical work in support of transaction execution and new business development, as well as assisting bankers in the development and delivery of value-added investment banking products and services to clients and prospects. Exceptional Interns will be considered further for full time Analyst positions at Drake Star upon graduation.

Responsibilities:

Co-author pitchbooks, confidential information memorandums, management presentations, and general Drake Star marketing materials
Spearhead financial analysis including preparing financial models, valuation analysis, and synthesizing complex data
Conduct industry and sector valuation, market, and trend research and analysis
Maintain deal flow tracking and prepare internal presentations for the deal team
Support the due diligence process through coordinating project deliverables with senior bankers


Qualifications:

Relevant previous internship experience within financial services
Proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to research and effectively summarize/synthesize relevant industry, competitive and transaction data
Demonstrated leadership skills and responsibility, resourcefulness, initiative, maturity and attention to detail
Proven ability to work well under pressure, ability to manage rapid timelines and proactively manage any potential conflicts
This position should expect client exposure and will require a demonstrated skill sets in the fundamentals of valuation, business strategy and client communication


Equal Opportunity Employer:

Drake Star Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, religious creed, disability (mental or physical), age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare, and Spotify founders.

But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

Meet The Team - Who You Will Work With üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüëß

You will join our Legal team, a fundamental and essential pillar of our company. The team is composed of one person, Jessica Giraud, our legal expert, and your future manager. It's a great opportunity to receive detailed guidance and get hands-on learning experience from a professional.

Role And Missions - What You Will Do üöÄ

As a Legal Intern, you will be an integral part, assisting in the day-to-day business and dealing with a very diverse range of legal topics and tasks to ensure compliance with laws and regulations, protect the company's intellectual property, manage contracts and agreements, and address legal issues that may arise.

Your missions will be the following:

Organize a legal repository and a library of contracts
Participate in the drafting and negotiation of business contracts
Provide answers to legal questions from operational staff
Assist with disputes and litigation matters
Conduct legal research, draft notes and procedures
Ensure the follow-up of the GDPR program
Any other duties that may be required from time to time


Requirements

Preferred Experience - What's your profile üëÄ

We are always excited to welcome new interns who are curious, motivated, eager to learn, and passionate. Overall, we are looking for interns willing to take on new challenges, and committed to making the most of their internship experience.

If you recognize yourself in the following description, you're the one!

Currently enrolled in your final year of a Master's degree program in Business Law, Intellectual Property Law, Commercial Law, Civil Law, or IT Law or DJCE.
Good knowledge of classic start-ups Saas or tools (Gsuite, Notion, Slack, Asana).
Familiarity with data protection law and corporate (M&A) is a plus (preferably in tech )
Prior experience either in a law firm or an internship in a company operating in Tech or within the gaming industry (PC or mobile) is preferred.
Good verbal and written communication, as well as, strong interpersonal skills.
Strong sense of confidentiality and adaptability, willing to learn on a diverse range of topics.
Availability to attend onsite in our Paris offices and commit for 6 months full-time.
Speaking English and French fluently is a must.


Benefits

Our Culture - Who we areü™ê

At Homa, we are building a community of brilliant talents. We believe that true innovation comes from diversity and collaboration, and that's why we prioritize brainpower and determination over formal education. So if you have the talent, energy, and motivation, there is no obstacle to your success here.

As the creative experts behind the platform, we provide developers with the data they need to bring their ideas to life. Our team lives by three central values that guide everything we do:

‚ú®Ambition: we're not afraid to tackle difficult challenges and set our goals extremely high. We're on a mission to revolutionize an industry dominated by well-established companies, and we won't stop until we succeed.

‚ú®Humility: we leave our pride & ego aside. We are always ready to lend a helping hand, celebrate each other's successes, and learn from our failures. As Mr. Lamar said, "Sit down. Be humble."

‚ú®Curiosity: we keep our minds open and never stop learning. We believe that questioning everything is the best way to stay ahead of the curve, and we encourage all our team members to stay curious and never stop exploring new ideas.

At Homa, you'll be challenged, supported, and inspired every day, and we can't wait to see what you bring to the table.

Perks & Benefits - What We Offer üéÅ

While success is its own reward, here are some of the benefits that come with working at Homa:

We offer essential benefits in France: including health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidies, childcare benefits, and life insurance
Working from our newly renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we have a desk waiting for you
You will be working in English with our international team of top-tier talents from 35+ countries
You will be able to attend diverse team events and Workations (the famous company-wide Homa trip)

Job Description üë®‚Äçüíª




Exotrail is expanding its software-development team of Space Dynamics Engineers and Software Developers. Our team is developing spacestudio‚Ñ¢ and spacetower‚Ñ¢, our software suite to design and operate satellite missions with an emphasis on propulsion operations!




Exotrail is looking for a Software intern to join our development team for 6 months. The start date would ideally be from early September to mid-October 2023.




spacestudio‚Ñ¢ is based on modern languages (Java, Javascript, Typescript, Python) and is targeted to satellite integrators and operators. Our main goal is to provide an easy-to-use, yet accurate and powerful tool for satellite integrators to design their platform with respect to mission and space dynamics constraints, and for operators to operate effortlessly constellations of satellites equipped with propulsion.




Our core competencies lie in the development of algorithms to control low-thrust propulsion on small satellites and to integrate a full flight dynamics system within an easy-to-use, modular interface.




Your job will be to contribute to the development of spacestudio‚Ñ¢, either on the design features or on the operational aspects. Depending on your skills, you may work on the following technical subjects:




Frontend development
Code architecture
Data management




You will work on several tasks including: üìå Implement new features in Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, Python




üìå Create user interfaces and implement 3D visualizations




üìå Integrate new space mechanics features in the workflow




üìå Integrate the technical bricks in a user-oriented approach




üìå Improve the user experience by working on data workflow




üìå Consolidate the architecture to improve the modularity




You will be joining a dynamic and motivated team based in the city centre of Toulouse. The development team operates following the Agile method, allowing to progress at a fast pace with a customer-oriented approach. We accord great importance to freedom, autonomy, and responsibility. You will benefit from the support of all the team in space dynamics and software development, our two areas of expertise in Toulouse. We also promote the culture of software craftmanship and rely on the principles of clean code.




Preferred Experience üíÅ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è




To complete this internship, Exotrail is looking for a young engineer or developer with a solid background in frontend or fullstack development. A proactive attitude and a high degree of autonomy are also expected. Interest or previous experience with the following are appreciated:




JS with Vue/React/Angular framework
User interface framework (Vuetify)
3D visualisation tools (Cesium)
MongoDB or other
Space mechanics




A friendly attitude and team spirit are appreciated.




You like working in a changing and challenging environment. You enjoy working in a team, bringing in new ideas and debating with your colleagues to move the project forward. You are an action-oriented person, and you want to bring agility to space and develop new services based on high-level technologies.




About Our Recruitment Process ü§ù




We are committed to recruiting the right people for the right job regardless of your private backround.




We meet at least three times in order to give you a better idea of what it's like to work at Exotrail:




Technical interview with your future manager: You will learn more about the position and the required qualifications
On-site interview with HR and VP: You will discover your work environment and learn more about our culture
Interview with a founder: You can make sure that you share the same vision and values of the company
Industries: Fabrication pour l‚Äôindustrie de la d√©fense et industrie spatiale

Job_description:
Get to know us




Do you want to help us shape what the future of work will look like and how it will best embrace our life's aspirations? If this sounds like a journey you want to embark on, we may have the right role for you!




PayFit is an intuitive cloud-based payroll and employee management solution designed specifically for SMBs. Since 2015, we have set ourselves a mission to simplify payroll for SMBs and enable employers and employees to grow together. We are a European company operating from 3 main countries (France, Spain, and the UK) where we are supporting over 9500 clients.




Creating a Fulfilling Work Environment And Culture Is Also a Core Mission At PayFit, And Our Day-to-day Work Philosophy Is Reflected In Our Four Values




Care




We genuinely care for others whoever they are, whatever they think.




Excellence




We aim to improve and achieve better results every day.




Humility




Staying humble and exchanging transparent feedback helps us to grow and improve.




Passion




We are the architects of PayFit's success.




A key part of our culture, and essential for our success, is also improving the diversity of our teams and building an inclusive culture where you can be yourself at work.




This is why our recruitment focuses on the skills you demonstrate, and not only on your academic background or previous professional experiences. At PayFit we understand that you can gain applicable skills through a variety of life experiences and we are interested in knowing them, too.




About The Role




As a VP of Data, you will be responsible for driving data initiatives that improve the customer experience, drive product innovation, and contribute to decision making and business growth.




Reporting Directly To Sylvain, CPO, You Will




Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy that aligns with the company's business goals and objectives.
Manage and level up a team of roughly 20ppl, composed of Data Product Analysts, BI Analysts, Analytics Engineers and Data Engineers to execute the roadmap and meet the company's goals.

About Us

AIRE Ancient Baths are temples dedicated to creating the ultimate relaxation experience, where time does not exist. Inspired by the tradition of baths from ancient Roman, Greek, and Ottoman civilizations, the AIRE Experience always takes place in restored historical buildings in the center of globally acclaimed cities.

At AIRE we are proud to have an international presence with 8 established centers: NYC, Chicago, London, Copenhagen, Barcelona, Sevilla, Almeria, and Vallromanes. We are already looking into the future and moving onwards, with our soon-to-be-opened, Upper East Side and Toronto-2024- facilities.

We are even prouder of the caring, inclusive, and familiar work environment we have created for all our employees.

The role

As an Architect and Interior Designer Trainee, you will be assisting the architect and interior designer manager in the production of plans and projecting architectural solutions in 2D, 3D for the development of architectural and interior executive projects.

You will be involved in the following tasks of the department:

Production and development of architectural plans and renders

Preparation of basic projects as a basis for the drafting of executive projects by external collaborators to the company
Modifications of the current centres‚Äô layout based on the renovations to be carried out

Review of designs received from engineering and workshop plans for the manufacture of architectural elements

Review of technical specifications of different materials proposed during the execution phase in accordance with the original project
Identify and provide solutions to problems detected in the designs
Drawing of updated solutions and layouts

Purchase Processes

Assist the architect and interior designer in the purchase processes of the different ongoing projects
Identify the best solutions based on prices, technical specifications and aesthetic criteria

Who You Are

Graduate of Architecture or Building Engineering and with a Master‚Äôs degree in Interior Design or related
Proficiency in AutoCAD 2D and 3D. SketchUp, Vray and Revit are desirable and Photoshop is a plus.
Fluent in English and Spanish -(spoken and written)
Strong attention to detail and ability to work in a team environment
Excellent communication and project management skills

Job_description:
ABOUT DANCE

At Dance, we believe getting where you want to go should be simple and sustainable.

So we‚Äôre on a mission to make emobility easy. Dance members get their own electric bike or moped, free 24-hour repairs, and theft coverage on a flexible monthly subscription.

Our service is currently live in Berlin, Hamburg, Munich, Vienna and Paris.




Dance was founded by SoundCloud founders Eric Quidenus-Wahlforss and Alexander Ljung, together with the co-founder of Jimdo, Christian Springub. Investors include BlueYard, HV Capital and Eurazeo. To find out more, visit https://dance.co.




As an equal opportunity employer, Dance is committed to building an inclusive workplace. We welcome people of any background, age, country of origin, ethnic and racial origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, marital status, religion or ideology to apply.




ABOUT THE ROLE

From dropping off bikes to repairs to customer service, our operations team is core to keeping the Dance community happy and satisfied. We‚Äôre looking for someone to join our Operations team in Paris, supporting the local team on a variety of ops related projects from its inception to its execution and monitoring.




As our Local Operations Intern, you will:

Support the scaling of the existing markets by developing new optimization & automation procedures
Training the local team (mechanics, drivers, shift leads) on new standard operational procedures
Closely work with the local managers on a variety of new projects & pilots to improve operational efficiency




ABOUT YOU

To be successful in this role, you:

Enjoy being hands-on and close to the action
Have strong ops project management skills & ready to work in a workshop environment
Are data-driven, structured and thrive in fast-paced environments
Speak French & English fluently
Are based in Paris and available at least for 4 months




Did we just describe you? Let us know by sending over a CV, with an outline of what motivates you most about becoming part of Dance. Even if you don't meet all the requirements, we would still encourage you to apply!




Come and experience a unique culture, where you can work alongside exceptionally talented people and move us towards more livable cities.




How we take care of you:

Competitive compensation package
Flexible working environment that suits your schedule
Access to nilo.health for your mental wellbeing
Your own Dance subscription for an ebike or emoped

Interactions with sales team, innovation manager, R and D ...


A graduate with a Master chemistry with an experience in CDMO, you have a minimum of 5 years of relevant industry experience in the management of projects.

You are curious and are recognized for your ability to analyze qualitative and quantitative data (products, customers, prices, market sizing, promotion) and interact with the key technical internal stakeholders.

You are recognized for your ability Team spirit and ability to work collaboratively and closely with sales team.

A good understanding of English and French is essential for this position.

Job_description:
About Us




Close is a bootstrapped, profitable, 100% remote, :80 person team of thoughtful individuals who value autonomy and impact. We‚Äôre eager to make a product our customers fall in love with over and over again.




We ‚ù§Ô∏è startups & SMBs. Since 2013, we‚Äôve been building a CRM that focuses on better communication, without the hassle of manual data entry or complex UI. Our goal: double the productivity of every sales rep.




We are growing our Customer Success Team of 8 to help serve more customers! We are specifically looking for someone to help with new customer onboarding and identify high-growth customers.




About You




You're comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with a small and talented team where you're supported in your efforts to grow professionally. You're able to manage your time well, communicate effectively and collaborate in a fully distributed team.




You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and are comfortable working autonomously in an asynchronous, remote environment. You have a high emotional intelligence, and possess the ability to understand and empathize with the needs of others. You have a friendly, but strong demeanor. Preference is given to candidates who have experience working in a startup environment.




You are located in European or Eastern American Time Zones.




About The Role




The newest member of the Customer Success team will work closely with high growth customers, ensuring they have the tools, knowledge, and set up to be successful in Close and in sales. This role will work the majority of time in a 1:1 capacity with individual customers, but will also contribute to the team‚Äôs digital engagement strategy. This role reports to the Manager of Customer Success, Meghann O‚ÄôBrien.




Key Responsibilities




Onboard new customers with an emphasis on creating a solid sales process and strategically mapping new customer data. Onboarding and follow-up training includes opinionated sales process advice, sales education, data consultation, and teaching the Close sales philosophy.
Work with existing customers to increase the value they receive from our service and identify and create an action plan for those customers who are rapidly growing and who may need extra love.
Build strong customer relationships and use these to negotiate and close annual renewal agreements with high-growth customers, ensuring their long-term commitment to and success with our platform.
Collaborate with other Success team members and teams at large (Sales, Support, Partnerships, Marketing, Product) to deploy resources for customers and gather information for company insight as needed.
Host roundtables, webinars and other types of virtual events to boost information and resources for the Close community.
Assist on virtual engagement strategy by creating /contributing to written and video content on platform best practices and Close sales philosophy


Requirements




3 years experience with B2B SaaS in a Customer Success or implementations role
Passionate about technology
Extremely well-informed in the SaaS product ecosystem, particularly products that cater to startups and SMBs
Preference given to candidates with:
1) frontline sales experience of minimum one year that you can rely on to act as a trusted sales advisor for our customers
2) experience working for a CRM platform or a sales enablement tool or
3) technical aptitude and capability


Why Work With Us?




Culture video üíö
100% remote company (we believe in trust and autonomy)
Choose between working 5 days/wk (standard full-time) or 4 days/wk @ 80% pay
Annual team retreats ‚úàÔ∏è
Quarterly virtual summits
5 weeks PTO + Winter Holiday Break
2 additional PTO days every year with the company
1 month paid sabbatical every 5 years
Paid parental leave
Medical, Dental, Vision with HSA option (US residents)
401k matching at 6% (US residents)
Dependent care FSA (US residents)
Contributor to Stripe's climate initiative üåç‚ù§Ô∏è
Our story and team üöÄ


Our Values




Build a house you want to live in -- Examine long-term thinking and action
No BS -- Practice transparency and honesty, especially when it‚Äôs hard
Invest in each other -- Build successful relationships with your coworkers and customers
Discipline equals freedom -- Keep your word to yourself and others
Strive for greatness -- Constantly challenge yourself and others





How We Work Together




Productivity, Quality & Impact: We don‚Äôt track hours. We trust you‚Äôre an adult and know best how to prioritize, meet your goals and contribute at a high level.
Asynchronous communication & collaboration: We have team members all over the world. We don‚Äôt expect anyone to work untraditional hours, that means our default is async. Most teams have 2-5 hours of internal meetings weekly.
Appreciation for Deep Work: *During your normal work day, not after a day of meetings*.
Autonomy & Freedom: Create a work environment that is sustainable for you. We place a high amount of trust and responsibility with our team members from the start.


At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practice a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don‚Äôt have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our business - we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you).




We come from 20+ countries located in 5 of the 7 continents. We‚Äôre a collection of talented humans, rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Every year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. These gatherings are an opportunity to strengthen the relationships within our global community.




Our team is growing in more ways than one - in the last few years, we've launched 24 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is ‚ÄúBuild a house you want to live in.‚Äù We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our people and help our customers become more successful.




Our application process was designed to promote equitable and unbiased hiring practices. We ask a small series of questions that are similar to what would be asked in the first interview. This helps us learn more about you right from the start so please be sure to answer each question thoughtfully. Each application will receive two screens by two different reviewers. Regardless of fit, you will hear back from us letting you know if we'll be moving forward.




Interested in Close but don't think this role is the best fit for you? View our other positions.

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Company Name: Nielsen Job Description




At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future.




About The Role




Due to our continued growth, we are looking for a ‚ÄòConsultant‚Äô to support our International Strategy & Consulting practice in helping clients from the sports and entertainment business find the right answers to any type of commercial challenge. The position holder will work on projects in France and Benelux and on an international level, in close collaboration with other consultants and the commercial team across Europe, the Middle East, and the Americas.




This position will be a great fit for a committed, responsible and collaborative individual with an understanding and appreciation of the European sports business. They should also have a passion for strategic planning, data analysis, and its application in consulting, and a commitment to do top-class management consulting work.




If an exciting career working closely with many of the world‚Äôs largest sports & entertainment rights holders, brands, agencies, and broadcasters sounds exciting, this could be the role for you.




The role will be based in Paris; we encourage everyone to work from there to learn from and connect with colleagues. However, we have adopted a flexible working approach and therefore the opportunity to work from home is available for those wanting to do so.




Key Responsibilities




Including but not limited to




Support with consulting projects and client deliverables




Collaborate with colleagues in the consulting team to jointly deliver high-quality work to our clients on various projects related to rights holders‚Äô commercial strategies, media rights, fan development, and brands‚Äô sponsorship planning
Conduct independent analysis of internal and external data sets, drawing out insights and producing recommendations and strategies
Developing and delivering compelling presentations to effectively communicate project results to clients and key stakeholders
Lead or contribute to project teams, ensuring the successful execution of consulting engagements. Define project scopes, timelines, and deliverables. Monitor progress and manage client expectations.




Build productive day-to-day relationships with clients




Develop strong client relationships ‚Äì we are a non-hierarchical team and believe in all consultants engaging regularly with our clients
Become a trusted advisor and collaborate with clients to understand their business objectives, challenges, and needs.




Continue your professional development




Keep up to date with trends in the sports and entertainment industries
Use Nielsen‚Äôs broad range of learning and development resources to further your commercial expertise
Support team planning and process management




Requirements for the role




Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent in business administration, sports management, marketing, or related fields
Minimum of 2 years experience as a strategy & management consultant at a top consulting firm
Strong communication and project management skills
Ability to think creatively, and strategically as well as apply data to problem-solve
Microsoft Office skills, particularly PowerPoint and Excel
Fluency in French and English (written and spoken)
A passion for sport, and an interest in the commercial business of sport




About Nielsen Sports




Committed to delivering powerful data-driven insights and services, Nielsen Sports works in collaboration with the world's top leagues, teams and brands to deliver the most comprehensive, trusted and meaningful insights and analysis across the world of sport and entertainment to help support decision making.




Nielsen Sports is a trusted adviser and partner in sports and entertainment strategy, helping our clients worldwide to maximise their commercial success and understand their fan base. Our projects are wide and varied, spanning commercial strategy, rights package creation and go-to-market strategies, sponsorship evaluation and ROI modelling and broadcast rights valuation. Our client list includes a broad range of international and domestic rights holders, including Paris Saint Germain FC, Paris 2024, F√©d√©ration Fran√ßaise de Tennis, FIA, Ligue de Football Professionnel, AFC Ajax, Jupiler Pro league, European Broadcasting Union. We also support major brands from sectors such as FMCG, luxury goods, travel, telco, OEM, crypto and banking & financial;




What can we offer you as an employee of Nielsen Media




In addition to a competitive salary and benefits we offer a varied area of responsibility as well as an open corporate culture with numerous development opportunities. Above all, our employees appreciate the ability to work independently in a motivated and very friendly team. Social responsibility, open communication and living our values can be found not only on our homepage, but also in everyday work. An informal atmosphere in a dynamic media company with opportunities for ownership and personal development.




Diversity




Here at Nielsen, we believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Nielsen is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome applications from people that are excited to work for us, regardless of their background - so please get in touch!




Nielsen provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to any protected characteristics under local law.




As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what‚Äôs true, we measure across all channels and platforms‚Å†‚Äîfrom podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.




Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You‚Äôll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

Our strong and agile international team continues to grow and adapt to new challenges. Based in Grenoble (France), we are currently establishing our Verkor Innovation Centre (R&D centre and 4.0 pilot line).




In the coming years, we will focus on building the world‚Äôs most modern and efficient Gigafactory in Dunkirk (France). With this facility, our ambition is an initial annual production of 16 Gwh of lithium-ion batteries by 2025, thus powering 300,000 electric vehicles annually.




In joining us you will actively participate in this breathtaking industrial adventure toshape the future of European mobility.




The Battery Data Analyst Engineer will be responsible for the development of battery data analytics and predictive system engineering tools and application of these tools for design and development of.




The candidate will take a leading role in the following:




Analyzing battery cell performance data,
identifying trends
providing insights to help optimize battery cell design and performance





The ideal candidate is expected to be highly analytical, have experience in data analysis/processing and also have experience in the battery cell modelling & simulation




Responsibilities




Develop and apply battery cell data analytics and predictive system engineering tools for prediction and verification of battery cell performance and thermal
Develop usage profiles and mission profiles for battery cell life modeling/ prediction/simulations and component designs for durability and other applications
Analyze critical cell manufacturing parameters during the entire lifecycle,
Collaborate with battery cell design and testing teams to identify and prioritize areas for improvement
Data analysis activities and interpretation related to battery field performance to guide requirements development and product improvements
Provide technical expertise in investigation of system issues and support root cause analysis and mitigation and corrective action plans
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track battery cell performance metrics
This list is not exhaustive


Requirements




Bachelor's degree in Battery sector related (Electrical, Chemistry, Applied Physics, Aerospace, Industrial, Systems, Computer Engineering, related Engineering field from an ABET accredited, ABET equivalent university)
3 years in product engineering design and development in automotive industry with 2 years of experience in mathematical modeling and data analysis/processing/mining
Good understanding of Li-ion cell electrochemistry, cell/battery life models and battery life behavior
Excellent Python skills or in R, MATLAB
Experience with database technologies such as SQL, NoSQL and Knowledge Graph
Knowledge of design of experiments, parameter fitting, optimization, and data regression methods
Demonstrate excellent level of analytical ability, communication and interpersonal skills required to build relationships and coach team members, and work with customers to solve problems and resolve issues


Why join us?




Strong company spirit and culture settle down around our 4 values:




Contribution




We promote personal initiative and give everyone the means to contribute to the company's success.




Communication




We're committed to transparent communication: we say what we think, and we mean what we say.




Team Spirit




Everyone, in their role, is an ambassador for the company. At Verkor, success is most definitely a team sport!




Commitment




We're all working towards a common goal: a sustainable future, which we're building one step at a time.




Attractive work conditions




Stimulating work environment: pleasant offices, multicultural and motivated team
Live and work in the Green Capital of Europe
Lunch vouchers
50% of local transportation costs financed
5 weeks of holidays per year + 2 weeks of compensation time (RTT)
Industry-leading healthcare
Opportunities to network and connect with worldwide experts





For more info on the company, please visit us at www.verkor.com

Job_description:
GENERAL PURPOSE:




The Verimatrix worldwide workforce of sales professionals believes in the motto ‚ÄúMission always possible‚Äù. The mission is out in the field on a daily basis identifying new business opportunities, talking to our customers, prospects, and partners to build long-term relationships and ensure the customer has a great buying experience. Our vision to be always the trusted security partner, coupled with the mission of ‚ÄúDriving Trust‚Äù that can give our customers the freedom to innovate.




As Sales Manager, your main objective will be to drive forward Verimatrix‚Äôs growing sales revenue in EMEA.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.




Managing direct sales and reseller channels to close deals and win new opportunities, as well as identifying potential new sales channels to help sell new products and services into new markets.
Providing full visibility into the sales pipeline and accurate revenue forecasting at every stage of development.
Working collaboratively across cross-functional teams, such as Pre-Sales, Partnerships, Marketing, Legal, Finance, Product Management, Engineering and Operations.
Establishing and fostering partnerships and relationships with key customers and partners to understand their business needs and objectives to drive long-term recurring business.
Understanding the competitive landscape and market trends and be able to make recommendations to management on creative ways to stay ahead of the curve.
Understanding and effectively communicating the company's value proposition, technology, business processes, and current partnerships.
Be responsible for the sales and partnership strategy, revenue forecasting and product/service delivery for the Verimatrix customers in your region.
Direct involvement in high profile and major sales engagements, plus business development at the appropriate levels into target accounts.
Be accountable for maintaining highest levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty for the customers in the region.
Represent Verimatrix at trade shows, webinars, panel discussions, and other events in the region as needed.




QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:




To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




Business Degree, Engineering Degree or equivalent
5+ years of technology sales experience.
A proven track record of forecasting and overachieving your targets.
Creativity in deal design to meeting customer‚Äôs constraints and budgets, while maximizing and predictively accelerating revenue for the company.
Ability to accurately forecast and overachieve your sales quota targets each quarter.
At ease communicating, presenting and influencing all levels of the organization, including business and technical representatives, executives and C-levels.
Experienced positioning against competitors with differentiated value propositions.
Experience working with partners, resellers and other channels to drive sales.
Experience using enterprise sales tools such as Salesforce, Hubspot and Zuora to create and manage leads, contacts, accounts, opportunities, quotes, and projects.
Experience scoping opportunities from RFI/RFP to multiple-phase project implementations in ways that accelerate revenue.
An excellent negotiator with strong listening and persuasion skills.
Strong business-level written, verbal and presentation skills in English.




Preferred but Not Required:




Experience in selling software security solutions.
Experience selling multi-year SaaS and subscription business models.
Experience selling into media, entertainment, telecommunications, fintech, automotive, healthcare and/or other IoT accounts.
Fluency in any other regional languages.




About Verimatrix:




Verimatrix helps power the modern connected world with security made for people. We protect digital content, applications, and devices with intuitive, people-centered and frictionless security. Leading brands turn to Verimatrix to secure everything from premium movies and live streaming sports, to sensitive financial and healthcare data, to mission-critical mobile applications. We enable the trusted connections our customers depend on to deliver compelling content and experiences to millions of consumers around the world. Verimatrix helps partners to get to market faster, scale easily, protect valuable revenue streams, and win new business.

in compliance with Verimatrix‚Äôs

Job_title: Country Manager - Setup and Launch Paris/France
Job_description:
Workfully is the decentralized hiring & upskilling marketplace. The world's fastest growing and most innovative companies use Workfully to hire & develop talent globally.




The Company




Our client is a proximity delivery startup that offers scheduled same-day delivery services to ecommerce and retailers. We believe that the future of eCommerce deliveries is customer controlled timeslots, combined with a nature-positive approach to sustainability. We are on a mission to make this the new standard.




The Role




We are looking for smart and highly motivated people that share our values and our view of business. We want people that have experience working in tech startups, understand how to setup and grow a business and need to work within a dynamic, innovative and constantly evolving workplace.




The Country Launcher role is a unique opportunity to have a direct impact on success. As the Country Launcher France, you will develop and scale our delivery service in one of our key markets globally. The role demands a unique combination of operational prowess, sales, negotiation and collaboration skills needed to bring out the best from our retailer and logistics partners, the innovation and creative thinking that's required to develop outside the box solutions, and the emotional intelligence required to lead a fast paced business and inspire a team of people.




This is the ideal role for someone who has experience building out a business, who's obsessed with tinkering and iterating to obtain operational excellence and our quality throughout the customer experience. Country strategy, marketing, logistics efficiency, quality, P&L ownership and customer experience sit under the CL‚Äôs umbrella of responsibilities. Deeply understanding your market and building local partnerships is critical. This is where creativity meets leadership and execution head on.




Build the business from ground up




Set mission and strategy: Set the vision, inspire and oversee the results-driven execution in your market across operations, business development, account management, partnership, marketing




P&L: Have full P&L responsibility and own business objectives




Business Development: Generate and secure new business opportunities with prospective clients. You will be the face of our brand to retailers




Partner Relations: Develop relations with key stakeholders




Team Management: Hire top talent, inspire and help them perform, grow and develop




towards building the business in France




Work cross-functionally: Collaborate with the Product team, Operations and Engineering to communicate product and process needs to deliver in France




Run experiments: We're looking for people who are curious and passionate about solving problems! As a startup within a startup, there will be many interesting challenges ahead. Experimenting and finding unique solutions is in our DNA




Public Policy: Be the legal representative of the company. Engage with local regulatory and political stakeholders within the last mile delivery ecosystem




PR: lead as the face of the company in France




Expansion: Scale the company to other cities




Achieving results: Achieve daily, weekly and monthly targets and KPIs




Monitoring: You will coordinate and monitor live orders. You will manage forecasting,




scheduling, while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and analysis of KPIs to ensure supply levels meet business requirements




Live Support: You will spend a good portion of each day being there for retailers, customers and delivery partners when they need support




Tracking: Dig into the city at a granular level to understand couriers metrics such as reliability, utilization, on-time delivery, quality and profitability




Data & Insight: find key opportunities to continually improve sales and operations and find efficiencies by surfacing key insights and wins from retailer partners, customers and delivery partners and then work to implement and execute these




Analysis: Perform analysis to come up with insights and strategic initiatives to solve key challenges




Build tools: Build analytical models and dashboards to support the implementation of




strategic initiatives




Develop & Optimize Processes: You will help designing processes, whether it be




onboarding, customer support, logistics to fuel growth and drive efficiency




Ownership: Take ownership of the companies growth in France, do whatever it takes to get the job done, delight users and retailers, provide your feedback, share personal ideas and proposals, and make your impact to push the business forward




You




3-5 years of experience in Operations, Strategy, Business Development or similar area.




Previous experience in the urban delivery industry and fleet management is a plus,




preferably in a high growth company




A great balance of skills. Comfortable selling a major international retailer as diving into the nitty gritty of supply demand management
A strong network of contacts at the France‚Äôs biggest retailers, eCommerce players and delivery companies. You can open the door for our sales team to go get clients and to our operations team to onboard new delivery partners
Experience leading a team, with willingness to invest in the coaching and development of your team members
Experience in startups and P&L ownership are a plus
A proven track record of success in setting up and growing a business. Have previously managed a company, region, office or team and understand the challenges of scaling up
University degree (Engineering, Business Administration or related areas)
French mother tongue and fluent in English
Proficient IT skills, especially MS Office and Google Docs. Knowledge of SQL is a plus
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal
Is comfortable on camera. Get ready for your 15 minutes of fame as you represent the company in press interviews, at the biggest trade shows and at tech and logistics conferences
Ability to produce reporting on weekly and monthly KPI‚Äôs
You are flexible to work late hours and weekends
Effective project management - experience delivering on a multifaceted projects with many stakeholders
An empathetic approach to customer service, being supportive and highly organized
Overachieving targets attitude is a must
Hungry for personal and professional growth
Data-driven decision mentality and sound business judgment through strong




analytical thinking and modelling ability. You love finding efficiencies and identifying




improvements in the guts of the business.




Stellar relationship building skills and the ability to make smart partnerships happen,




from negotiation to execution




Consultative approach: you have a natural desire to understand prospective clients‚Äô




needs and work to find a solution that fits them best




Ability and agility to solve problems. You have a creative mindset and enjoy putting in




place initiatives to solve practical issues




Curious and eager to learn about all aspects of the business. You desire to build up




skills and knowledge very fast to become a recognized subject matter expert amongst




your peers




Ability to continuously gather clients‚Äô feedback and report it to various stakeholders




in the company (Product, IT, Operations, Finance)




A creative, passionate and entrepreneurial mindset to drive positive changes in the




business. You own the business and we expect you to be proactive and make your




impact




Excited about the companies prospects for the future and a believer in the value that the brand brings to our partners.




Benefits




Enticing equity plan (if applicable)




Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)

Sounds amazing, right?

Anglais professionnel requis.

Did you know that about 10% of all insurance payouts are flowing directly into the pockets of fraudsters? The future of insurance starts with Decisions Made Better.




Shift Technology harnesses the power of AI to enable the world‚Äôs leading insurance organizations to make better decisions. Our products automate and optimize decisions from underwriting to claims, resulting in increased operational efficiency, reduced costs, and superior customer experiences for millions of people around the globe.




Our culture is built on innovation, trust, and a drive to transform the insurance industry by imagining and innovating solutions that impact insurers and their customers - like you! We come from more than 40 different countries and cultures and together we are creating the future of insurance.




Are you looking for an internship where you can get strong programming skills and discover real-life problems? Come and join the French Insurtech leader to change the insurance world with A.I.!




The Data Science team works on a broad range of subjects. We actively participate in the definition and development of our suite of products on fraud detection, anti-money laundering and claim automation. We have a lot of technical and professional experience in data science, data engineering, coding, business understanding and client interactions. Additionally, we also work on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.




This position is for you if you are looking for an end-of-studies internship to complete your degree, and are interested in a permanent position if you think Shift is the right place to start!




What You'll Do...




As a member of the data science team, and working alongside our technical experts, your role will be key to roll-out our different solutions to the clients. Your day-to-day will include :




Set-up and deploy in production the data processing pipelines of our clients, including data reception in batches or in real-time, data cleaning, information extraction, calibration of fraud detection models, etc.
Work closely with our clients to understand their needs, their feedback to improve our solutions
R&D for product development and innovation (through machine learning, image analysis, NLP, trend analysis, chatbots‚Ä¶)
Work closely with the sales team for prospects demo




What you bring‚Ä¶




You have a master‚Äôs degree in either Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research (a knowledge in machine learning and/or Big Data is a plus)
You have experience in object-oriented programming
You combine strong analysis with synthesis abilities and are not afraid to deal with the details
You can write quality production code
You are comfortable dealing with clients
You can communicate clearly in English
French is mandatory at a fluent level

Job description :

The candidate will join the Data Tribe. He/She will closely work within the Data Governance and other legacy IT teams , to built the business object and stream it into kinesis at a first step, then at a second step to consume from the kinesis for different use case (like populate the data lake , the DWH or generate an action based on an event) . Today, we chose Python as programing language for data manipulation , but other languages may be used in the future like scala etc .

The mission will take place in a DevOps and agile organization. The main key responsibilities are:


Development of python algorithm (in lambda functions) to create the business object that will be streamed into kinesis.
Development of python algorithm to consume the business object from the kinesis and feed the datawarhouse or to trigger other processes
Challenge developments done by the developers, share experience and best practices .
Document, ensure maintainability of the code, run technical tests (NR tests, performance tests etc ..), peer code review
Participate and work closely with Business analyst and Data governance on Business objects definition and other business requirements
Act as an active member of EH python community, share knowledge and work an a collaborative environment


Profile :

Strong Knowledge in Python (4+ years experience) and other development language like scala

Strong experience on Data transformation ( worked on data projects and already manipulated data)

Confirmed k nowledge on AWS platform and usage of the basic AWS Data services ( Lambda, EC2, Kinesis, Kinesis analytics , spark , S3 etc ‚Ä¶)

Good knowledge of DevOps best practices & tooling (GITLAB CI, unit tests‚Ä¶)

Good knowledge of Agile methodology (Scrum)

Knowledge of Terraform

Knowledge on Data warehousing (Redshift, Snowflake‚Ä¶)

Knowledge on scripting Shell Unix/Linux

Background:

eu-LISA is the European Union Agency for the Operational Management of Large-Scale IT Systems in the Area of Freedom, Security and Justice (eu-LISA) manages large-scale IT systems to support the implementation of asylum, border management and migration policies in the European Union (EU). The Agency is also a front-runner for the digitalisation efforts of the EU's Justice and Home Affairs domain, building a new information architecture and contributing to the development of a new security ecosystem. Since the Agency's beginnings in 2012, eu-LISA has become the digital engine of the Schengen Area. With its activities and tasks, the Agency adds value to the EU Member States by supporting their efforts towards justice, security and freedom.

Job Description

Airbus Commercial Aircraft is looking for a Business Analysis Production Planning (f/m) to join our Operation department based in Toulouse, France.

You will be part of a team starting to transform our company, where our customers can benefit from our innovative products and services, where we are key to implement the digitalization in our company through important Digital transformation programmes and where we connect thousand of worldwide end users everyday, and all that in a protected and safe environment.

IM is everywhere in the business, from the design of an aircraft until its delivery with linked services to our customers and even more.

People development, engagement & wellbeing are at the heart of our thinking. Diversity is a must and our most precious treasure.

We are the life-blood of any organization or business and play a vital role each day in terms of technology and innovation in Airbus.

You will join the DO organization i.e. the IM teams for Operation. Our mission is to deliver innovative IT solutions that support their digital transformation and efficient operations to secure Aircraft Delivery.

Your Working Environment

Global capital of aeronautics and European capital for space research, Toulouse is a dynamic city in the southwest of France served by an international airport. Ideally located between the Mediterranean sea and the Atlantic ocean and close to the Pyrenees mountains, it offers plenty of options for outdoor activities!

How We Care For You


Financial rewards: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis.
Work / Life Balance: Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services.
Wellbeing / Health: Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application.
Individual development: Great upskilling opportunities and development prospects with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility.


At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

About The Company




Bloomfield is a plant imaging platform shaping the future of precision agriculture. We scan farms and vineyards at scale (capturing high resolution imagery and other sensor data), analyze every plant, and derive actionable intelligence to help growers be more efficient and productive. We collaborate with a variety of movement platform companies, from ATV and tractor manufacturers to robotics startups.




About The Role




The Field Operations Manager has a strong background in viticulture and vineyard operations, is mechanically inclined with farm equipment and is enthusiastic to work with new, emerging technologies on the cutting edge of precision agriculture. Day to day activities include oversight of our France customers, and working closely with the internal technology team to collect and process data, provide data analysis and insights and is the primary link between Bloomfield and the customer. This full-time position is a combination of hands-on work in the field, remote project management and customer support, and will support the rapid growth of an early stage company.




Location: France cities near Bordeaux, Montpellier or Toulouse




Responsibilities




Schedule customer visits and scanning operations
Participate in customer communication; conduct daily field staff and support customers
Educate the field staff, outside service providers, and customers about the process Bloomfield uses to collect and analyze data from the field to result in actionable information, and ensure that the process is followed
Use the Flash camera in the field properly, efficiently and with a thorough understanding of how it functions
Conduct initial block information gathering, organization, and entry of data
Execute block setup, including field marker installation and GPS coordinate gathering
Provide administrative support for the field operation staff and outside service providers
Provide backup support to other field operation employees in their absence
Schedule necessary travel to customer vineyards
Majority of travel is regional by car/truck
Balance competing priorities and ensure essential functions are completed in a timely manner and/or by assigned date
Engage with the Bloomfield team and customers to inform/discuss in the field learnings




Qualifications




Must be fluent in French and English
Located in France in a city near Bordeaux, Montpellier or Toulouse
Ability to travel to remote customers in France potentially up to 25% of the time
High school diploma or equivalent required, college degree preferred
Viticulturist experience preferred
General understanding of vineyard operations
Strong understanding of technology
Digital literacy including Google Office/Microsoft Office and various web applications as needed including Airtable, Slack and Atlassian Jira & Confluence
A valid driver‚Äôs license; ability to rent a car/truck
An ability to work independently in a remote capacity to facilitate accurate data collection activities
Excel at process improvement
Team oriented, strive for the team to achieve its goals and successes
Detail oriented and able to prioritize multiple tasks
Self-starter able to work independently with minimal direction
Available to work overtime as necessary
Proven time management skills




Physical Requirements




Lift and move at least 40 lbs
Work up to 8 hours a day and/or 5 days or longer a week during a good part of the growing season

Job_description:
About Us

GuestReady is a globally leading short-term rental management and hospitality company, providing great services to property owners, and amazing stays to guests. We are currently operating in the United Kingdom, France, Portugal, Spain and the United Arab Emirates, and we're growing fast. Launched in 2016, with over 3.3 million guest nights sold, generating over $170 million in Gross Booking Value and managing a portfolio worth over $1 billion, GuestReady is a company on the rise.

At GuestReady, our purpose is to revolutionise the short-term rental industry through innovative technology and a commitment to hospitality. We empower landlords to turn their investments into profitable sources of income by streamlining the rental process from start to finish. From creating listings across multiple platforms to managing guest communications, housekeeping, key exchange, and price optimisation, our team of experts handle every aspect of the rental experience, freeing landlords from the hassle and stress of property management. Our mission is to bring the tradition of hospitality to the short-term rental market and provide peace of mind for our valued clients.

ATC is a European logistics, white glove, and technical services specialist for data centres. Our focus is on anticipating the critical needs of our clients and delivering industry-leading standards for safety, security and reliability. Since being established in 1979, we have continued to lead our dedicated teams across Europe to build strong relationships with our clients.

Our mission is to deliver and install Europe‚Äôs data centres with precision and care. We achieve this by focusing on our team and our services:

Our Team‚ÄìPowered by people to keep data centres moving safely and securely.


We recognise that our greatest strength is our staff, which is why we promote a culture of personal development and professional training, both internally and from leading industry bodies.

Our Services‚ÄìWe provide a range of specialised services tailored to the individual needs and demands of each client, their equipment, and their data centre infrastructure.


From managing specialised computer transport, and IT relocation services, to logistics and planning, and data centre commissioning and decommissioning; we adapt our 40+ years of expertise to every situation.

ATC operates in a dynamic global market where clients demand a service that is right first time, every time; we are recruiting motivated and driven people to work in a company that is Driving Forward.

This Role

ATC‚Äôs Data Centre Installers(DCIs) provide an essential service to our clients across Europe. They work inside our clients‚Äô data centres delivering, positioning, and installing server racks to build their cloud infrastructure. Safety, security and customer service are the priorities for all ATC employees.

The DCI role provides candidates with opportunities to learn and develop. There are pathways to delivery supervisor, cabling technician, or team leader, and training and mentorship are provided. Candidates can also travel with work as part of ATC‚Äôs Mobilisation Team.

Role Requirements & Responsibilities

Attend clients‚Äô sites on time, with all required equipment, uniform, procedures and documentation, and PPE.
Unloading, unpacking with power tools and positioning customers‚Äô IT hardware(server racks).
Lifting up to 30-40 kg is required, with occasional exertion up to 50kg(using safe lifting methods).
Cabling server racks by patching and dressing fibre and copper cables(in certain regions, and training will be provided).
Providing industry-leading customer service levels by acting professionally with clients and colleagues at all times.
Following clients‚Äô procedures and requirements, including health and safety, and security.
Communicating with colleagues, including managers, planners, team leaders and supervisors, in a consistent, timely, and efficient manner. Reports include arrival times, delays, safety concerns, and completion times.
Completing daily checklists and providing reports on daily activities or tasks, including other general administration tasks.
Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time in line with your skills and competencies.


Requirements

The role requires flexibility and adaptability to changing situations and customer requirements, so the candidate must be comfortable working under pressure and on strict timelines. The candidate must be adaptable while performing tasks, ready to change priorities and maintain professional communications with clients, colleagues and vendors.

The successful candidate will be required to possess and demonstrate the following:

Strong organisational and problem-solving skills, with high levels of attention to detail.
Valid class B driving licence with a good driving record.
Basic experience with hand and power tools.
Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Teams and Email.
Language proficiency: B1 level in English and A2 level in the country of employment.


The following qualifications, skills and experience would be an advantage:

Prior experience in a data centre, logistics or construction environment.
Ability to be flexible and travel for work.
Ability to complete checklists in Excel(or Teams) based on daily activities.
Prior experience with the installation of structured cabling, including fibre and copper.


Benefits

The remunerating package, including salary and benefits, is negotiable depending on experience. The package may include the following:

Competitive market salary.
Performance-based bonus.
Opportunities for continuing professional development will also be provided.
Company pension plan(varies by region, subject to local employment laws).
Sports & social club.

About The Company




Bloomfield is a plant imaging platform shaping the future of precision agriculture. We scan farms and vineyards at scale (capturing high resolution imagery and other sensor data), analyze every plant, and derive actionable intelligence to help growers be more efficient and productive. We collaborate with a variety of movement platform companies, from ATV and tractor manufacturers to robotics startups.




About The Role




The Field Operations Manager has a strong background in viticulture and vineyard operations, is mechanically inclined with farm equipment and is enthusiastic to work with new, emerging technologies on the cutting edge of precision agriculture. Day to day activities include oversight of our France customers, and working closely with the internal technology team to collect and process data, provide data analysis and insights and is the primary link between Bloomfield and the customer. This full-time position is a combination of hands-on work in the field, remote project management and customer support, and will support the rapid growth of an early stage company.




Location: France cities near Bordeaux, Montpellier or Toulouse




Responsibilities




Schedule customer visits and scanning operations
Participate in customer communication; conduct daily field staff and support customers

About The Company




Bloomfield is a plant imaging platform shaping the future of precision agriculture. We scan farms and vineyards at scale (capturing high resolution imagery and other sensor data), analyze every plant, and derive actionable intelligence to help growers be more efficient and productive. We collaborate with a variety of movement platform companies, from ATV and tractor manufacturers to robotics startups.




About The Role




The Field Operations Manager has a strong background in viticulture and vineyard operations, is mechanically inclined with farm equipment and is enthusiastic to work with new, emerging technologies on the cutting edge of precision agriculture. Day to day activities include oversight of our France customers, and working closely with the internal technology team to collect and process data, provide data analysis and insights and is the primary link between Bloomfield and the customer. This full-time position is a combination of hands-on work in the field, remote project management and customer support, and will support the rapid growth of an early stage company.

Proven time management skills

Lift and move at least 40 lbs

Le Wagon




Le Wagon is a global leader in immersive tech training. Our mission is to train people from all backgrounds in coding, data and product skills, give them the best learning experience of their life, and help them accelerate in their career. We also help companies become more data-driven by leveraging their data and unlocking their employees‚Äô potential through corporate training.




Founded in Paris in 2013, Le Wagon now has campuses in +40 cities across 25 countries, including global tech hubs such as Berlin, London, Tokyo, Shanghai, Singapore, and S√£o Paulo. Most importantly, Le Wagon is a community of 18,000+ graduates from all walks of life, including career changers, digital nomads and many entrepreneurs - who've created 180+ tech startups and raised $862M+ and counting!




We are hiring an Associate Product Manager in Le Wagon's engineering team. The job is based in Paris (11e) for a 6-month internship.




The Engineering team üõ†




We are a team of 12 Web Developers based in Paris, Berlin, London, Munich.




Our mission is to build the right tools and features to support Le Wagon's consolidation and growth. We work in cycles and follow the Shape Up methodology.




Our senior engineers have a strong product culture and are involved in our product cycles, from shaping to release and adoption. The product team is made of the CTO, VP Engineering, Director of Engineering, Head of Data and Associate Product Manager. You will report to the VP Engineering.




What is the job about? üìê




As an Associate Product Manager, you will take an active role in the Product Roadmap, coordinating our cycles and owning User Research and Shaping steps.




What You Will Do
