Company Description




At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.




As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible.




Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.




Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.




Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care.




Job Description




Primary Function of Position




As Statistician/Data scientist of Clinical Affairs, this role is primary responsible for developing and executing data analysis frameworks for Clinical Affairs global evidence initiatives. The role will be responsible for leading statistical design of clinical studies and the analysis strategy in support of evidence generation and scientific publication efforts. This position will partner with key internal and external stakeholders to design, analyze, and interpret clinical studies in support of Intuitive‚Äôs clinical evidence development.




This role is also responsible for developing and executing artificial intelligence initiatives to promote clinical evidence generation around digital products. This role is also responsible to provide guidance to other team members, to support clinical studies and other scientific evidence generation requirements, apply best and current practice and meet guidelines and regulations.




This position will report to Clinical Affairs, Europe, Intuitive Surgical Headquarters, in Switzerland.




Roles And Responsibilities




Overall role responsibilities




Act as a key partner in statistical analysis and data science to develop evidence generation across surgical specialties and Intuitive technologies in close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Support for managing resource (internal and external) and budget related to statistical and data analysis to ensure study success
Provide support for team members to achieve high performance; effectively distills complexity and provides clear and actionable direction and information, help team prioritize, solve complex problems that enable the team to make significant progress
Ensure compliance with corporate (e.g., SOP‚Äôs) and regulatory requirements (e.g., GCP and MDR / MEDDEV, ISO14155) and responsible for ongoing review of departmental procedures and process improvement initiatives.




Statistician




Providing statistical guidance and expertise for clinical studies (pre-market and post market) across various Intuitive technologies, including study design, analysis, interpretation, clinical study reports and manuscript development.
Responsible for developing Statistical Analysis Plans, designing shells for tables, listings and figures; developing programming specifications for statistical analysis.
Providing statistical expertise for addressing regulatory authority questions related to statistical design and analysis for all pre-market clinical studies and post market studies/post-market clinical follow up studies which are overseen by regulatory authorities.
Represent the EU clinical affairs Biostatistics function within cross-functional teams, collaborate with other team members for the development of Clinical Investigational Plan, Clinical Study Report, Case Report Form and other key study documents.
Work closely with Data management to define CRF specifications, edit checks and critical variable lists, may participate to UAT of the eCRF, support data cleaning activities to ensure collection of high-quality data; handles database lock and unblinding process per study requirements
Supports the EU CA team working with study investigators and key opinion leaders to identify the publication needs; works closely with internal/external authors to develop manuscripts, abstract/presentation or poster, and provides statistical support throughout the publication process.
Support additional research projects to generate clinical evidence, such as data analysis of large clinical databases, meta-analysis, inputs on dashboards requiring statistical outcomes, etc.




Data scientist




Leads or participates in analytical studies to support the generation of evidence in EU, exploring and implementing novel tools for efficiencies and up to date methodologies such as machine learning methods
Use predictive modeling to help leverage insights from clinical data
Partner with digital teams to support and optimize the use of new digital tools within clinical studies
Mine and analyze existing datasets and search for qualified datasets to answer various needs related to Clinical Affairs activities
Stay abreast of latest industry and academic developments in Statistics, modeling and machine learning techniques and apply adapting methodology to solve unique or challenging study design and data analysis issues.




Qualifications




Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:




Advanced degree in Biostatistics or Statistics (Master or Ph. D) with sound knowledge of theoretical and applied statistics
A minimum of 3-5 years of clinical research biostats working experience in biotech industry (medical device company experience is preferred)
Working experience in developing machine learning models with clinical data/digital health applications is an advantage
Proven track record of success in designing clinical studies with various statistical methodologies
Experience of conducting statistical analysis to support the development of statistical analysis plan, clinical study report and publications, with strong scientific writing and editing skills
Proficient in R and SAS programming and/or a suitable statistical programming environment
Proficient in Python and/or R programming with commonly used data science libraries to build predictive machine learning models
Be clinically savvy and be able to bridge analytics to clinical interpretation and explain complex mathematical/statistical problems to team members and senior leadership
Knowledge of applicable medical device regulations and guidelines: MEDDEV, MDR, Good Clinical Practice, ISO-14155, GDPR
Excellent verbal/written communication, presentation, teamwork and interpersonal skills; capability to build strong cross-functional collaboration both internally and externally
High attention to detail and scientific integrity
Excellent organizational planning, project management and time management skills
Results-driven attitude and strong problem-solving skills, consistently shows dedication or strong work-ethic to help meet aggressive timelines or multiple projects when necessary; demonstrated ability to adapt and adjust to changing priorities and deal with uncertainty and risks
Must be able to travel up to 10%
English language required, a second European language (French / German) is an advantage
Experience of studies with health economic focus is an advantage
Experience of working with CROs or external consultants is an advantage
Experience for analysis of a large dataset (administrative or commercial data sets) is desirable




Additional Information




Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.




We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.




Shift: Day




Travel: None

Job Description

Kiln is the leading enterprise-grade staking platform, enabling institutional customers to stake assets, and to white-label staking functionality into their offering. We are looking for a Marketing Intern to work closely with our Head of Marketing and Marketing Manager.

Missions

Support marketing and communications strategy
Assist on day-to-day marketing and communication operations

Kiln is the leading enterprise-grade staking platform, enabling institutional customers to stake assets, and to whitelabel staking functionality into their offering. Our platform is API-first and enables fully automated validator, rewards, data, and commission management.

Kiln integrates with exchanges, custodians, wallets, and other fintech players to ensure that everyone can securely and seamlessly stake their assets and share in the value creation of the crypto markets.

The team is made up of ecosystem enthusiasts formerly at Google, Circle, Ledger, Chainalysis, Polygon, and other leading technology and cryptocurrency companies.

Join Kiln and help us make the web more secure, stable, decentralized, and fair.

Created in 2014, Excelya is a people-centered Contract Research Organization (CRO) that excels with care.

Fluent in English

Job Description




Keyrus Life Science is looking for a Value Evidence Analysts to join our consulting team for a client project based in Wavre.




Your missionwill be, to give support in the evidence generation activities for the development of the pneumococcal MAPS vaccines.




You generate health economic evidences and conduct of systematic literature reviews as well as support in evidence generation planning.




You will take a leading role in this evidence generation with external vendors. Meaning that you collaborate and coordinate with relevant stakeholders on global, regional and local operating countries (LOCs) level to facilitate evidence generation and planning including also project management.




Your challenges will be:




Collaborate with global Value Evidence and cross-functional teams, regional and local value evidence teams to plan and coordinate evidence generation activities
Conduct of value evidence activities including health economic modelling, systematic literature reviews and value evidence planning including quality control
Management or development of other supporting materials (Toolkits, Slidedecks, abstracts, publications etc
Project Management of value evidence activities (in collaboration with project managers):
Obtain internal approvals as per the GSK process
Project contracting
Reviewing interim results and reports
Reviewing final report and associated slide deck as needed;




Profile




Experienced Health Economists (about 3+ years experience),
Experience in health economics and systematic literature reviews,
Critical review of health economic publications
Ability to prioritize
Location of this mission is Belgium or Europe preferred (+/-1 hour CET time zone as possible)
Languages: English and French

En France, nous sommes une √©quipe de 1 000 passionn√©-e-s pr√©sents au sein de 5 villes (Paris, Lille, Nantes, Rennes et Toulouse) et nous avons pour ambition de continuer de grandir.

Nous avons donc h√¢te de rencontrer nos prochains Consultant BI H/F !

A quoi ressemblera ton quotidien ?

Tu seras int√©gr√©-e au sein d'une √©quipe projet BI, Big Data ou Data Gouvernance pour l'un de nos clients grands comptes du secteur tertiaire (banques, transports, secteur public, assurances, t√©l√©communications etc.). Plus pr√©cis√©ment, tu participeras :

Aux analyses fonctionnelles

Nos + :

‚Ä¢ En plus de ton quotidien, tu pourras entreprendre, √™tre form√©-e via notre catalogue de formation et certification

‚Ä¢ C√¥t√© r√©mun√©ration certes ton salaire mais aussi de la participation, de l'int√©ressement, un PERCO, une mutuelle, des TR, des cong√©s d'anciennet√©, un catalogue CE, un accord de t√©l√©travail et de parentalit√©

Tu te reconnais si :

De formation data, tu poss√®des une connaissance (acquise lors d‚Äôun projet d‚Äô√©tude, d‚Äôun stage ou d‚Äôune alternance) en BI ou sur un ETL:

Reporting BI : SAP BI (Hana, BW, BI 4), Microsoft BI (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS), IBM Cognos

COMMENT SE RENCONTRER ?

LES PLUS DU POSTE




En plus de votre quotidien, vous pourrez entreprendre, √™tre form√©, utiliser nos incubateurs pour innover, pitcher √† des conf√©rences en France ou ailleurs.

C√¥t√© r√©mun√©ration, votre salaire, mais aussi de la participation, de l'int√©ressement, un PERCO, une mutuelle, des tickets restaurants, des cong√©s suppl√©mentaires proportionnels √† votre anciennet√© (8J), un CE tr√®s dynamique, un accord de t√©l√©travail et de parentalit√© et des horaires modulables.




Rencontrons-nous !

Who are we?

Private equity investors have more than $6.5 trillion under management, which is being invested in the most innovative sectors and companies in the world. However, the majority of these investors still rely on tools such as Excel spreadsheets to manage their portfolios. Edda has been developed to provide the market with fit for purpose technology bringing efficiency, transparency and safety to the industry, from the earliest days of deal selecting through to portfolio management and exits.

Most tools in the market are built for big private equity companies and often use legacy technology. At Edda, we see that these tools need to adapt to a rapidly changing market. When you have different teams using different softwares working in conjunction, time is wasted through inefficiencies as the various technologies aren't compatible. This means there is an increased risk of losing data, there is a delay for retrieving information, communication becomes complicated and you lose sight of the bigger picture.

Edda removes inefficiencies within companies by allowing everyone to work on the same platform together. Edda is the first tool to unite all the aspects of investment, including dealflow, portfolio, LPs and network management into one product and automatically offers users up-to-date news and data, solving the problems that investors face daily.

Product UI/UX Designer at Edda

We're seeking a talented Product UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team in Paris. As a key member of our product team, you'll be responsible for delivering the best user experience on our software, ensuring customer satisfaction and loyalty. Your expertise in UI/UX design and strong skills in graphic design, typography, and intuitive layouts will be invaluable in developing intuitive, usable, and engaging interactions and visual designs. You'll report to the Head of Design and collaborate closely with our Senior Product Designer, who will mentor and guide you.

Here's what you'll be responsible for:

Quickly and efficiently understanding product objectives
Communicate your ideas and decisions clearly and concisely to stakeholders, Developers and members of your team during all the stages of the data analysis and interpretation process.
Usiing a Design System to ensure consistency across features
Continuously delivering design iterations to improve user experience
Participating in design team ceremonies, such as design critiques and retrospectives
Embracing design as an iterative process and being willing to release designs that are not yet perfect to gather feedback from users and improve upon them
Conducting ongoing user research, including interviews, user testing, and product data analysis


You may be a fit for this role if you have:

4 to 8 years of experience in UI/UX design
Strong research skills and ability to reach out to customers
Strong communication skills, both written and spoken in English, with the ability to adapt to diverse audiences.
Entrepreneurial spirit and enjoys problem-solving
Detail-oriented with strong ability to recognize and predict use-cases and user interaction
Experience with design and prototyping software, including Figma
Strong graphic design skills with good understanding of typography and intuitive layouts
Stays up to date with latest design standards, changes, and trends
Team player with strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
Able to deliver impeccable visual designs with high attention to detail
Experience in finance is a plus
Hands-on approach, able to achieve features and follow the product roadmap
Already familiar with research-based design processes and open to changing features as necessary


What we offer:

Opportunities for personal and professional growth
A dynamic and innovative work environment
A unique international team based in Paris
The flexibility of working remotely for 2 days a week and up to 2 weeks a year from a location of your choice.


Recruitment process

Initial interview with Shameerah, our Talent Acquisition Manager.
Technical skills case study presentation to Josselin, our Head of Design, and Claudia, our Senior UX IX Designer.
Personal meeting with our CEO at our Paris office to experience our company culture firsthand.


At Edda, we're looking for people with passion, ambition, humility and curiosity. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. We valued skills and passion as much as experience. If you think you can have an impact in our company and you're not afraid to tackle challenges, we need you!

Company Description




Syngenta Seeds is one of the world‚Äôs largest developers and producers of seed for farmers, commercial growers, retailers and small seed companies. Syngenta seeds improve the quality and yields of crops. High-quality seeds ensure better and more productive crops, which is why farmers invest in them. Advanced seeds help mitigate risks such as disease and drought and allow farmers to grow food using less land, less water and fewer inputs. Syngenta Seeds brings farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions. Syngenta Seeds is headquartered in the United States.




Job Description




As part of our activities in EAME, we are looking for a Melon Breeder (M/F)




Role purpose




The Melon Breeder contributes to the development of inbred lines and hybrid varieties of Charentais and Italo American melon that meet the performance targets set by the EAME and Americas market segment teams with input from the Breeding Trial Specialists (BTS) and the Cucurbits business unit.




You will participate in nursery and hybrid testing related activities and take the ownership of areas in the breeding program. You will focus on implementing strategies that aid in the development of commercially successful lines and hybrids and to ensure that all activities act to enhance genetic gain and the long-term success of the breeding program




The position is offered on a permanent contract, ideally based in our Toulouse Innovation Center, France, Saint Sauveur (31).




This position requires business trips in Europe (up to 30% for field visits and workshops), and occasionally Worldwide.




Start date : as soon as possible.




Sites not accessible by public transport.




Accountabilities




Maintain and develop a product development portfolio in line with market segment requests and business planning, addressing short-, medium-, and long-term market segment needs.
Develop awareness of market needs for commercial products throughout EAME and Americas market segments areas. Interactions with Breeding Trial specialists and product Development Specialist colleagues to anticipate product performance gaps and contribute to a research plan to address these gaps.
Pro-actively learn to understand changing market needs and provide information to Sales/Commercial team to assist them with their decision-making processes.
Develop expertise in crop biology, germplasm and critical trait priorities.
Collaborate with Trait Development Leads and Genetic scientists to identify and develop marker-trait associations, innovative traits, germplasm management: Participate actively to discovery projects.
Develop and deploy new breeding technologies and methods. Implement data driven decision in every part of the breeding program.
Using analytic and data science tools, predictive models for product selection and genomic selection.
Prepare nurseries and yield trial experiments: Design current and future resource plans with key stake holders.
Provide meaningful input on hybrid advancement decisions. Work with market segment teams to ensure appropriate selection criteria and target product profiles are being applied.
Responsible for a quantitative assessment of pipeline performance in alignment with market needs: Generate reports/tables/charts to highlight to other functions and management how product performance is measured over time or in comparison to check hybrids in a current growing season.
Communicate effectively and regularly with peers and supervisors regarding status of projects and work activities, raise awareness of issues that could affect meeting project objectives and business goals.
Perform all tasks in a manner compliant with and in support of all safety and stewardship related company policies and practices, including completing all required training courses.




Qualifications




Ph.D. with 2 years of experience in plant breeding preferred in either a commercial or academic Plant Breeding setting.
Strong experience working with molecular marker-based studies applied to breeding, such as marker-assisted selection, genome-wide phenotype-to-genotype association, and genomic selection.
Successful quantitative genetics and genomic selection implementation in breeding programs.
Basic coding skills in R and/or Python with some experience in visualization tools/applications Rshiny, Tableau
Project management experience in a team-oriented atmosphere; ability to develop and adhere to a budget.
Experience in operating independently in a complex matrix environment.
Well-developed private and academic scientific network.
Fluent in English and French mandatory. Spanish will be valued.




Additional Information




Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Job_description:
Shipup is a 50+ people company that envisions a world where brands keep their promises along the entire customer journey.




That's why we enable brands to take control over the most volatile part of the customer experience ‚Äîthe post-purchase‚Äî so they increase brand loyalty and save support costs




Our company culture & values




‚úä Ownership




Taking ownership means feeling completely responsible for our goals ‚Äî and this is something all of Shipup adheres to! We believe that every single one of us needs to feel accountable for the results of our work. This creates a state of complete trust in each other.




üí° Initiative




Our teams‚Äô are founded on pushing each other to take initiative. Today, we constantly take action without being told what to do and come up with solutions to problems!




üë®‚Äçüë¶ Empowerment




We truly want all of our employees to succeed. Thus, we provide everything and anything they need to thrive! We also encourage everyone to take action and more importantly, we support them if they make mistakes.




üß∏ Caring




One of Shipup's priorities is to impose a culture of care on a daily basis. We not only care about our co-workers, but we deeply care for our customers and the customers of our customers! Our whole product is based on how much a company cares for its clients, and we love it!




üèãÔ∏è‚Äç Ambition




Our team always sees the bigger picture! We have a strong desire and determination to succeed




Job Description




Context




Our People Director, based in Europe, will be one of the company's main strategic profiles by representing the people department (office, HR, and hiring).




Your main mission will be to maintain a great place to work (very proud of our 5-stars Glassdoor profile) & a motivated team, committed to Shipup‚Äôs ambitious vision.




Our company is currently facing two main strategic challenges: a recent acquisition by GlobalBlue and our new flexible remote policy. That's where you come in.




Company culture: we defined our core values when we were only 15 employees, now that we are almost 60, they need to be redefined and reinforced.
Talent development and retention: our average seniority is increasing, as are our employees‚Äô expectations, so we want to make our employees‚Äô value propositions evolve.
Talent acquisition: as we are defining new business objectives, we‚Äôll need to define and manage a new ambitious hiring roadmap to answer business needs.
Internationalization: we already opened our US office and we redefined our remote policy, so we‚Äôre hiring more and more international talents.




Our current team members




You‚Äôll structure the entire department. For now, here are the profiles you‚Äôll manage:




Ang√©lique & Quentin: 2 Talent Acquisition Managers (Business & Tech/Product)
Oph√©lie, our HR Manager
Claire, our Office Manager




As a People Director @Shipup, you will have an impact on:




The Whole Company




Business partnering




Participate in the development of Shipup‚Äôs strategy.
Challenge Shipup‚Äôs department organizational structure considering our recent internationalization.
Support our department leaders in building a strong talent development and retention strategy by overseeing career development, promotion, training, and leadership development.
Collaborate with the Finance team and managers to regularly review the structure of our overall compensation and benefits strategy (including bonus programs, benchmarking, and annual review strategy).




Culture




Act as the guardian of our core values.
Preserve our strong culture across countries and offices.
Foster a growth-oriented and motivating culture.




Talent Acquisition




Help improve our hiring process (+20 open positions for 2023).
Empower managers on hiring topics.
Build a strong employer brand.

Pharmacokineticist I




Fortrea‚Äôs Clinical Operations team is recruiting for a Pharmacokineticist. You will join a global team and have the opportunity to work across a number of compounds across Phase I studies. In a versatile opportunity, you will work closely with a variety of different Sponsors, being responsible of Pharmacokinetic deliverables across a number of projects.




We are looking for a Pharmacokineticist / Clinical Pharmacologist who will be involved in reviewing study designs, providing input to Statistical Analysis Plans, performing/reviewing PK/PD data analyses and providing accurate interpretation of data. You will also contribute to project management activities and have the opportunity to assist with proposal activities.




As a leading global contract research organization (CRO) with a passion for scientific rigor and decades of clinical development experience, Fortrea provides pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device customers a wide range of clinical development, patient access and technology solutions across more than 20 therapeutic areas. With over 19,000 staff conducting operations in more than 90 countries, Fortrea is transforming drug and device development for partners and patients across the globe.




Did you know?




Labcorp's Clinical Development and Commercialization Services business is now Fortrea in connection with its planned spin-off from Labcorp, which is expected in mid-2023. Fortrea‚Äôs spin-off from Labcorp is subject to satisfaction of certain customary conditions. This spin-off will position both organizations for accelerated growth and allow each to focus resources on distinct strategic priorities, customer and employee needs and value creation opportunities. As a provider of phase I-IV clinical trial management, regulatory guidance, patient access solutions and market access consulting, Fortrea will partner with both emerging and large pharmaceutical, biotechnology, device and diagnostic companies to drive healthcare innovation and improve the lives of patients worldwide.




Fortrea is looking for problem-solvers and creative thinkers who are passionate about breaking down barriers faced by sponsors of clinical trials, and who are committed to helping transform the development process to get promising life-changing ideas and therapies to patients faster. Join us as we cultivate a workspace where all employees have the opportunity to grow and make impacts on a global scale. For more information and questions related to Fortrea, please visit www.fortrea.com .




Duties Will Include




Provide PK(PD) guidance and consultancy in development of clinical research program and in design of individual studies as part of multi-disciplinary team.
Fulfill the role of a study Pharmacokineticist:
Responsible for PK(/PD) deliverables within assigned projects.
Review draft protocols for allocated studies to ensure they meet the Sponsors requirements in terms of PK(/PD) analysis and study objectives.
Responsible for development of PK(/PD) Analysis Plans, to include methodology, definition of derived variables, and data-handling rules.
Conduct or review/QC interim PK(/PD) analyses, interpret the data, and attend dose escalation teleconferences to support dose progression in allocated studies.
Conduct or review/QC non-compartmental PK and PD analyses as specified in the report and analysis plans.
Conduct modeling/simulation of PK, PD, and PK/PD data and provide interpretation of the results.
Responsible for PK(/PD) input to reports including Clinical Study Reports.
Independent peer review of PK and PD deliverables (e.g., protocols, Analysis Plans, PK reports, Clinical Study Reports).
Carry out all activities according to appropriate Labcorp SOPs, working within the framework of the Quality Management System and to GCP.
Contribute to review and amendment of departmental processes and supporting documentation. Provide PK input into other disciplines‚Äô activities and participate in interdepartmental processes.
Project management activities for identified projects including financial, resource planning and utilization, timelines, and milestone management.
Represent Pharmacokinetics in internal and external audits.
Supervision and training of less-experienced Pharmacokineticists within project activities.
Contribute to proposal activities and client presentations.
Provide PK(/PD) guidance and consultancy in development of clinical research program and in design of individual studies as part of multi-disciplinary team.




Ideally You Will Have The Following Experience/skills




Postgraduate experience in the application of PK and PD to clinical trials, ideally within a CRO.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Bioanalytical Chemistry or a Biological Life Science field.
Proficient in compartmental/non-compartmental data analysis.
Proficient in PK/PD analysis tools WinNonLin and NONMEM.
Effective interpersonal and communication skills
Cooperative, team-oriented and proactive.
Ability to work in tight deadlines while maintaining high quality standards.
Good knowledge of Clinical Development.
Competence in the preparation of Pharmacokinetic Analysis Plans, reporting, etc., across a variety of trials.
Ability to explain PK and PD concepts to non-pharmacokineticists
An evident appreciation of the possible impact of day-to-day activities and actions on company as a business.

Role - Data Scientist

Skillsets - Technical stack : Azure, Databricks, Python

OS : Windows




Location - Paris, Warsaw, Poland




Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Analytics Architect to join our team and help

secure our Analytics team's activities. This person will work alongside our current contractor

to provide architectural guidance and support for the team's data engineering and BI

development work.

Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Work closely with the Analytics team to understand their needs and requirements

‚Ä¢ Design and oversee the implementation of the Analytics team's solutions, ensuring

that they are scalable, efficient, and effective

‚Ä¢ Work with stakeholders across the company to ensure that the solutions are aligned

with the company's overall strategy and goals

‚Ä¢ Provide architectural guidance and support to the Analytics team

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain data pipelines and data models

‚Ä¢ Develop queries and tools to extract insights from the data

‚Ä¢ Work closely with the current contractor to manage the Analytics team's activities

and ensure that they are delivering value to the company

Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field

‚Ä¢ Minimum of 5 years of experience in data engineering and architecture

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of data modeling, ETL, and database design

‚Ä¢ Experience working with Azure, particularly with Azure Data Factory, Azure Data

Lake, and Azure SQL Database

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in SQL and at least one programming language (Python, Java, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and collaboration skills

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and in a team environment




About IGT:

IGT Solutions (IGT) is committed to simplify complex customer interactions while delivering a seamless experience. It provides integrated BPM, Technology and Digital Services & Solutions for clients across industries. Established in 1998, with 100% focus on customer experience, we are a Technology, Data & Digital services & BPM company committed to deliver innovation and business excellence for our 75+ marquee customers across the global technology sector. We have a global delivery footprint, spread across 19 centres in 11 countries, with 13,500 CX and Technology experts from 30+ nationalities. IGT is part of the Apollo group of companies (Apollo is a leading global alternative investment manager with approximately $414Bn under management)

IGT's Data & Digital team collaborates closely with our customer‚Äôs business & technology teams to take solutions faster to market while sustaining quality while focusing on business value and improving overall end-Customer Experience

Our service offerings include providing consulting / advisory & delivery services to our customers to improve synergies between business & technology by enabling latest, best practice delivery and collaboration mechanisms. These include lifecycle transformation & rapid development / technology delivery services leveraging latest technology stack across the enterprise where our services include: Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Hyper-Automation, Software Engineering, Quality Engineering (Testing), Architectural Transformations, Platform services including Cloud Computing / Transformation, Systems Integration as well as IT Operations service management deliver innovative & cutting-edge solution using best practices & expertise on Agile, DevOps, Lean as well as traditional methodologies.

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

About us




At MOBILIZE PAY, we‚Äôre on a mission to empower our customers to move and live more sustainably, one payment at a time. We bring together EV charging, payments, and sustainability ‚Äì making it easier to lead a more mindful lifestyle. We‚Äôre growing fast and looking for like-minded entrepreneurs to come build a better future with us! üöÄ




Our team




We're an autonomous, ambitious, and impact-driven start-up team based out of Paris, with the confidence of Mobilize Financial Services. Bringing the best of both worlds together. üí•

We‚Äôre a collaborative and diverse team of go-getters, entrepreneurs, developers, designers, and many more. In the coming months, we're speeding ahead with building our new product, onboarding the best partners, and launching in new markets.

Mobilize Financial Services is Renault Group's global banking group, helping 4.7 million customers across the world finance their car in 2021 alone.




The role




Our company is seeking an accountant to join our financial team.




As a member of the team, you will:

üí™ Handle our new in-house accounting system
üíª Manage all financial transactions, from fixed payments and variable expenses to bank deposits and budgets
üñá Compile, analyze, and report financial data
üìä Creating periodic reports, such as balance sheets, profit & loss statements, etc.
üì† Ensure compliance with financial policies and regulations
üìÇ Compute taxes and prepare tax returns
üíº Assist management in the decision-making process by preparing budgets and financial forecasts




In this role, you will report to the Chief Accountant of Mobilize Pay, and will based in central Paris. We fully support flexible working, but love to collaborate in real life a few days a week to get the most out of the experience.




This role is for you if you:

Have a degree in finance or accounting
Have experience in a fintech or working on a project from the ground up
Have strong knowledge of IFRS and French banking and regulatory framework
Bonus: have knowledge of financial products (leasing, credit...)
Are comfortable operating at all levels ‚Äì presenting at board presentations to rolling up your sleeves to get things done, even if they are outside your core area of expertise
Strategic thinker, able to recommend solutions that balances business and financial perspectives




Typically, people with 4+ years of post-qualification experience in accountings have developed the tactical skills to be successful in this role. But we believe experience is not the best predictor of future performance and that people learn fast ‚Äì so if all this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to meet you! üëã
